I have favored the Lumix due to the Leica lens and simplicity of the camera operation.  All the Lumix have lasted for quite some time with no failures and only upgraded for new features.  My daughter borrowed my Lumix to take some photos on a trip and liked it better than the Kodak she had that she liked for so many years.  She asked me to get a Lumix for her like the one I had, This ZS20 model was less than the price for one like I had so we decided to purchase it.  We are amazed at the quality of the photos and the camera in general, it seems to work better than mine and I really do like the one I have.  For a pocket camera that can do it all even some portraits, you can't beat this camera and the price is simply great. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the best point and shoot available for people who care about imagery
Reviews.Author: James D. Strawn "Problem Finder"
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth one of these I have bought since late 2010. The first one (ZS7) I upgraded for better (720p) video. That one (ZS8) I dropped in the ocean and destroyed it (all my fault). The third one (ZS10) served me well for 2 years until finally started having some mechanical problems and stopped zooming to closing down the lens cap.Now I have the ZS20, which has a little better video and imaging technology than the ZS10. They also move the mic over away from the end where your finger ends up inadvertently covering up much of the time when shooting video. It's a great little camera which takes surprisingly good pics and vid and is really easy to use. I recommend it for casual and semi-serious photographers that don't want to get bogged down with bulky/unintuitive equipment but still care about a bigger lens and ultimately better image quality than you'll get from a phone or other non-camera devices. I also recommend it to pro's who just need something really handy to get that quick shot in with nearly the quality that there high-end stuff will get. It's also good for artists shooting reference/compositional photography who need high quality imagery with plenty of detail but don't care about super high print res and imaging quality. About the only people I don't recommend it to is people who are attached to their phones and don;t mind the realtively poor quality that even the best phone cameras provide today. (hint if the lens is tiny, it does't matter how good the glass or the chip is, you'll always take a huge quality hit especially in lower lighting situations)

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: C J Campbell "Waddling Eagle"
Reviews.Content: Let me put it this way: it was a gift for my rather non-technical wife. Unlike with most such technical gifts, she has not had to come back to me to ask me how to use it. That, for me, speaks louder than any other endorsement that I could make.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: DebT
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera that would be easy to use and take great pictures.  Well this one fit the bill!  My first shots where at a wedding,  after looking back on the pictures they so clean and clear.  When I showed them to the bride she asked for the digital copies.  They were great.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF DUST!!! - Otherwise, a wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that we absolutely love our Lumix DMC-ZS20.  (We have been faithful devotees to the Lumix brand for a very long time.)  Others have done a fine job detailing the various features that set this camera apart from its competitors, so I won't rehash all that in this review.However, those making a decision to purchase should be aware that dust (getting inside the camera and settling on the lens and sensor) has been an issue in these Panasonic Lumix cameras.  It has been for many years and many models.  This results in images with spots on them which are usually more visible when fully zoomed in.  Despite this, I continue to buy the Lumix line because they have the best overall feature set available, in my opinion (besides the dust issue).Note that we take extremely good care of our cameras, always store them in their cases, constantly brush and blow off any dust particles we see on the camera's body, etc.  The problem is with the zoom lens.  Tiny dust particles are sucked into the lens when it expands open (which is any time the camera is turned on or zoomed).  Panasonic acknowledges the issue and will clean the camera for free within the warranty period (1 year).  After that, if you experience the issue, you'll either need to upgrade your camera, endure the dust, or pay to have it repaired.My previous Lumix (DMC-ZS3 I believe) was actually easy enough to open that I could clean it myself (with guidance from Youtube videos).  However, they are using tiny new star-type screws inside the camera (securing the sensor) which I can now no longer access (not having the proper tools).(On a related note, two of my brothers-in-law purchased the same camera as I did - on my recommendation - and neither has had dust appear on the lens. So, this seems to be an isolated issue. Just know that it is a possibility.)Anyway, for now, we Lumix owners must simply take great care to keep dust, sand, and dirt particles off the body of our cameras (and hope that none find their way inside our camera lens).  I guess this impending issue causes us to appreciate each dust-free day a little more, knowing that it could be our last.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Hernandez
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I sold a Lumix camera that I wish I never had. I have a great Nikon DSLR camera that I use for my pro shots but I needed something that I can stick in my pocket for those times when I don't want to lug around a big camera. This camera is where it is at! The zoom on it is what mostly sold me. It is amazing how far you can zoom with it and still get the quality in the photo. The auto focus works very well and quickly. I am a big fan of doing panoramic photos and to my surprise this camera has that feature! I also love that fact that I can plug it to both the wall and my usb port on my computer to charge it up. I am so amazed of the versatility of this camera and what it can do. For such a great price for this great camera, you just can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: TSW
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter and she has used it a lot what I've seen is great pictures and very versital

Reviews.Title: Better than my more expensive camera
Reviews.Author: BrainMD
Reviews.Content: Last year I purchased an Olympus SP-800UZ which is a great camera but I found myself not using it as much as I wanted because it was just too bulky to pack around in my bag with me. Looking for a camera which I could tuck inside my purse more easily led me to try out this Lumix. Wow. I am so impressed with the quality of pictures that I have gotten. I have to admit that this camera is taking clearer more stunning pictures that my Olympus. It's quite easy to learn with a little learning curve to understand where all the options are located but it didn't take long for this to become my most favorite. I absolutely love how fast this little guy is. I hated waiting for my other camera to cycle over and catch my next shot. With this camera I can shoot many pictures in quick succession. I took it with me on a recent sailboat cruise and the built in stabilizer worked fabulous for capturing distance zoom shots on the rocking boat. For the amount of features and quality pictures this sweet camera gives you I would have expected to pay at least double the price. I do advise purchasing a second battery for it. I did and keep my second battery charged and tucked into my camera case so I always have a back up. I also advise that you bring the camera with you to find a case. It is a tight fit for some of the cases on the market as it is just a tad bit larger than some of the other point and shoot cameras available. Even so, it's still small enough that you won't have trouble carrying it in your pocket or purse everywhere you go. You will find yourself becoming a shutter-geek quickly with this fun camera.

Reviews.Title: Finally - A great, affordable camera!
Reviews.Author: Camera "Collector"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take great nature shots on a trip I'll be taking soon to New England.  I had the opportunity to test it out recently at a professional sporting event and am so pleased with this purchase!  I shot many images zoomed in all the way in and every single one of the photos were crisp and colorful.  It fires faster than I am used to, so I needed a little practice, but took no blurry photos.  Yay!  I was planning on bringing a mono-pod on my trip but have scrapped that idea.  I don't think I'll need it.Love the size as it fits into a small cross-body handbag and isn't too weighty.I have tried about a dozen digital cameras in just about every brand since they first came out, so I have lots of experience with cameras in the $100-$1000 range (they were REALLY expensive at first).  My budget for this purchase was under $250 and I feel I got the best bang for my buck.P.S.  I do my research before buying anything on line.  Interestingly enough,  I needed a small camera to keep in my desk drawer at work and I wound up getting a Lumix as well, which is also a nice camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jeffery
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in a week with free shipping. The manual, is skimpy, and you will need to use pdf file print out on computer, for the full manual,  to view the operation and functions of this camera.The pictures/video with  up to 20x optical zoom are of good quality for the price of this pocket camera. The automatic camera settings work nice, and the flash gives nice pictures in 18 foot rooms, with low light. The camera has an easy scene mode to pick up to 18 scenes, and utilize this feature for video and pictures with/without zoom. So even a novice in photography, will have no trouble shooting multiple scenes, with some of the more common settings, and get very good results.

Reviews.Title: Is my new camera used?
Reviews.Author: irina
Reviews.Content: I have a question to new Lumix DMS-ZS20 owners. I've received my new camera few days ago and it doesn't have a sticker indicating main features as on this photo: [...]. Original packaging contains everything it suppose to but seems to be opened. Does it mean I've got used camera or floor model?

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! So far, so good! Tried all the features. GPS can be tricky.
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo17EOPA792IYFBcurrentClick) { return cv_mo17EOPA792IYFBcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:21 MinsAfter using this camera for a month, I've upped the rating from 4 to 5 stars. The pixel quality may not be the best, but man is this full featured!! In camera HDR, pseudo-tilt shift, almost everything you can think off, this camera does. The zoom is amazing, and the features never seem to end. For example, baby mode - you record the birthday of up to two kids. When you switch to baby mode (1 or 2) it automatically adds the age of the child to the EXIF data!I needed a quality camera for my Urban exploration, when I am not able to carry a DSLR. Low light, manual, GPS and video were on my list. This camera has that and more. Today I had it on a decently challenging outing. One battery lasted for 500 photos, many of which used the flash. That impressed me.Low light, automatic: Without the flash, these tend to blurry - slow exposure time. Going manual corrected this.Manual mode: Limited options, but nice on a camera in this price range. The screen shows an accurate preview.Panoramic: Not great. The stitching is not perfect, they are often blurry, and very low resolution.Video: Really, really good, better than my GoPro Hero2. It tends to lose focus in differing light conditions. The sample was shot in bright light (obviously) on a recent abandoned building exploration. The sound quality is amazing.GPS: This can be a pain. There's an online feature that assists the camera in geocoding for the first time. If you don't turn this off afterwards, the camera keeps using this setting. So my first time out a few miles from home, it was off by that distance. Turned off that setting, and GPS worked great.Mic positioning - I found that I kept covering it with my fingers when holding the camera - odd placement. Same for the flash. Had to retrain myself and nor wrap my fingers around the camera.The photos are pretty darn good, and I'm pleasantly surprised with the quality. I've uploaded some samples.It's a good camera, probably perfect for the point and shoot user. I have it as a backup to my DSLR, and to that it does not measure up. But it's probably as close as you can get in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Easiest five stars I have ever given out
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best point & shoot I have owned. If focuses quickly and accurately no matter what the zoom is set to. Manual controls are easy to use (but auto almost always gets me a great pic anyhow). You can control ISO, aperture and shutter speed manually. You can also do burst at 10fps. It takes awesome 1080p/60fps video and focuses very quickly on the fly.The zoom on this is just plain awesome, especially for a camera this size. It opens up pictures that simply wouldn't be possibly with regular (non mega-zoom) point & shoots. After using the 20x optical zoom for a week I'll never go back to 3x/4x optical zoom ranges.Maybe pics have a bit of noise when blown up to 100%, but for regular prints and screen sizes pics look very sharp.Bottom line is that I am getting pics you'd normally need a DSLR with massive lens to get using a pocket sized camera. To me it's a great middle ground between power, convenience and ease of use. Definite 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Beverly5534
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a lot of use yet with this camera, but what I have done is great. I love the zoom! My ohOtos are clear and sharp. I carry it in my purse or pocket. Since I had the previous version of this camera I find it very easy to use.  Bought the red one so I feel special when everyone else as boring black cameras.

Reviews.Title: Wish had copy of manual came with Lumix.
Reviews.Author: Frenchie
Reviews.Content: Ittakesgoodphotos, clear and sharp.  Easy to handle, nice size.This is my second Lumix.  Will learn to use the GPS function this summer.  I wish camera came with a hard copy Manual instead of having to go to download it from the Internet.  I am not always near a computer and it is inconvenient not to have the manual not available at all times .

Reviews.Title: Good until it fails
Reviews.Author: James Duke
Reviews.Content: I have owned two Panasonic Lumix cameras.  The first one developed black spots on the screen.  After returning for repair for the same problem three times, and more than 5 total hours on hold and talking with worthless customer service representatives, they finally replaced it.  All work was under warranty, but each time I was without a camera for a month.  The replacement camera was a different model Lumix.  It failed within a year.  This time it was an auto focus issue on zoom.  I was advised that the replacement camera only had a 90 day warranty.  I purchased the lumix primarily because of the zoom lens.  DO NOT PURCHASE OR YOU WILL BE SORRY!

Reviews.Title: Problematic Camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce MacDermott
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, when it works.  Mine has been in for service twice in the first year.  The lens sticks and fails to properly open during start-up.  The lens cover blades also fail to properly open/close.  I purchased a second one while the first was in the shop for over 3 months.  That one is now giving me error messages when I use the full zoom function, requiring that I turn the camera off then on again.  Not ready for prime time, is my estimation.  Wish I had purchased the Canon, but it might have the same issues.  Hard to say.  I purchased it for the 20X zoom.  Worked great for about 6 months.  The backup camera started having problems almost immediately with the lens cover.

Reviews.Title: Extremely poor warranty service...worst ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Bail
Reviews.Content: I have the ZS19. I loved the camera, took great pictures, etc until the shutter failed to open. I sent it in for warranty coverage and found out that "Panacare" is a big, black hole. They have had the camera over a month with no communication except a delayed response to me plaintive emails. I've tried calling and either the line is busy or I'm on hold for over 35 minutes with no end in sight. Today I managed to get to  a feature where you can leave a message and they'll call you back. However, when I selected that option their mailbox was full!!!!!! While I love the camera, I will never buy again from Panasonic as their customer service is simply nonexistent!

Reviews.Title: Major downgrade
Reviews.Author: DC27
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April as an upgrade to DC-ZS3, which worked fantastic for me for the last couple years. DC-ZS3 produced fairly good pictures for a compact camera, but I thought I could use all the new bells and whistles that came with DC-ZS20 such as better zoom, panoramic shots etc. In June, I took DC-ZS20 on a month-long trip to Europe, where I snapped about 3.5K pictures with it. When I got back home and started looking at the pictures on a large screen, I realized about 3K of those were just awful (and I don't mean my picture-taking skills).The major problem seems to be an over-zealous noise reduction program in the camera, which is particularly bad in low light. But even the shots taken in a well-lit environment and/or with the flash were smothered too. I had many group pictures taken from 10-15 feet and in most of those one couldn't even make facial features of people in the shot.Panoramic shots were also a disappointment, because the photos would only come out with the fixed height of 864 pixels as opposed to 3K one would gets in the normal shot. In addition, the camera locks into iA mode and does not allow any adjustments to the settings. All in all, the "upgrade" turned out to be a major downgrade. I had a few pictures taken in the same places where I had shots taken by DC-ZS3 couple years back and the difference between the two was stunning (not in favor of DC-ZS20).To add insult to injury, the camera just quit on me two days before the end of my trip. The LCD screen would come up and show all the overlays, but the picture itself was black and so were all the shots I tried to take. I had to send it to Panasonic Service center for repairs upon return - still not sure what the problem was.The bottom line - stay with older models or look at other options

Reviews.Title: Very good traveling camera
Reviews.Author: W. Daitchman
Reviews.Content: So the Lumix ZS20 - currently the latest from Panasonic in this category of point and shoot, has a lot of pluses:* It's very small - easily fits in a shirt pocket.* It's fast - set on burst for 5 or 10 rapid photos in a fraction of a second.* Amazing range: from 25mm wide angle to a lens magnification of 20x and a digitally extended magnification of 40x. Photograph a rocky outcropping across a canyon with very good detail.* Color rendition is very good.* Shoot stills or video (HD) at will: not necessary to change modes for video.* Telephoto is available during video shoot.You can read about other features like GPS and photo effects at any of the better camera review sites: dpreview, cameralabs, etc..The main downside is image quality which can show digital artifacts, especially at telephoto. If you're used to SLR quality, then understand there is a trade off for the Panasonic's convenience and reasonable cost. That said, it truly is a good travel camera. And non-techies will find it easy enough to use too!

Reviews.Title: Was AWESOME until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: J. Worm
Reviews.Content: I've had two Panasonic Lumix cameras.  I had the first for three years and never had a problem with it.  I eventually upgraded to the ZS20 for more zoom and GPS capabilities.  Until recently, I was 100% satisfied with my camera.  One day after I had the camera for a year and a half, the shutter decided not to open.  There was no obvious event that caused this.  After 30 minutes of fiddling with it, the shutter opened fine.  Over the past six months this issue has become more frequent, and takes longer to recover.  I've read online of MANY people experiencing the same problem.  Yesterday, once more, the shutter would not open.  It's been almost 24 hours and it appears that it will not ever be opening again.  No matter how great the photo quality has been, a $300 camera that stops working after just over a year is not cost effective.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Geecheeboy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my existing 5 year old compact digital. I specifically bought it to take on a Mediterranean cruise. While others were lugging around their digital SLR behemoths, the ZS20 comfortably fit it my pants pocket. I researched all type of cameras and once I settled on a compact digital, I decided to buy the newest, most feature laden compact digital I could find. I was not dissapointed in my selection of the ZS20. The picture quality is excellent and it is loaded with features. From one menu, you can pick settings for panorama, sunset, portrait, landscape, food shots and about a dozen more. However, left in its fully automatic mode, the picture quality is excellent. For the more advanced user, you can set aperture, shutter speed and a few other manual modes. It also has some neat picture modes - black & white, Sepia, one that gives you pictures a 1960's look, and one that makes your pic look like you are photographing toys. Filming video (1080 HD) is as easy as pressing one button. The 20X optical zoom is fantastic. You can double that with the digital zoom, but the 20X is unbelievable. You can shoot burst up to 10fps. There is a high speed video function that slows down fast action video (cool!).I was very impressed with the ease of learning so many of the features of this camera. It is very easy to use. This is a great camera if you are looking for a feature laden compact digital.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: yifingirl
Reviews.Content: I really couldn't be happier with this camera. I got it for Christmas 2013 and waited to review it until I had a chance to use it quite a bit, and I'm very glad I did.  When I first got it, I wasn't sure the pictures (especially close-ups) were as clear as I had hoped, but since I've figured out the best settings for close-ups, I'm very thankful and happy with the way they're turning out!  I've taken hundreds of pictures with it, and people comment on how good these pictures are!  I'm so glad I purchased this camera!  The zoom is excellent for the price and size of this camera. Distant pictures can be zoomed in with great clarity!  I've been very satisfied with the battery life as well!

Reviews.Title: Fun to use; takes great shots
Reviews.Author: E. Max
Reviews.Content: After struggling with an earlier version of this camera that had developed frequent but intermittent problems, I purchased the ZS20 and just the fact that it is working reliably is a pleasure.  I took pictures at my daughter's college graduation last week.  I was far away from the stage, but captured the peak pictures of her getting her diploma using maximal telephoto and ISO 1600 to minimize camera shake on a monopod.  I also love the burst photo feature allowing me to choose the best of similar shots in difficult situations.

Reviews.Title: so far only one problem or me
Reviews.Author: M. DiOrio "mpdio"
Reviews.Content: i just got this today and have been shooting around the house. one glaring error for me about this camera is thee placement of the flash. it is rigght next to the hand grip. i found myself gripping the camera and covering at least part of the flash with a finger or 2. you can see the darkness in the LCD review.i like the camera,i like the weight and size of it. I also have an LX7 which i love and was looking for something a little less bulky when i had the electronic viewfinder on it to carry in my shoulder bag. I've tried about 8 LUMIX cameras in the last month and this one seems like a keeper. but like I said I've had it for less than a day. one more thing. Hey Panasonic how about standardizing battery sizes. everyone i've tried has a different battery size

Reviews.Title: great in low light
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: wish the wifi feature worked with Mac/Ipadlove the ability to create your own "pre-set" functions - was great for adjusting in low light situations - white balance, shutter & aperture all done in 1 clickstill learning all of the advanced features

Reviews.Title: Started off great but it does not last
Reviews.Author: Basenjis Rule
Reviews.Content: I bought this after reading the great reviews.  At first, I was impressed but then 9 months later I had the first problem.  The lens cover was not fully opening.  Ruined most photos from a vacation grip.  I returned it for warranty service.  The service was terrible.  I had to wait more than a month to have the camera back.  (This after I called and wrote to complain.)  Now six months later, on another great vacation of a lifetime, the camera did the same thing and got even worse.  Same problem.  When I contacted Panasonic I was told I am SOL because it is out of warranty.  Almost $300 I paid and wasted on this camera.  I did not use this camera everyday and it failed twice and gave me terrible pictures.  So guess what... goodbye Panasonic and hello to a real camera maker such as Canon.

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera I've ever used.
Reviews.Author: Carla Kelly
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and takes fabulous pictures.  Have only had it for a couple of weeks but it's already my go-to camera.  I always have it with me and have already almost abandoned my good SLRs.  The videos are top quality, the burst rate is far better than my other cameras and it's as solid as a tank.  Battery life is acceptable and the extra batteries charge rather quickly compared to others I have.  Low light pics are incredible.  I have the ZS19 (without GPS) . Bought it refurbished for under $100 and feel like it's the best deal I've made in a very long time.  Maybe I'll find something I don't like about it, but that could take a while.  Kudos Panasonic for making a camera for all times.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price -- wicked zoom
Reviews.Author: David R. Tarrant "DDT8"
Reviews.Content: I had a previous model of this Panasonic Lumix camera and love it (I still use it after owning it for ~7 years).I bought this model for my wife.  It's a bit bigger than the earlier version but the size is well worth it.  I'm amazed at how good the zoom is on this compact camera.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of similar point and shoot price cameras I bought this camera.  I liked this size combined with the 20x zoom.  Using the auto setting I have taken many action shots of my grandson's baseball games,  I couldn't be more pleased with the results  I have received many compliments on these photos.  The camera is very easy o use also.

Reviews.Title: The best P&S; I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: LELCW
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the photos that I get with this camera. I am by no means a photographer, so my opinion is that of the average P&S; user. With that in mind, I think this camera is wonderful. It's small but not so tiny that I feel like I can't grip it. I love the handhold on the front and the wrist strap. It's quick, it's got a wide angle, it takes great action shots (in good light), and the zoom is fantastic. For me, this camera is the perfect travel companion and all-rounder.(I highly recommend the MegaGear case for it, too.)

Reviews.Title: my favorite travel camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou
Reviews.Content: It's my third Lumix with a wonderful zoom...so easy to use. I have taken them on extensive trips overseas, and these cameras are very dependable, uncomplicated, while accomplishing clear, fabulous pictures. Love the Panasonic Lumix!!! I take additional memory cards and charged batteries when I'm going to be out for a whole day. I've had several digital cameras. This is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: amazing little camera.
Reviews.Author: B. Burch
Reviews.Content: this camera is amazing. i'm a point and shoot kind of person and it has yet to take what i consider to be a bad picture. battery seems to last forever.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: Desert Denizen "desertkrone"
Reviews.Content: I just used it on a trip back home for the first time. Basics are really easy to understand and use. I took pictures of my sister coaching her soccer team from across the field in the bleachers. Turned out great. Pictures cropped and enlarged nicely. Great wide shots also.

Reviews.Title: Allways With You Camera
Reviews.Author: Flipper "Phil"
Reviews.Content: If you want a small camera that you will carry with you all the time, and require more than a smart phone, this is it.  The main reason I bought this camera is the Leica lens.  This very small, very light, high quality lens, long telephoto zoom was the perfect fit for me.  Much better than a good smart phone camera, and much smaller, and in some ways as good as a SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Julie Hausmann
Reviews.Content: sweet camera, small and easy to store but really packs a bunch of options. great pictures, crisp and clean. recommend.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: John S. Mclachlan
Reviews.Content: There are lots of other great extensive reviews on here.  I'll keep it brief and say I've had this camera almost since it came out and have been a happy camper.  Great photos.  Great video.  the 20x zoom is amazing.  I pretty much take this camera everywhere I go now so it's always at the ready.A great buy, and would buy it again if I had to replace it.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: JWeeds
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it much so far, but very good pictures and easy to use.  Hopefully, it will last longer than the earlier model of Lumix that got dust inside on the lens.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised
Reviews.Author: larry smith
Reviews.Content: met my expectations and more.  good camera for the money. does everything I wanted and more. I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: panasonic zs20
Reviews.Author: frank c. wilson III
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Perfect for point and shoot. Took over 500 photos in vegas Feb 19-23, 2014. Beautiful panoramic photos of hoover dam, lake mead, red rock canyons!!!!

Reviews.Title: What a great camera from a Nikon 7000 usae.
Reviews.Author: Edward D Hays "edh"
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice camera from a died in the wool Nikon user. Needed a little back up camera and this really fills the bill. You can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the quality and size of the camera
Reviews.Author: South-40
Reviews.Content: Took a trip to Australia and took thousands of pictures.  Had to get additional cards and batteries to keep up with my photographic adventure.  Glad I had this compact, high quality camera.  Others have been impressed on the quality of the pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: pete's dragon "good sound lover"
Reviews.Content: So much value added in 20x optical zoom with small dimensions. This camera along with superlative video is a keeper.Amazon price is unbeatable so far.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Carl Redford
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a reliable point and shoot camera This should be the last stop.The picture quality is extremely clear.The camera is lightweight and easy to carry.The full hd video is a bonus and night photography super.Overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Nettie
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I am still learning to use all the features - but still simple as a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Arturo
Reviews.Content: We're up for a trip to NYC and a Cruise from Miami, our camera was a very bad performing Canon that I bought a year ago, this time I needed a reliable one that can take great pictures but also a simple one that anyone helping to take a picture of us, could do. After reading several reviews, I decided for this amazing Lumix, I'm not technical so for me it was very simple, I put the automatic mode, point and shoot, same instructions for everyone in our trip. The result, the best vacations photos ever, outstanding resolution, zero shutter lag, so easy to use and very reliable, we took pictures in the snow, on movement, on the beach, at night, low light conditions, very sunny, and all, all of the pictures was just perfect!  Even take a quick video of snow falling in NYC, and it was equally great. I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Elwin W. Hannock, III
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect blend of quality, size, zoom lens, etc. We have not been disappointed.  It is easy to use, small but not so small that it is difficult to hold.

Reviews.Title: A great caamera
Reviews.Author: ritanderson
Reviews.Content: Has everything I wanted  and a lot more.  I have recommended to all of my family to buy a Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Great video
Reviews.Author: NYC
Reviews.Content: Takes very good pictures...but it takes great video, especially for such a small camera. It is a bit fragile though as the mechanism can get stuck or no longer open at all. This replaces one that had this issue. Fingers crossed. ;)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: John Q Public
Reviews.Content: This was bought this as a gift. They were thrilled with it. It takes pictures very fast and has a nice set of features. Optical zoom is better than digital any day. Panasonic camera's are rock solid.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Value, Excellent Service !
Reviews.Author: BERNAL J. ANDRADE
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  It actually has more features than I will ever use, but does a great job with the one's that I do use.For anyone who does not require the features of an SLR, this camera will perform well, at a great price.  I am extremely satisfied with the camera's performance and with Amazon's expedient services.  Hope others can take advantage of this superb value.

Reviews.Title: My 3rd Lumix
Reviews.Author: DBoh2
Reviews.Content: This is one excellent "all around camera." Great 20X zoom and it worked well on our Antarctic cruise. When you think about the temperature differential between Antarctica and Buenos Aires (our in-between stop) this camera functioned in temperatures of 0 to 100 degrees F with no problems. One excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera even for a pro like me.
Reviews.Author: Peter Daprix "A Reader"
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with this little camera. I am a pro but cannot carry a full sized DLSR around with me and its assortment of lenses when I am just going about life. And now with the weight and bulk restrictions on airlines, it minimizes that problem too. But as a professional, it has features like the panorama feature that I am using professionally as well as the HDR multiple exposure still feature that gets a better range of exposures all into one finished shot. The Leica lens is superb. Two levels of JPEG is also an excellent feature. But also as a pro I would not have bought this camera if I could not turn off all the gadgets that are installed for amateurs to do their thinking for them like the flash on camera that is about as unflattering a light for photographing people, the GPS, and a rafter of other annoying features like the date and time stamp on every photos. You can always find that information in most photo processing applications since it is recorded but hidden from view. It has video recording but the software that smooths out jerkeyness or hand held camera motion tends to result in making its own jerky transitions so I am sticking with my great little Canon video cigar tube camera for that.It even has a nice tripod screw thread on the bottom for the use of a tripod or mono-pod in low light conditions or high end "selfies". After reading a review of the latest lower end model, the reviewer said that for about the same price, you could still buy the last version of the high end model and I did. Good choice even if I don't like the brushed metal setting changer on the top that is very hard to read as it catches the light and makes reading the different setting difficult. But that is offset by each setting being displayed and described on the back viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality and easy to use point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Bahama Joe
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera expert and needed to get an easy to use camera prior to a trip to Antarctica. I chose the Panasonic Lumix zs-20 as I didn't need the WIFI capability of the zs -30. This camera performed very well in a difficult environment. PQ was excellent and consistently good in variable light conditions. I just left it on auto focus and the camera did the rest. There was little learning curve required with this camera . The set up directions are a breeze and after using it just 3 days prior to the trip I knew how everything important worked.  This camera is very pettite and fits in the palm of your hand. I was worried that I would not be able to handle it easily in a zodiac with thick gloves. I solved that problem by wearing a thin inner silk glove and I was able to use the camera with ease though I did need to use both hands for stability. You do have to be careful not to press the red video button when using the  zoom lever but I quickly got used to it. Picture quality and stability did deteriorate somewhat when using the zoom to the max on overcast days. But otherwise it worked just fine. My wife took a DSLR camera with very expensive lenses and yet my little Panasonic was flexible enough to capture some great shots in comparison. I did not have a problem with battery life on this camera but that may be because I turned off the GPS and did not use the blu ray resolution video options which are battery vampires.  Always a good idea to carry around a spare battery if you plan to use these options to a great extent. In reviewing my photos I found the review and delete buttons to the lower right of the view finder very useful. It was very easy to select the "keepers" after every day of shooting. I can't say enough about my positive experience with this camera and would not hesitate in recommending it to any amateur photographer looking for a reliable point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Berglund
Reviews.Content: Love it! Works great takes super pictures and very easy to use. I'd suggest this camera for anyone, even my mother.

Reviews.Title: Lumix zs20
Reviews.Author: cheryl davis
Reviews.Content: Best pictures ,zoom is great you feel like your so close.I would recommend to anyone to wants great pictures without all the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable Price through Amazon for this Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Somers
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a new digital camera for a while.  My son recommended this Panasonic.  I did my research on prices and availability.  The next closest price was $50.00 more than Amazon.  I also had an offer from American Express and got an additional $25.00 credit.  So this is an excellent camera at a very reasonable price.  I also ordered the SD card, battery charger, 2 spare batteries and a compact carrying bag.I'm still learning the camera, but so far the pictures and video are excellent.  There's a CD in the package that has detailed instructions.  I saved the PDF to my computer and can review the instructions with the camera in front of me.  There's also a user guide included, but it's very brief.The only negative I could find is the button for taking pictures is very sensitive, so you might end up with pictures of your feet or the floor.  These are easily deleted and I'm sure I will get used to the camera and won't have the issue.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: usdoc1ga
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment purchase for  a wedding. It takes great pics even in low lights. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sandy Hammargren
Reviews.Content: purchased as a Christmas present - takes great pictures, very clear and sharp.  Nice looking and easy to use.  May get one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Loved it!
Reviews.Author: Stalone
Reviews.Content: I gave it to my son as a gift he loves it and all the things it does. Thanks Much

Reviews.Title: A must-have for travelers!
Reviews.Author: Art Emperor
Reviews.Content: It's compact yet has a powerful zoom. Love the wide angle 24mm lens. Easy to use. A simple and sophisticated point and shoot camera. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: great point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: non-professional photographer
Reviews.Content: great camera, and it fits in your shirt pocket.  All my Lumixes have been great, and this was no exception

Reviews.Title: Last year's model takes excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: G. McGowan
Reviews.Content: Very good pictures and a great user interface.  Panasonic continues to make the auto focus and auto program (shutter and aperture) better with each generation of camera.  Want to set your own shutter speed and lens opening? Easy, just select another mode.  The ease of a point-and-shoot with the power to experiment.Even the menu system makes sense (unlike cameras from some other manufacturers).  Small, fits in your pocket, takes very good pictures even in low light.  The zoom is amazing too.

Reviews.Title: My second purchase of the same GREAT camera
Reviews.Author: W. Raffel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this same camera 2 years ago and it has been used a lot. I have taken over 15,000 photos and I love the image quality. I also use it to shoot short videos and they are very high quality. I recently passed the camera down to one of the children, so it was time to shop again. After extensive research, I purchased the same camera again. The camera's results do not lie, this is a great camera!Updated: 12-21-2013: I just got off the phone with Amazon Customer Service. I purchased the camera at the beginning of November; in fact I just used it on my last vacation. Well, the price on the camera has gone down about $72.00. Since I had purchased the camera during the "Amazon Holiday Season," it had a return policy and price guarantee until the end of January. The customer service rep told me the price guarantee would cover this situation and issued a refund for the difference.NOW, that is SERVICE! I am blown away...and a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: I'm happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Brian AZ
Reviews.Content: I read lots of review sites before buying this camera for my vacation to Thailand. I wanted the following features:1. USB charging.  All my electronics charge off USB, and I've invested in battery packs and solar chargers. I wanted to charge the cameras battery off these other purchases and not have to carry around a special charger.2. Pocket size with a large optical zoom. @ 20x this camera delivers.3. 1080P video recording.  I read that the ZS25 does not have this feature, making the older ZS20 more desirable.The biggest negative so far is the non-stardard USB port requiring me to bring along a special USB cord to charge the camera. Everything should be microUSB in my opinion, so this is slightly annoying.

Reviews.Title: sleek & takes great shots
Reviews.Author: mama b
Reviews.Content: I am no expert, but I have 6 kids and they move fast!  This camera gets great photos of them.  I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: So glad I bought this
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: I have a more expensive camera but would often miss great shots because 2 and 3 years olds do not sit still at any time. I must admit that I had begun to lose faith in my abiltiy to take shots after all these years.  I read many reviews on Amazon and checked out THE consumer magazine and this had great ratings.  So glad I bought it. My daughter-in-law was very pleased with the birthday party shots and my other shots have turned out so well.  She could not get over how GOOD they were. You will love this camera! It is light, easy to pack around, and the images are terrific.  Best of all you do not have to take a photography class to operated it. Now that is a deal.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a lost ZS7.This unit's GPS is a vast improvement, it picks up the signal inside and extremely fast.The rest of the camera is just as good as my old unit, meaning quite capable.Both pics and video are as good as I need. Haven't tried low light filming.The video button has been moved from the back to the top. This is better for me, as without a viewfinder, you need to view the pic, adjust, then press the button. When beginning a video,  don't start with the camera at eye level. Now I don't have to tilt the camera forward to see just what button to press.I currently use automatic settings, but with the plethora of adjustments, it should be of use for those that use their own settings.A Canon unit was such a bad experience, I returned it and got this. In all fairness, the Canon unit was ~ half the price.It is a tad heavy, but I appreciate a well built and durable unit.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic compact
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: Having owned the DMC TZ7 model I was keen to get my hands on this unit. the features are a great improvement on my previous model. Especially the image stabilization for such a high optical zoom and the quality of the image file saved. I hardly use the automatic settings and prefer manual control and this was another reason to chose the camera. it has both aperture and shutter priority modes for complete control. As with virtually all compact digitals shooting in low light is a not that impressive with too much "grain" coming through, this is where film would beat it hands down an why i didn't give it 5 stars. try to fine the Panasonic belt flip top camera pouch. With all compacts you run the risk of dust being ingested into the lenses structure if you keep the camera in a pocket or moving around in a bag. The proprietary case would have been good to have been included with the model, as it is I bought it separately.

Reviews.Title: Poor Macintosh support
Reviews.Author: H. Chorpenning
Reviews.Content: Like other Lumix cameras I've owned, I'm very pleased with my new DMC-zs20, but Panasonic does an ABYSMAL job of supporting Mac users. There is no in-depth owner's manual with the camera. (It's supposedly a PDF on the DVD-ROM included with the camera, which wouldn't even read in my MacBook Pro.) After frustration on the internet and with Panasonic's website, I found the instructions online here: [...]The other point of confusion is loading the GPS Assist software, which is hard to know how to do without the DVD-ROM or the advanced Owner's Manual.It doesn't take a customer support whiz to figure out how to mount easy-to-find support documents that are available in the Windows and Mac world, let alone for Android and iOS users. Panasonic tech support: you can do better!Great camera, though! Excellent lens clarity and nice aperture preference or shutter-speed preference (very handy if you want shallow depth-of-field or photograph moving subjects).

Reviews.Title: 1-year review
Reviews.Author: eric heis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.Push the button and it takes a picture.  Instant.  No delay.  Still does this after owning for a year.Though these cameras were supposed to be replaced by camera phones and high end photography gear as it became cheaper, you still cannot get a better point and shoot for the price.The settings are easy and perfect for an average user like myself.  From taking it to work functions, kickball games, or Caribbean sunsets, it does everything I ask it to with minimal clicks of the dial.

Reviews.Title: Customer no service
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Peacock
Reviews.Content: Received this as a gift and fell in love with all this camera has to offer. Two months later the screen went black. Sent in for repairs and was told it had been dropped and was not covered by warranty. I had no memory of any time dropping my camera. Ask for pictures of the damage to be emailed (twice), never received. Ask to speak to a supervisor, he was unavailable that day ( but did tell the rep on the phone that I could have 20% discount on repair). I called several days and he was alway unable to talk or not in the office. (To be fair, he did leave a message one morning while I was at work, but he never called again). The repair cost was only $20 less than buying a new camera. I had it sent back without being repaired. I have owned 3 other digital cameras that were much sturdier.  Very disappointed the fragility of this camera and the customer service. In hind-site I would have taken pictures of the camera before I sent it for repairs, live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui, HI with great pictures from Maui and Molokai including many action shots from a whale watching adventure in a smallish boat where many of the whales were larger than our boat.  The camera adjusted to the changing background lights as we passed from bright sunshine into dark clouds.  The camera is easy to use and almost user proof.  One caution before you go out on an adventure make sure you charge the camera's battery fully and have a bakup battery on hand.

Reviews.Title: I dropped this at the beach and it got sand in it.....
Reviews.Author: Mommy
Reviews.Content: I thought it was dead for sure.  It shut down and just closed.  We were very sad!!!  Then the next morning before heading off to Busch Gardens we tried it again.  Sure enough it came back from the dead and worked like a charm.  This thing is great!

Reviews.Title: You are buying a Leica without the name.
Reviews.Author: Coinguy
Reviews.Content: I own a Leica 14mp model of this at a cost of over $600.It simply is amazing. I ordered this one to have a less expensive model for travel and was surprised to find it is the same camera. The same body, the same lens, the same batery and charger.Aside from the screen boot up not saying Leica and a adobe software package a Leica has, it is the same camera.I ended up getting a spare in the box as I think this camera will hold it's value where most drop like bricks. As you can see Leica and the L logo is all over this camera. Remove Panasonic and if you don't need the adobe sofware you just saved $400+Hope this helps you.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: John Geiler
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth digital camera we've purchased in the last 10 years and it is by far the best of the 4.  The pictures are sharp and exposure is quick and simple.  Camera feels good in your hand and controls are straight forward.  Looking forward to trying it on the motorcycle trips we take.Can't find any faults yet.  3 different people grabbed the camera on Thanksgiving and took excellent pictures without ever using this model before.I would recommend this camera to beginners and not-so-beginners.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS20- GREAT PICS -GREAT ZOOM!!
Reviews.Author: Stanzalady
Reviews.Content: I had the Lumix ZS1 I think it was called before this one.  The reason I don't totally remember the name is because I gave it to my sister after buy this camera and she loves it.  It was a great camera and still had a lot of life in it but I just wanted more.  I can take over 100 pictures a day, I have been known to take over 3000 during a special event.  I live up in the mountains by a lake, with deer and all kinds of wild life and a lake I can see from my deck.  My camera needs to be small to be carried in my purse and/or pockets.  I need it to work on the spot and have the best zoom ever.  Well saying all that, my Lumix ZS20 does all that, the zoom is outrageous for such a small camera.  I took a picture of the moon like it was at arm link and we all know how far the moon is away from us.  I could see ever crater on it.  I placed that picture on Facebook and no one could believe I took it with a pocket camera.  This camera takes picture like a high power, expensive camera.  The GPS is nice too, but I think it helps eat up the battery.  I did not like the battery that came with this camera or the charger so I bought me a 2 battery charger deal at a cheap price out here in Amazon and it works great and I bought a 16gb card.  I have not missed a sunrise/set  or deer picture yet.  And it take great grandbaby pics too.  It is a very easy camera to use and has professional settings for all you who like to set your own cameras to work how you want them to work.  Great buy.  Great camera.

Reviews.Title: One Month and I agree with Other 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: Photosbypullum
Reviews.Content: I have used a Panasonic TZ3 for 7 years and passing on to my daughter. Seven years has brought a lot of changes in this the TZ series; ZS20 is TZ30 in Europe. Astounding!! Such versatility. Such Quality. Top ranked: see Snapsort.com for comparisons to others you may be consider. I like the touch screen follow focus. GPS, great for trips to foreign countries. Right away added a 30/37mm modified stepup ring for filters. Takes IR at 650nm may work at 720nm. Using the night photo setting gives great results with IR, reduces noise.I have a small belt pack that contains the aluminum ID/CreditCard holder, contains this camera, and my Cell phone. 4.5 tall, 3.5  wide and deep. Truly compact. My only complaint is that Panasonic did not include cell phone capabilities, (joking, or am I), of course, no raw, no threads for 37mm filters, but competition does not have these either so that is reality.While photos are not equal to DSLR ..problem is the DSLR and lenses are not with you all the time. My ZS20 is on my belt and ready for that "Of The Moment" photo. The photo you take with the ZS20 is so vastly superior to photos the DSLR did not take because it was at home on the shelf. Some reviews say photos are a little soft, OK, if so, then I can tweak that in post. I personally have no complaints, only praises for this camera. I read many reviews and did a lot of side by side comparisons in Snapsort. I knew before I bought and confirmed my choice during the last month.

Reviews.Title: Overrated!
Reviews.Author: Emil E. Lopez "elopezuvm05"
Reviews.Content: Not at the level of similarly priced cameras. I returned this camera as the colors were muted, and the skin textures appeared pasty. Other then the high zoom there's nothing special about it. Also, the lens cover is easily damaged. We got a replacement after 4 week because the cover was getting stuck (it has a multi-layered lens cover that seems fragile).Decided to pay a little extra and get the Canon s100. Much better!

Reviews.Title: Paradise lost
Reviews.Author: Navigator "444"
Reviews.Content: Received camera bought for first ever trip to Hawaii.  Arrived on 11/8 Oahu.  Took pictures all day during visit to Arizona memorial - worked great, exceptional battery life and decent results for an amateur.  However, as of 11/10 there is a black flake of something on the inside that appears in every photo!  Tragic really.  Trip will cost about 6000$ and our camera cannot take photos because of this defect.  Never seen anything like this.  Normally wouldn't Mind, but this is a giant trip for us.  Very disappointed in this product.  Two stars because it does take nice photos prior to this.  I've owned cheaper cameras for Years and none ever failed like this.  I would like to exchange the camera and try it again, but obviously will not be able to accomplish this while on trip - I don't have the original package with me!  Dang...

Reviews.Title: Received Lemon/Poor Customer Service From Panasonic
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: Camera worked well for about 2 weeks. battery life stinks thoughNow camera fails to work after first photo.  must keep turning camera on and off to take a photo.Panasonic has been stringing me along and now has finally agreed to let me return the camera for service.  I must package and pay for shipping.  At least a 3 week turnaround.  So the camera we purchased for vacation won't be traveling with us.  Sigh

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever! Until next year, of course...
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: As someone who uses a camera rarely, by the time I need one again (for things that can't be handled by my cell phone) I'll have lost the charger, the camera, the cable, or the battery's flatlined and can't be revived short of a defibrillator and CPR - and have you ever tried mouth to mouth on a battery?  I don't recommend trying it twice.So I've bought about 8 cameras over the last 15 years - and each one has been a major step up in capacity and utility for the price. The price point stays the same, but MP count and features stack like crazy. So let's get started...The good -Low light - I'm significantly impressed.  Shots that would have taken flash before come out reasonably clear without it.  The Intelligent Auto mode picks up what you want to do pretty well.  The Night Mode Scene selection give you a number of options - though I could wish that the max exposure time would be a bit more than 15 seconds.  (The ZS10 model will do up to 60, but I found that the pictures were a bit muddy, and for an extra $10-20 more the ZS20 is much more capable. A year makes quite a difference!)Macro Mode -  Ridiculously close, decently sharp.  Have fun, but I don't recommend getting a good shot of your earbuds, unless you REALLY want to see what you're sticking in your ears.  Flower buds are one thing, earbuds another.  Also very good for reading fine print in contracts, SD card markings (Did you know that the speed rating is marked by a C with a number inside?  C10 is fastest, but on the micro-SC cards I use that marking looks like a little blob.) and more.  I'm pleased with the sharpness of the pictures overall.Regular shots - I'm pleased with the sharpness of the pictures again. The panorama setting is VERY nice, the high-contrast scene setting works quite well even in lower light settings.  Fiddle a bit with it, and see what you can do.Video - Lots of options.  LOTS of options.  Want to take a video at 220 frames per second?  This will do it, though at a pretty small frame size.  (QVGA)  I look forward to about two years from now where it'll be 220 fps at 14MP...Zoom shots -  The optical zoom is excellent - my favorite test (at least for this camera) is to find a small item about 40-50 feet away, then zoom in on it and see what level of detail I can get.  I'm checking a fire sprinkler head, about 4 inches in size.  It's reasonably clear, to the point where I can see the lettering on it, but not quite able to read them.  Adding in the IA zoom, and it's larger - but not quite so clear.  That's to be expected, since it's interpolating between the pixels it has to make it out to a simulated 40x.  Good enough, for a pocket camera.  (BTW, the ZS10 didn't do nearly so well.)On that matter, I've noticed that there's some 'fuzz' when I take a 14 MP image and examine it very closely.  After a while, I realized it was the result of a 14 MP image being taken down to the pixel level.  A 2 or 4MP shot will have a fairly defined delineation between two pixels on an edge, for instance.  With a 14MP shot, you'll have four or five or six pixels where there were two before so it gets a bit trickier trying to find an edge.  This might lead you to think the shot is fuzzy - and in a sense it is because you're getting a lot more info than you're used to, the camera can show you more detail.This might be a problem for some users.  It's not for me.  In a way, it's reminiscent of the graininess of photographic film - the lower the speed, the finer the grain.  I'll have to fiddle a bit with it to see whether the 100 speed or 3200 speed settings have more grain in a particular situation.Now... the bad.I like manuals for cameras, since they'll detail out what the various settings are and how to use them.  The basic user's manual with this doesn't cut it beyond very basic functions.  Fortunately, an Advanced User's Manual is available from Panasonic, [...] - which details what each setting does.  And at a cost of 'FREE' for the download, it's a very worthwhile addition.  I'd have liked a more comprehensive manual in paper - but at least I can find it on the internet.Included graphics editing software - it's slow.  But it works.  But it's slow - and not terribly simple.  Wizards will attempt to do everything for you - where I'd prefer to get by without them.  Maybe it'll grow on me, or maybe I'll just get a copy of Photoshop Elements or use GIMP.  Time will tell.The 3D function...  Yay for being able to take photos in 3D!  Boo for needing a 3D enabled TV to display them on.  I don't know I'll use this particular function - but it's interesting that it's there.Battery life...  I don't like internal charging. I really prefer an external - but there's a good number of external options.  Just check the "Customers also bought this" section, you'll spot them.  I purchased one from TheMemeStore, the charger works fine and the batteries are fully compatible.  So that's a solution.  I think it'd be better to keep the external charger - but that's just me.Firmware updates - the current firmware version shipping is 1.0 - but Panasonic's got a version 1.1 which upgrades the low-light capabilities of the camera.  And at the cost of 'Free', I'd advise getting it.  It's not a tough install.To sum up - this is a very capable camera, at an affordable price.  The controls are easy to use, the various settings not quite so much but you can puzzle them out after a fashion.  You might not find the pictures to your liking - but I think they're as sharp as any film camera's ever come up with and then some.  It's not a flawless camera - but it's pretty darn good and (with any luck) it'll last me a year w/no problems...

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I have five point and shoot cameras and this is by far my favorite camera. It takes AWESOME pictures. I LOVE IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, great camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron See
Reviews.Content: Love the combination of great features from previous models in tight package with good price. I love the GPS and HD video. It is so easy to operate and the pictures turn out great. The zoom is amazing for such a small package. My previous camera was a Panasonic with Leica lens and GPS which I bought for $450 years ago. Dust in the lens rendered it unworthy of special moments so I bought this new model days before my trip to Argentina. Very happy to capture the sites with this Lumix.Recharging port is nice new addition, plus I can still use my backup battery for long adventures in the wild. Small enough for jeans pockets makes it very versatile.I tend to turn on/off A LOT when sightseeing. In those cases lens goes in and out. Wonder if there's a better way I can manage battery while out and about. Like turning screen off in a low power mode while keeping lens extended for a minute or so? Just curious, as its my one thought on improvement of my experience using this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Bad Charger
Reviews.Author: Alex Frances
Reviews.Content: Just got my Panasonic Lumix ZS20 a month ago. I love the camera. It is easy to use and I am getting great pictures. One thing I dislike is having to charge the battery inside the camera so I bought me a travel charger: STK's Panasonic DMW-BCG10PP Battery Charger - for Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7, DMC-ZS6, DMC-ZS10, DMC-ZS5, DMC-ZS3, DMC-ZS8, DMC-ZS1, DMC-ZR3, DMC-ZR1, DMC-TZ10, DMC-TZ7, DMC-TZ20, DMW BCG10, DMC-TZ8, DMC-ZX3, DMC-TZ6, DMC-ZX1, DMC-TZ18, DMW-BCG10E, DMC-TZ19. Also got an extra battery: STK Panasonic DMW BCG10PP Battery - 1200mAh for Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: ZS 20
Reviews.Author: Arnie
Reviews.Content: I love this point and shoot camera, It's very similar to the water proof TS3 so it was very easy to use right out of the box.The pictures are a lot better than the TS3 and the zoom is fantastic for a point ans shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: David L. Beaman
Reviews.Content: Best pocket camera out thereZoom, image stability, and shutter and ISO control are unbelievable for a simple digital camera that fits in a pocket

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Amos Demian Ostos Chaya
Reviews.Content: I just used it to a "business" trip and I took around 3 thousand great pictures. Its zoom is the most appealing feature because even though is 20X optical zoom it is also very portable... I would suggest this product to anybody who asks me, specially for those who wants to travel light and obtain great pictures... the only con I see so far is the battery life... if you are going to have a full day taking pictures you have to have a spare battery fully charged because the battery it uses is not AA so it means you have to plug it to an outlet to re-charge... it is the only con I see but for me is not a deal breaker

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1
Reviews.Author: Timothy Andrews "Toma"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  I replaced a Canon Powershot and was pleasantly surprised by improvement and enhancement of both photo quality and camera features.  Before buying I also considered the Leica DLux version and decided the price difference was too great for what amounts to a name upgrade.  In addition to great still shots, the camera produces good videos. Accompanying photo management software is OK but not as good as others I have used.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: meme
Reviews.Content: Very nice little camera.takes good pictures. One feature I like is the take pictures through a glass window. I take a lot of photos of birds at my feeders from inside the house and it reduces the window glare greatly. I like the burst speed .i am still learning about this camera .i purchased additional batteries and wall charger at the same time I purchased the camera so I always have two replacement batteries charged and ready to go at all times . This camera goes everywhere with me . Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera for 2012
Reviews.Author: v1per
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Amazon.com (not third party or fulfilled by Amazon) and it arrived on time. Excellent, excellent camera! When I bought it, the red model cost more than the silver or black, but I'm glad I picked the red because it's unique and eye catching.I had used Casio, Olympus, Canon, and Nikon in the past, and the Panasonic Lumix ZS20 beat them all in picture quality (the most important factor in my opinion for a camera), ease of use, battery life, number of useful features, etc. I enjoyed the durability of Olympus (mine was the 790 SW model, so it was able to withstand drops, water immersion, etc.) but the picture quality left a lot to be desired. Casio had good picture quality (though not as good as this Panasonic model) but battery life was not good. Canon and Nikon are overpriced in my opinion for the picture quality and features that they offered.FYI I did my research thoroughly (reading reviews from sites like CNET, talking to friends who are students of photography, and even reading individuals' reviews here on Amazon for each model from each brand) comparing the best models from Panasonic, Olympus, Casio, Canon, Nikon and Sony before I decided on this one. The only gap I saw with this model may have to do with the warranty where you may not get service if it breaks down overseas (honestly, I'm not sure about this point ... potential buyers should re-check) but that's easily remedied by purchasing a Square Trade warranty here from Amazon (which I did for my Panasonic Lumix ZS20 :)Spend the money on this cam and get the warranty ... perfect combo.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Steve Loves Amazon
Reviews.Content: Camera technology has come a long way, and I love these Panasonic cameras. I bought three to use at a wedding, and they were great for that. I took one on my honeymoon, though, and without a view finder, I had to randomly shoot half the trip. The screen is just not bright enough in broad daylight.So this 20x zoom camera could almost replace an SLR and even a video camera, but not in daylight. What a frustration that was.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: J. Wilgus
Reviews.Content: I had a Panasonic Lumix ZS-3 and was going to switch to the new Samsung smart camera with a 21x zoom but after reading the reviews about its slow shutter speed,  I went with the Panasonic again and I'm glad I did.  The zoom at 20x is pretty phenomenal and the clarity of the pics is excellent.  I took pictures of birds through the window and they were still very clear.  The shutter speed is very quick.  I think it does better than the previous versions in low light conditions.  My only "complaint" is that the touch screen requires a little more pressure than I'm used to with my "i" products but certainly not a deal breaker.  I like the wide angle of the lens- great for group shots. I like the white body.  I haven't done anything with the GPS so I don't know how it affects the battery.  I don't know why Panasonic gave up on the one piece charger for the in-camera charger.  I always carry two batteries so the in-camera charger doesn't work for me.  I'm using the one piece from my old camera since both cameras use the same battery.  Overall, a very good camera for a competitive price.  Remember that the best camera is the one you have with you and this is a good size for carrying in a pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE UNBELIEVABLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have the ZS19 (same but without GPS). This camera replaced my Cannon Elph 600. I wanted better pictures & videos. WHAT A SURPRISE! This camera exceeded my expectations by about 2000%. The iA mode covers almost every situation even when recording videos and the results are truly amazing. Not even my 35mm camera did better (and I always had to remember f-stops, etc; always confusing.). Suitable for the professional with all the manual controls.It says 20x zoom, but you can take up to 40x (it picked up a license number half a block away), but for the xtra zoom use a tripod. Color rendition is perfect. I've really put it to the test trying almost all the features. Mode selector is easy to read and adjust. And as you scroll through settings, a help bar describes each function. I got hummingbirds in flight a dusk; and at their feeder from 40' away with good clarity (still pix). This is definitely the BEST camera I ever had and I still have more to learn about it.  It's amazing so much is contained in a point & shoot camera. Well made; fantastic lens. I can't remember making a better purchase. I do miss a viewfinder (you have to learn to point the lens at the subject for zoom). Battery life much shorter than old camera; I bought the Power Kit by Thermstore (2 batteries, wall and auto chargers which work very well). With all the features and flexibility  I don't mind having to change/charge batteries more often; the trade-off is certainly worth it. And the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Greg Tishkowski
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use this camera, but so far, so good.  I would say that the instructions on GPS usage is a bit confusing.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Brubaker
Reviews.Content: My old Panasonic Lumix decided to develop software issue, but since it had been great over the last 4 years, decided to try one more.  This was the right one in my budget.  Works great, no real learning curve.  AND syncs perfect with my Panasonic TV with Viera Link. Sharing vacation pics is so much easier on a 50 inch.

Reviews.Title: High Quality photos and great video
Reviews.Author: IKU1758
Reviews.Content: Did some research on various Point and Shoot digital cameras and came to the conclusion that this camera for the price had everything that we need.  It takes great pictures in auto mode.  It adjusts for indoor lighting and has a great zoom.  The HD video recording is amazing and the pictures and video were easy to download and edit.  The battery lasts longer than expected but I do plan to buy a spare so we have an extra.Overall, my wife uses this and it meets all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: No seperate charger
Reviews.Author: Charlotte M Koshick
Reviews.Content: The only way to charge it is to plug in the whole camera.  Usually I buy an extra batery for my camera so I can charge one while still using the camera, but that is not an option with this since it can only charge in the camera.  So if your battery dies you have stop taking pictures until the battery is recharged, possibly missing priceless moments.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Panny
Reviews.Author: Tukhyya
Reviews.Content: This ZS-20 is the fourth Panasonic  point and shoot l have owned. It is fantastic.  Each model has been better than the previous one and this model is a quantum leap ahead.The images  are crisp and beautifully exposed..Screen is bright and easy to see in all but the brightest light.Lens range is brilliant.Video is as good as you need in this style of camera.Burst mode is fantastic . Used it on motorcycle racing at Laguna Seca and got great pictures.Ergos are the same as previous models so it was familiar straight out of the box.Love this camera and value for money is tops.

Reviews.Title: An engineering marvel
Reviews.Author: gman33 "gman33"
Reviews.Content: Just got this a couple of days ago and I'm very impressed. I've tested and used quite a few travel zooms and I believe this one is the best. Others might produce marginally better image quality, but what sets the ZS20 apart is it's ability to focus fast and accurately, and a pretty incredible image stabilization system. If you've got decent light, you can take handheld shots at full zoom that are pretty close to tack sharp. I've had other travel zooms where you have to set on 2 second delay on full zoom just so the shutter-shake doesn't blur the images. And that's at 20x, which is amazing. Plus, Panasonic's Intelligent zoom does a reasonably good job of enhancing the quality of digital zoom (it does for photos what an upconverter does for DVDs). At full enhanced zoom (40x with digital), you can see what somebody looks like behind home plate from the center field bleachers at most ballparks. This camera may not measure up to the Sony HX9V for pure image quality, but it's darn close, and I think you'd only tell the difference on closer technical analysis than 99 percent of us would ever do. More important, the ZS20 is much skinnier, easier to use (subjective), much much faster, and has lightning quick and accurate focussing as well as the exceptional image stabilization that I believe will result in more usable shots for casual users. An added bonus is that you can also shoot slow-motion video with this camera, something you can't do with the HX9V.

Reviews.Title: Not for extended field use
Reviews.Author: J. Andrew Blaher
Reviews.Content: I specifically purchased this camera for an extended backpacking trip due to its wide zoom and light weight.  It took good pictures while it worked but after 4 months the display failed.  I have read that this is not unusual with the camera so I sent it in for warranty repair.  I was then advised that there was corrosion found inside the camera and the warranty would be voided as a result.  While it was a very wet early season the camera was not exposed to rain other than an occasional light drizzle.  It was kept in a water resistant case but it was by my side in humid weather as were my other electronic devices such as my cell phone which was probably exposed to more rain but had no issues.  Whether the display failure was related to the corrosion is up for debate.  What is not is that the camera will experience corrosion if kept in humid outdoor conditions for an extended period of time and this will void the warranty.  The camera is not recommended for extended field use.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Look for a manufacturer other than Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and after only a few months of owning it the lens cover would not open.  I sent it back to Panasonic Repair and after 3 weeks of waiting and a couple of phone calls, I sent them an email expressing my dissatisfaction with their repair process and responsiveness.  The next day I received a call from them stating they would not honor the warranty due to finding sand inside the camera. I took very good care of this camera, always kept it in a case, never dropped it, etc. No abuse, no misuse, just normal usage for a point and shoot camera. If a grain of sand can make its way into the lens and render the camera irreparable, I guess I consider that a design flaw. If Panasonic will not honor the warranty, I consider that the poorest of customer service.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Boklewski "twister"
Reviews.Content: I searched for a while to find a great camera.  I am not technically saavy enough (nor patient enough) to operate technically impossible and heavy camera equipment.  I just wanted a nice, compact model that would take breathtaking pictures (Sorry Ashton, I passed up the cool pics camera).  I have done research and know Leica products to be very reliable and I trust this name. This one has amazing zoom, amazing special effects, takes great pictures, and even has a waterproof case if you want.  I just got it weeks ago and have not completely read the manual, but worth the money.  I am so pleased with the quality of the pictures thatI had to write this review.

Reviews.Title: SLR quality photos in an incredible - pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Melnic "Melnic"
Reviews.Content: Intelligent - makes my pictures look great.You would not believe the zoom !!If you can barely see it in the distance - you can zoom in up close,with a steady, no tripod photo (image stabilization).Great HD movies.Finally a camera that zooms that starts out wide anglefor the grandkids birthday parties ... I don't have to back out ofthe room to take a photo.The "through a window" mode - was great on our Grand Canyon vacationas we were driving - photos look like I was outside - standing still,when I was driving at 60 !Very pleased with the battery life, picture quality and cameraoperation.  Highly recommend for those tired of lugging their SLRaround.  Fits in my cargo shorts pocket - comfortably.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: kcnew "kcnew"
