Reviews.Content: This camera is a little heavier than the simple point-and-shoot models, and - in that I was backpacking for 5 weeks - I worried about that aspect ... but it fit perfectly into my pocket and performed magnificently. I ordered two extra batteries for it and charged them before I left for the UK but I never had to use them. One 32GB SD card and one battery that I recharged whenever I could find an outlet, and it was perfect. The battery will last for days through hundreds of pictures at the highest setting. I couldn't have been happier with my purchase. I even dropped it quite a few times without it being in a case and ... nothing. I hope I have it forever.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: gv116 in NJ
Reviews.Content: I like the picture quality and shooting features.  I did have a malfunction that required service the first year which is the reason for three stars.  The rating would have been higher without the malfunction and lower if not for the free warranty repair.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Pictures
Reviews.Author: Boston Audiophile
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete novice and this camera takes incredible pictures with no skill-set whatsoever.  it's a highly recommended point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan A Jala
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about two weeks now, and love the camera and it's features. I have used the Macro feature quite extensively, and the zoom and wide angle capability is marvelous. There are so many features on the camera however, that it will take quite some time to master. However, if you simply want a point and shoot, you have that also. The size is very compact, and easy to carry wherever you go (suggest a carry case for protection).

Reviews.Title: My second ZS camera and lovin' it.
Reviews.Author: Reenie McC "Reenie"
Reviews.Content: I debated a couple of months about replacing my 18 month old ZS19 with the ZS 20.  Specifically, I needed to replace the ZS19 because I damaged it when it bumped a table because I had it on the strap on my wrist.  The bump caused a lens error that would have cost about $180 to have Panasonic repair look at it and possibly more than that.  The ZS20 came up on sale for less than the repair cost, so what to do?  I really really liked the ZS19 - GREAT zoom acuity, plenty of features for the wanna-be photog who likes to take more than vacation shots but doesn't want to be bothered with the bigger camera and the changeable lenses (downside - no viewfinder, which took a while to get used to, and which I would love to have - maybe when the costs come down).  So, I went back and forth, back and forth, looking at tons of options.  Do I chance getting the same camera (difference is the ZS has GPS, which doesn't matter to me) getting damaged easily, or do I go for more sophistication?  Do I spend more money on something I don't really need just because I fear damage.  Decided to stay with the ZS family, and I'm not sorry, yet.  Same great photos, great zoom, small size - stick it in a pocket or purse, BUT DON"T CARRY IT ON A WRIST.  I DID purchase the additional warranty for less than $40 for 2 extra years.  After my experience with the ZS19, it seems well worth it.  Hopefully it will not be necessary to use it.  I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone wanting a good camera  without the costs of additional lenses.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and so compact.
Reviews.Author: S. Guerrero "sus25"
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time; actually earlier than promised.  Was easy to use right out of the box.  Takes great pictures which download in a snap.

Reviews.Title: Great features
Reviews.Author: Tom Hannigan
Reviews.Content: Like the ZS19, the ZS 20 delivers. Great travel camera. Lightweight ( compared to the new Canon XS700 it is like a feather), sleek and quick. Great pix, and lots of great features. Price at 170 is perfect. A better value than its newer sibling ( ZS25) from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Learning curve
Reviews.Author: Harry C. Thorn
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd ZS camera and with each one comes a learning curve.  We still have a lot to learn about this camera but so far it has met or exceeded out expectations.Harry and Karin

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Andrews
Reviews.Content: excellent camera for the price. Smooth and easy to carry in your pocket. Fast, Powerful and a great zoom lens

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Francis S. Tostanoski
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. I bought it for my girl friend and she really loves it. It takes awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fourth Lumix I've owned
Reviews.Author: AEP
Reviews.Content: I use it for real estate appraisals.  The 20x optical zoom allows me to be a long distance from a house and still get a good picture so everyone can see what it looks like up close.Decent time lapse between taking pictures.  Lots of other goodies that I don't use that much but when I've tried them seem to work very well.If you need a good point and shoot digital I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice compact camera at a nice price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera at a nice price.  The zoom range is phenomenal at the price tag!  I can't find a problem with this - and it fits in my pants pocket easily!!  That did it for me!

Reviews.Title: I was very surpise how soon we got this package.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I am really surpise on the picture quality of this camera a real god sent, and it never stops to impress me with every use.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Terry Doyle "Collectible_PBs"
Reviews.Content: No detailed review but this is the 2nd of these cameras I've bot (dropped the last one and fell on it finally killing it). Works very well and takes great pix: close ups, landscapes, portraits...I don't think there is a situation which this small wonder can't handle.

Reviews.Title: It's a good camera fro the dollar
Reviews.Author: Stuck in old Lodi again
Reviews.Content: Nothing exceptional but works well and is easy to use. I was hoping that it would give a little bit sharper image from a distance. It's a little slow on the start up, stops action well. Seems to be built well time will tell. It is a pocket camera with nice features.

Reviews.Title: Loved the first one!
Reviews.Author: Kristen M Pritchett
Reviews.Content: Had this camera in red and loved it........had some shutter issues and it had some other issues before it was even 2 years old but bought it again because I loved it so much.  I just hope I don't have the same issue.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great!
Reviews.Author: Gloria P
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to replace a Canon point and shoot that I dropped in the sand. This is the first Panasonic that I have owned.  It takes great pictures and video, great zoom and quickness. Although I'm an amateur photographer, I have taken beautiful shots over the years, and I love taking pictures..  My first requirement for a camera is that it fit in my pocket, although I'd love to have one of the big ones.  I'm not certain that the inside pictures are quite as sharp as the Canon, but it is still great and much quicker than the Canon.  Love the auto mode, the close ups and the landscape modes.  Still have to learn to do good videos, but that's for vacation time.  I'm very happy with this camera.  I'll give it four stars because it is a bit of a learning curve for me with using the computer manual.

Reviews.Title: Love the lumix.
Reviews.Author: Campbell "Pumpkinhead"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Lumix have a great sensitivity to color. I've compared them side by side to other cameras and the difference is amazing. The panoramic feature is easy and neat to use. Only wish it was a little better in low light without the flash. But it's other features make up for it.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: Walter Jonas
Reviews.Content: and great pictures.  Interface with the computer is a little clunky, but a fantastic replacement for my dying Canon A540

Reviews.Title: Good low light
Reviews.Author: Alecia
Reviews.Content: Only took about 80 picture so far. I got this to replace a lumix that has dust inside and leaves the dots on photos. So far the low light pics were great! Will update as I use it more.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: Aaron D. Cantleberry
Reviews.Content: User friendly and takes incredible pictures and videos.  Love the panoramic option!  Great little camera to take on your next vacation!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: betty stiles
Reviews.Content: Everything was great .  Works beautiful . I am Very happy with this  camera .It was sent to me quickly  .

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Darrell P.
Reviews.Content: Plenty of camera for the user. It you're the point and shoot person, this camera will far exceed you needs. Too many features for ME to include !

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: glensan
Reviews.Content: camera works fine so far, last one (previous model Lumix) only lasted 1 year before stuff got inside the lense somehow & made for spots on pics. Amazon delivery was fast and product arrived in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love!!
Reviews.Author: RecentGrad
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2 years and it has never failed me! The quality of the pictures are outstanding and it has many options to choose from in regards to scenes. The only semi-bad thing is the time it takes to take a picture. However, I am comparing this to my zero-shutter lag smartphone. I bought this camera for around $300 and now that it is half the price, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: An incredible camera
Reviews.Author: E A Fow
Reviews.Content: I just graduated from a smaller Canon point and shoot (which died after a year) to this incredible Lumix.  I am still learning to use the manual controls, and I wish it had come with a full paper manual (instead of the cd rom and online materials), but even in point and shoot mode, it is simply amazing. I have been taking photos of the birds in my yard using the 20x optic zoom, and they are stunning. Probably it's most amazing feature is how well it shoots in low light. I never use the flash inside - the camera does a terrific job without it.  I'll update my review as I continue to learn how to use everything, but I could not be happier with this camera, and already one of my friends has bought one, too, after seeing me using mine and then seeing the results.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Savvy "Smart Consumer"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a replacement for a Panasonic DMCTZ4, I would have purchased the DMCTZ4 again but couldn't find one.  I dropped my old camera and the zoom no longer worked.  I kept getting an error message (turn camera off...) but alas it was ruined.Now to this camera.  It was very easy to use.  Having said that there are many features that I haven't used because I haven't read all the directions (I tend to use something until I run into a glitch or need further information).  Once I read all the directions I know I will love it as much as I did my previous Panasonic.It's small and lightweight - perfect.

Reviews.Title: Low Light Dream!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Robinson
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this camera to me for low light photo's.  For the price, I was willing to take the chance.  We go to a lot of concert's and they don't permit flash photography.  In steps this camera and hands down, well worth it!  Fantastic shots and easy to use.  Highly recommend this beauty.

Reviews.Title: Required for work.
Reviews.Author: Kristye McDonald
Reviews.Content: When my job required that we all have cameras with GPS capability I found this on on Amazon aftern exhausting all local resources.  Great price.  Great camera.  I use for between 400 and 800 photos a day and have had no trouble with it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent purchase
Reviews.Author: RAFAEL Q.
Reviews.Content: Very good compact camera,  easy to use; small but has every thing is needed to take impressive photos; the zoom is excelent.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: bananananny "bananananny"
Reviews.Content: I take the worst pictures ever, historically.  This camera has made all the difference. For $20, get the insurance so if it does have issues as neg. reviews have indicated, it can be remedied.  I haven't read the book yet but have taken fantastic photos of my dogs, which is why I bought it.  Dogs don't sit still long so most pics are on the fly and this doesn't disappoint.  I'm very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great camera great price
Reviews.Author: Daniel S. Hwang
Reviews.Content: As I stated above. I really appreciate panasonic's knack for creating high built in optical zoom. The features of this camera are perfect for picture taking in any light level. Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: The best choice!
Reviews.Author: Raúl Campiglia
Reviews.Content: Strongly recommendedThe camera exceeded my expectations.Obviously you can not get a camera that meets all the needs of users.My requirements were that it was a pocket camera with the ease of point and shoot photo in auto mode but at the same time have very good zoom and wide possibility of manual configuration.The only weak I've found so far is the GPS function, it takes forever to connect to the satellites (when it does ...) and think it's not so much what it brings.

Reviews.Title: Awesome features and quality
Reviews.Author: BargainKing "gREATsHOPPER"
Reviews.Content: Zs20 from amazon was a great deal. Chose this over the zs25...overall a great camera for the price. Videos are also very good. The 20x optical zoom with image stabilizer is really great! Now, why 4 stars...I would give 4.5 stars but I can't! My only minor complaint is 1. I wish there were more photo choices for image quality, 2. I expected even sharper images with the Leica lens, 3. Wish it had wifi connectivity to upload to social media!

Reviews.Title: This is my wife's baby
Reviews.Author: Benjamin A. Marshall
Reviews.Content: To date, she has not had a single complaint to me so far and coming from her that is saying a lot

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: E "EDR"
Reviews.Content: it is a great camera easy to use with great features. it is a little bigger than the previous model and doesn't fit in my old case

Reviews.Title: Clearly you get alot more than you pay for.
Reviews.Author: scott williams
Reviews.Content: The first time i bought a Panasonic camera I was sceptical. But it turned out to be the best csmera i had ever owned. My jobs requires alot of picture taking in different places and different lighting. I take anywhere from 100 to 1,000 photo's a day. The only reason I am not still using my original Panasonis is due to the fact that my clients now require the Geo coding with the gps camera. So i looked on Amazon and found this one for alot less money than the others and it was a "no brainer". This camera is even better than my old one which i loved dearly. I looked foward to many years with this camera. I not only recommend this camera but I would strongly urge you to buy it. You will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Craig Kellerman
Reviews.Content: I looked at many compact cameras and choose the Panasonic for the quality. It is well built not plastic,has a great Lumix lens, has great zoom. I have a larger Cannon digital and wanted something that I can carry in my pocket. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Perfect GPS Camera on a budget
Reviews.Author: Joseph C. Moore Jr.
Reviews.Content: Love this camera and takes good pics. Camera is very easy to use one handed, Zoom takes a couple seconds to focus. Night pics take some practice to get right, Would highly recommend you purchase a spare battery. Battery life is not the best when using with the GPS enabled.

Reviews.Title: versatil
Reviews.Author: Patricio C.
Reviews.Content: Practical, small, handable and fast shutter speed. It would be perfect if it had a good wi-fi user experience. But I liked it. I'm using it all the time :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Avalon
Reviews.Content: The Lumix ZS20 is a fine compact camera. We still have a lot to learn on it, but as of now the pics are clear and we are very satisfied with the purchase

Reviews.Title: LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: DONNA
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this camera.  It is pocket size but able to really zoom close for distance photos.  Muck more clear pictures than our old camera.

Reviews.Title: It's the greatest for a pocket camera
Reviews.Author: peter buerkle
Reviews.Content: I had it's brother the ZS19 for a few years until it fell our of my pocket on an African sahfari. Both cameras are the same except the ZS20 has GPS which would have been nice when your taking pictures in four different countries. The camera is very easy to use.  It takes very clear still pictures as well as movies with stereo sound.  The 20x telephoto is great for a pocket camera. Overall it is a good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: TPDBLBASS
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace an older Lumix I've had for over 7 years. Took it to MLB Spring Training in Phoenix. I took over 700 pictures/videos and it worked flawlessly. The battery life seems to be very good (I bought a spare and never had to use it). Videos are especially nice. Excellent zoom. Great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: So far is very good
Reviews.Author: Carrie A.
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to purchase this camera.  So far I love it!  The zoom is awesome!  I have only had 1 indoor picture that came out a little dark.  Will update if I have any problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: kITTY SUTTON
Reviews.Content: I used to have a DMC-ZS3, but this camera raises the bar. The quality of the pictures is amazing, especially when you take them with low light. The video quality is also another thing that is a huge change. I recommend to buy SD cards that at least are 45 mb/s, you'll see with these ones that the camera save instantly the pictures and videos with zero delay.

Reviews.Title: When you can't use a DSLR. . .
Reviews.Author: Wesley Youngblood "Wax Junkie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily to use at music shows, given that most specify no cameras "with removable lenses". You can fit this one in your shirt pocket and it does the job. From some of the reviews on this site I was afraid I wouldn't be able to get some good pictures. The pictures turned out better than I expected them to. In fact I kind of like the grainy look of them. The Lumix stands far above other cameras in it's price range for a very simple reason. Manual control. In low light situations where there are spotlights on what you want to focus on, most camera meters over expose, and whats worse, use a slow shutter speed. This makes your images look like a cell phone camera. I assume that the people that gave the Lumix bad reviews relied on the automatic controls. At 1600 ISO and a sturdy chair to rest my elbow I am able to get the same exposures and focus as an SLR, but I have to trick it buy telling it to underexpose the shot. Little does it know it will expose correctly. One small quibble I have is that it doesn't have manual auto focus. This annoys me to no end. Cameras are stupid. You have to bend it in accordance with your will.

Reviews.Title: It's just cool...
Reviews.Author: Vance Andrews
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Panasonic equipment, but when it comes to cameras I have always stuck with Kodak (as much as to some that may be telling as far as taste in cameras) and enjoyed the quality of Kodak. I think it's just how compact this camera is and how easy it is to connect USB and quickly copy the files. But the MTS file format for video is much preferred (by me) over MPG, so that was a plus as well. I am not displeased at all with the quality of photos in low light, which I expected utter failure.It's just cool... :)

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: J. Del Bono Lonardi
Reviews.Content: This Camera is great, is really smart, the Ai function that select an scene automatically, works great!!!, the image quality is really good and the noise it is not a probleam untill ISO 800 or 1600 on small prints.The 20x zoom in this such compact body is fantastic.The only thing 2 things that to improve is the playback function (I personally prefer a button and not a switch that you need to change every time you want to see a picture or take one)The other thing is the body and buttons feels not strong as my previous Canon Isus 770is.

Reviews.Title: I found my digital camera and using with pleasure
Reviews.Author: Jahongir
Reviews.Content: The digital camera is perfect. I liked it from the 1st holding. Looks very good and the pictures and videos are very high quality.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Auburngrad08
Reviews.Content: Can't beat it for the money, and the quality pictures that we have gotten so far.  Have not used it a whole lot yet, but pleased with it at a concert.  Shots look good considering the lighting and distance covered.  Battery seems to be holding a nice charge that will last.  It might not be the newest out there, but I would buy it again in a heart beat.I have been a professional photographer, and still shoot most of our pictures on my DSLR.  I reviewed alot the P&S; camera's before settleing on this one.  It has a qualty lense, and the features are great.  Small enough to fit in my wifes small purse, and can take it anywhere.  Most events now do not allow DSLR's in, or only with short lenses, that don't capture what I want.Nothing from a P&S; can match my Canon DSLR, or the Nikon equvilants that are out there, but this does a great job, and always allows us to have the camera.  You never know when you will have something you want to take a picture of.

Reviews.Title: Handy size, easy to switch to video
Reviews.Author: L. Sztajer
Reviews.Content: I lost a previous version of this camera while on vacation, so I replaced it with this model. It's a bit thicker than the previous model making it a little harder to get into a pants pocket, and it requires a little bit bigger case. But the photo quality is great and taking videos is much easier thanks to the record button on the top (no need to switch modes anymore). This one has a real "on/off" switch, which was the reason I chose it. (I hear newer models have replaced with a button that can be accidentally triggered too easily).

Reviews.Title: Get it while available
Reviews.Author: William W. Whelan "Wiz"
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife who would use nothing but smartphone for photos.  This is smaller and far far superior. With 20X zoom  it can be use for bird/wildlife.  Loads of features. Good images. She is now a believer.  At the current price it is like a gift. Don't miss it as a true pocket camera and/ or back up.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Superb point to shoot camera
Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the best point to shoot cameras in the market today.Super clarity awesome zoom and great flash.Can't go wrong with this one

Reviews.Title: Good Quality!!
Reviews.Author: Natalie PW
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I love the functions. there are so many options and it's pretty easy to figure out the basics. The pictures turn out fabulously and I plan to take a course to learn tips and tricks to take even better photos.

Reviews.Title: powerful zoom, somewhat complex
Reviews.Author: rdmjr
Reviews.Content: this is a quality camera, has the 20 x zoom, a quality Leica lens.  Has a number of optional settings which can get a little complicated for the casual user, takes great pictures in low light.  does not seem to be as easily programmed or as versatile as the TS-2 underwater models.  I would suggest this camera if you have specific needs for a 20x soon, such as nature or low light photography, but be prepared to spend some time getting to understand its intricacies.

Reviews.Title: Wow....great buy
Reviews.Author: J. Frazier
Reviews.Content: This is the third Panasonic I have had over the years, and this one is fantastic.  I have tried it out in some very difficult light and contrast situations and it hasn't failed me yet.  It has some fine optics, and the built in bracketing option is a real plus. I have had very clear and noiseless images even at the longer end of the zoom.  Looking forward to traveling with this this summer.  I can't stand carrying a tripod and a lot of gear around.  This enables me to travel light without loosing quality.  Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Very, very good camera
Reviews.Author: tomgil
Reviews.Content: I have a DSLR and this as a backup. Has many very good features, good quality lens and is compact besides.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but the 20X optical photo is nearly the same as an older 10x optical Lumix
Reviews.Author: David M. Fisher
Reviews.Content: The Lumix ZS20 camera is easy to use and takes good photos.  Regarding the 20x optical however, it may be lacking.  That is, I took a photo of a house in the distance using the 20x.  I then took the same photo using an older Lumix DMC-FZ20 using the 10x optical it has.  The result was nearly an identical photo with the edge going to the 20x ZS20.  Practically speaking, the 20x optical is not really 20x, when the 10x camera takes almost the same shot.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Stephen K.
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for traveling - excellent price - best camera for the price I paid - takes great pictures with low light - great zooming capabilities - light weight - Takes great close up photos - I use it to photograph jewelry - I recommend this camera to anyone - Easy to use - Paid $161 on Amazon - Listed at other electronic stores for $349 to $439.

Reviews.Title: It's a wonderful camera.  It's exactly what I wanted.  It's very light weight.
Reviews.Author: Linda W. Lester
Reviews.Content: I lost my camera on trip overseas & have been looking for one similar ever since. I am very with it.

Reviews.Title: panasonic Lumic ZS20 camera
Reviews.Author: hitori
Reviews.Content: Has clear photos, easy to use and an excellent 20 power optical zoom. It is also compatable with the panasonic cameras I have in the office.

Reviews.Title: as good as advertised
Reviews.Author: D Lee
Reviews.Content: Received this camera after taking some time to research and review an affordable effective point and shoot for less than 200 dollars. I was going to buy the newer version, however this camera is compact, and packs plenty of punch. I will be using this for vacation photos and when I need to capture better quality photos than what my iphone can produce.

Reviews.Title: Another great Lumix
Reviews.Author: Prairie
Reviews.Content: I really like the ZS20.  Nice and compact, yet takes very high quality pictures that rival much bigger and much more expensive cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. G. Kenadjian
Reviews.Content: I have this camera a month and it is taking excellent pictures.  The optical zoom works well and its responsiveness is good.  My friends admire it and talk about maybe getting one too.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: C. Todd
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift. Feedback is great and the pic are perfect. Lots of settings for the perfect situation. Lovin it so far.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS20, great camera great price
Reviews.Author: shiv "shiv"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes phenomenal pix in fairly low light conditions.  I like it MUCH better than the ZS30 I had for about a month.  this model has a switch for on/off vs. soft button, next to the shutter.my mother, mother-in-law, and sister-in-law all have the same camera I was so impressed with it. simple to use, I recommend getting a second battery as a backup, not because it drains quickly but just in case.HD video is pretty good too. GPS is a cool feature.if you can test out this camera do so, I think you'll like it and the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this camera for capability and price
Reviews.Author: O. Goldfarb
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces a one that was four times the price and 10 times the weight with hardly a difference in picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a great time with the ZS20.
Reviews.Author: IrishHawn "HonBaka"
Reviews.Content: I have been using the ZS8 for over 2 years and really liked how it handled and,  for my purposes, was satisfied with every aspect save 2. The 16X zoom did not reach quite far enough for my mature shots and,  2. The lid to the  battery compartment seemed a bit flimsy.  My misgivings about this proved valid when thearea where the lid pivots upon chipped.Fortunately, there was sufficient material leftthat the lid stayed in place. This cameratravelled with me to more than 20 cities acrossAmerica and took very good picturesThe battery lid arrangement hasn't improved but the extra zoom capability as well as some of the other features will give me greater capabilities to get that special shot.I may follow up later with more input as I take more pictures.With the 20X zoom my first

Reviews.Title: Great camera:
Reviews.Author: Lisa Muehlbauer
Reviews.Content: Unbelieveable at the price.  I am so happy I purchased this camera, the scenes phase is very useful and handy.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Alvaro
Reviews.Content: More features than I will ever need, but all the ones I want.  The quality is excellent and it is small enough to slide into a pocket [in the neoprene case I bought] but large enough to hang on to.  The grip is good.  No protector over the extra-large screen - which is easy to see!  So a case is a must.

Reviews.Title: A Birthday Gift to make a girl happy
Reviews.Author: Jean Scrivner
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to our daughter for her birthday.  She is one very happy young lady ready to great spring with camera in hand..

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Hard to find a point and shoot with a 20x optical zoom.  Zoom is smooth and quiet.  Takes great pictures and has many different picture options.  Barely small enough to fit comfortably in pocket.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for my job.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: i do property inspections for bank and mortgage companies and i must say the best 2 things about this camera is the zoom and the time it takes to take a picture after flash is used. which is about 0.5 - 2 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular allrounder
Reviews.Author: KGPOC
Reviews.Content: For price, quality of shot, zoom, speedy autofocus I do not believe there is a better camera..There are no cons..

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Colleen R.
Reviews.Content: So far, I love this camera for the price.  I have not had much time to really experiment with it yet but love the 20x zoom; a huge upgrade from my old 3x zoom point & shoot.  I wish the full manual came with the camera rather than just the "start up" manual.  Found the extended manual for all the features on-line but it's a lot of information to read or copy.  The CD that came with the camera is NOT Mac compatible which is too bad.  I'm looking forward to learning more about this camera's use.

Reviews.Title: like it
Reviews.Author: Corina
Reviews.Content: We had an identical one and we broke it. So, we decided to buy the same model because it's the best quality/price.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take pictures on a trip. Camera work very well. Only complaint is I wish a SD card was included,camera memory pretty small so a card is needed.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Juju
Reviews.Content: We had a Panasonic Lumix for years and wanted another one similar. It is very similar and takes great pics. Very happy with it and it was so reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: G. doraisamy
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about.I did a lot of research before buying this one and do not regret it a bit.Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Carleen
Reviews.Content: Loved my new camera.... It took awesome pictures & videos too.....The zoom worked great as well. I need to get use to the microphone because when I took the video I would forget & put my fingers over it....

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Customer from Dallas, Tx
Reviews.Content: All a compact camera needs:Easy handling, great pictures.Panorama shooting mode.HD video mode. Very good macro mode.Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Judith M.
Reviews.Content: I selected this camera since I had an older Lumix that I was happy with, and wanted to be able to use the same extra battery.  That worked out okay, but I was slighly disappointed that the companion cord doesn't match (they changed the fitting).  However, other than not having a spare cord, I am very happy with the new camera.  It seems to take even better pictures, and is quicker, than my old Lumix, just using the auto adjustment feature.  I also love that I can making manual setting adjustments.  I also love the compact size and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: ZS20
Reviews.Author: Max C. Mcmillon
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for my photography needs. Easy to use, but be sure too always use the camera strap as it is easy to drop.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: S. Brown
Reviews.Content: takes excellent photos,easy to use -would recco Panasonic cameras to all.carry it with me at all times in the ready position.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: James Mogush
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money - The zs30 offers very little more except wi-fi and a slight improvement in resolution but costs too much for these additional features.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Julie Zbyszinski
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and arrived early.  Had a charger and adapter for transfering pics to computer.  So far it is working great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Maria Waltner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this last year (I know, I'm so far behind on my reviews...) and I still love it.Perhaps it is just in comparison to my old camera or my phone's camera but this takes EXCELLENT shots. The zoom and focus in particular are fantastic. I can get a clear shot of a bird 40-50 feet away through a dirty window and see the worm in his mouth. A fast shutter speed allows me to get the shot the second I press the button and not several seconds after.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: I am a novice photographer, so I wanted a camera that would take a good range of types of photos easily, and produce excellent quality photos. This camera does this, while also giving you options to select special settings if you want to get out of automatic mode (shutter priority, aperture priority, etc.).  For focusing, I love that you can tap on the screen if the camera is not focusing where you want the focus to be. The camera has performed well for distance photos, macro close-ups, zoomed photos (although as mentioned in many reviews, at the full 20x, a tripod or something to steady the camera is advisable).  I have not yet explored all the features, but I am thrilled with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: love the camara,
Reviews.Author: brenda
Reviews.Content: easy to handle, small enough to fit in purse. zoom works awesome and is quick to focus.works well even in low light situations.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Harlan Shaver
Reviews.Content: Had been using this camera everywhere for around 8 months and the backlight on the touchscreen stopped working.  Panasonic was awesome about it.  I've used Lumix cameras for many years now and this was the first time one ever needed a repair.  It was refreshing to know Panasonic would stand behind their product.  This really is an awesome camera for the price range.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: A co worker did the research for cameras and suggested this camera to me.  Took great photos but this Christmas it had a system error for the zoom and stopped working.  First problem I have had.  I contacted Amazon and had a replacement asap.  Even with this issue, it's a wonderful camera and takes beautiful photos.

Reviews.Title: Meets My Expectations
Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to handle compact camera.  It has an awesome zoom range and in general takes pretty good photos.  I have yet to try out the video function but for now I'm happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Really Liked this camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Grzelewski
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera very much I have had other cameras from Panasonic Lumix and they were, in my opinion really good quality. I would give this camera a 4 star only because I never give a perfect rating. there is always room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: j walker
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this camera to anyone who wants a good camera for a fair price.  I think it is very good.

Reviews.Title: "Ok lah" type of point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Desmond Chan
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for my "noisy picture" casio camera. I'm always particular about noise in pictures but then again, I do not have the patience to learn the sophisticated DSLR camera. Overall, I'm pretty happy with this after some pix testing. Just did also the v1.2 firmware upgrade as well.

Reviews.Title: Great great camera.
Reviews.Author: PatG
Reviews.Content: Always looking for a great easy to use camera and this is it. Was hoping it would just snap the greatest pictures and it can. I also did some homework and look at a couple of videos on youtube and I must say it is great and simple.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Matthew M. Jackson "04wrangler"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic has done it again by makine a stellar product!  The camera turns on at the speed of light and is ready to take a picture in what feels like less than a second!  the pictures for a point and shoot are very nice and the ease of use of this camera is amazing.  Put this camera next to the Nikon 9300 point and shoot series and found that it is faster, takes an equal picture by quality, and is physically a smaller camera so easier to carry in your pocket.  Great Product!!

Reviews.Title: Super convenient. Great photos
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Hastings
Reviews.Content: After losing the first camera (stolen- but can I blame their taste?) I got a replacement Samsung camera.  When it broke the first day, I realized the Panasonic Lumix was still the better camera, and for less money.

Reviews.Title: FAB
Reviews.Author: Sheree Hall
Reviews.Content: great camera.  I have used it in Spain and Israel & Switzerland this year and love the high quality. easy pictures it takes.  It is not worth paying extra for the gps locator as that drains your battery.  Battery life is very good.  A lot of easy to use features.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Melanie Stuart
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It is pocket sized yet has a 20X zoom with at 14.1 MP. You can do a lot with this camera! It is the best "small sized" camera that I have owned.

Reviews.Title: This series is fine workhorses for travel.
Reviews.Author: JAMES F VORWOLDT
Reviews.Content: This has been a very good traveling camera.I got another one that was adapted for infrared sothat I have a light weight and portable setfor my urban explorations. I sometimesuse the infrared one for my b/w images.

Reviews.Title: Easy full facility camera with excellent lens
Reviews.Author: Camera Fan
Reviews.Content: Fun, easy to use camera. Lots of control ability, yet the auto mode is excellent. It fits in a pocket but does as much as many want to be SLR's.

Reviews.Title: Very fast camera
Reviews.Author: jackson
Reviews.Content: This is super fast and pretty good auto focus system  Only issue is picture quality is not as good as i expected

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: OnWings Press
Reviews.Content: I am still learning to use it but it does so much and takes great pictures. I live in the mountains and the panoramic and night time pictures are fun to play with.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Levandowski
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest little camera I have owned. The zoom is unbelievable for such a small camera but what to expect from the Lieca lens. I did have a screen failure and returned to the repair facility and it was repaired and sent back with no charge in a timely manor. I do recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good buy.
Reviews.Author: DeniseGrimaldi
Reviews.Content: Great zoom, fast processing. Better than the Sony I had. Great camera for the price. I think this is a good begining camera for someone. I am now graduated to a Nikon with changeable lens , but I still love the lumix.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera
Reviews.Author: Juan Martin
Reviews.Content: Excelente camera, great quality in photos taken, has a great zoom, the estabilizer program is fantastic! If you want a great point and shot camera, this is....

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Awesome zone, Great automatic setting and good variety of other settings. Don't like proprietary charging cable!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera when I was going to China. I was looking for a point and shoot so I can have a nice compact camera. The 20X optical zoom is one of the best you can get with regular point and shoot and no lenses to carry or protruding out of the unit. It takes good automatic pictures and has a good environment settings for different scenes. It performs these much better than other  Point and Shoots I used and has a better variety.Only negative to this camera is their proprietary charging cable. It looks like a USB micro connection, but a closer look reveals it's proprietary cable. This means if you don't bring your cable and your batteries dye or you lose the cable you are out of luck. Probably have to contact the Panasonic to get another

Reviews.Title: my favourite camera
Reviews.Author: MadMad1
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Panasonic camera, I really treasure:20x zoom capability even inside moving vehicles,taken excellent photographs indoor gallery without flashor the laser display in Egypt at nightpanorama sweeping function is great for scenerytook thousands of photographs during my vacations.

Reviews.Title: Huge jumps in picture size.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a good little pocket camera for the price.  Works well when I'm not carrying my DSLR.  The video function works vary well.  My issue with this camera is that it allows you to select the fineness (size) of the image.  The lowest setting is .3M and the highest is 14.1M.  We use this camera for documentation purposes and store the pictures with client records.  14.1M (nearly 14 MB per picture) of detail takes up too much space as we take around 100 pictures per client, but .3 MP is not enough to record the detail.  My issue is that the next setting after .3M is 5M.  That's like 16 times larger or about 5 MB per picture.  It would be nice if there were a setting in the 1M range.  It's odd that there would be such huge jumps on the lower end of the selection scale.  To me, the large jumps should be on the upper end of the selection scale.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Emilie A. Ospina "EBIO gal"
Reviews.Content: I bought this before heading on a birding tour of the west. It is a great little camera that takes great closeups of birds in the hand as well as some decent shots of birds in trees.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: dvdpuertorico
Reviews.Content: Just the battery is not that great, and the performance in low light is not good! It is compact and have a lot of flexibility when taking pictures. Video quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Fan of the Panasonic Lumix series
Reviews.Author: Bitey (the big one)
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and take a ridiculous number of pics. I love the Panasonic Lumix cameras. They are easy to tote about, comfortably fitting in my hand as I wander around. They have a great zoom, which I love for wildlife, and give really high quality pics for a point and shoot. I've documented about 20 international trips with a few of these and have been super happy. In fact, even with my Canon Rebel T3i, I always carry this too. It's so convenient. I like to take it on runs through cities, which has been a great way to see cities and get exercise. The intelligent system works great. And they take pretty decent night-time shots, which is important to me. Overall, this is a great camera for basically any situation. I've had these for years now, so can't directly compare to anything else that isn't like 10 years old.Also, they're hardy. I've dropped and banged up a number of these and they take a beating. And when they stop, I've always had great interactions with the Panasonic customer service. No issues replacing when under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Gibson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my second deployment to Afghanistan. This thing is amazing! It survived the whole deployment and took beautiful pictures and video. Most of my pictures were taken from the air and turned out really well. Three of the guys Im with here bought the camera because they were so impressed by it.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: TONY DIESTE
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for the quality of lens and the performance of the camera. It was a lot cheaper than buying a Leica camera.

Reviews.Title: DMC-ZS20 lengthy process to save settings, but possible
Reviews.Author: kapt
Reviews.Content: After months of frustration (bought in Feb 2013) with the settings going back to factory default, I finally called Panasonic customer service and they helped me to permanently change some of them:1) In C1 mode at least, change the settings by going to Rec menu. Change the things like red-eye reduction, aspect ration, size, whatever.2) Go back to main menu and get into Setup.3) Scroll down to Cust.Set.Mem. and enter. Then, select C1 (or C2-1, etc) and click Menu/Set. When asked if you want to overwrite, select yes and click Menu/Set.Your settings should be saved (fingers crossed). The instruction booklet never seems to go into this- at least not in a way that I was able to pick up on.I really like the pictures and the speed with which I can take one after another- I was able to catch a "sword fight" that my boys had and it was almost like a movie.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Mary Jarman
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera for a few weeks, but I am already very pleased.  I took some video of my sister climbing down a twenty story building and with the amount of zoom this camera has I was able to see her facial expressions in reflection of the building. I have also used it in sport mode to take some really great soccer pictures.  I have gotten several comments about the great quality and wanting to know if I had a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I haven't figured out everything about this camera yet but I do love it.  Looks awesome and takes great pictures.  There is no lag time like I had with my pervious Sony Cybershot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Leena Guptha "Holistic Doctor"
Reviews.Content: I love, love this camera. I am not techno but it is easy to use and it takes FANTASTIC photos!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: P. Carvajal
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking at Amazon and Consumer Report Reviews before deciding on this camera to take on a big trip to Japan. It cost a bit more than I was hoping to spend but the results were worth every penny.Things I liked about the camera.1, Size small enough to fit in your pocket and pull out quickly to get a quick shot.2. Quality. This camera feels solid in your hand and it worked perfectly.3. Functions - It did everything that I wanted it to do when I wanted to do it. The buttons are all easy to find and use with very minimal time required to familiarize yourself with the camera.4. Battery life - This camera stayed charged for a couple of days on one charge with constant use. The sleep mode is awesome for those times you forget to turn it off before sticking it back into your pocket or bag.5. Zoom - Oh my gosh, the quality of the picture taken from far away was outstanding.As you can tell I am not a professional photographer just an every day person that wanted to memorialize a special trip. This exceeded my expectations and I have received so many compliments on my pictures. I am more than pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great buy!
Reviews.Author: T. Lascari
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my hubby as an early birthday present.  So glad I jumped on the opportunity after much research.  I bought it on April Fool's Day (one day sale) for $244.95 and the day after the price jumped to $341.24.  I love it already!  (I already have dslr camera and he doesn't like the bulky thing nor understands how to use it.)  There are a lot of features I haven't begun to try but will eventually.Zoom - Loving this feature since our old camera was only 4x.Pictures are nice and crisp from our experience thus far.  Low lighting ok but way better than our old camera.  I will use the dslr for those kind of pics so it's not an issue.Video - very good quality with a/f continual focus.  Great if you have grandchildren or pets on the move.  What I love about this is I can record a video and take still shots while recording.  I can't do that with my dslr because it stops recording if I try to snap a photo.Program and ia mode is ideal for hubby since the rest is Greek to him.  Not sure which setting is best for him, yet. I like the M.S.A.P. and the custom settings (he won't use) so I can experiment with that  and create custom settings.GPS drains battery and not something we're interested in right now but good to know it's there.The lacking viewfinder works out in our/his favor.  My hubby wears glasses and doesn't like the little window as a viewfinder to take pics, and loving the LCD screen instead indoors. Haven't tried it outdoors yet.This camera exceeds our expectations. We are very happy with it for a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Incredible product
Reviews.Author: Travis Buffa
Reviews.Content: The Lumix ZS20 has a Leica lens that is absolutely phenomenal.  I take a lot of pictures and wanted a camera that helps get some quality shots and that's exactly what I got.  A photographer friend recommended this series of camera to me, and I'm very glad I listened.  This camera is without a doubt, the best camera I could have bought.

Reviews.Title: Good, but complex
Reviews.Author: Mr. R. Thomale
Reviews.Content: The camera is a very complete and complex camera...it has many features that I will never use....but it takes beautiful pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: 678shopper
Reviews.Content: This is the third Panasonic camera purchased by me in the last 7-8 years starting with the FZ3. Size has now become important as also ability to take it out quickly to snap a moment. Hence this purchase.I am knocking off one star because of the battery drain that happens with the GPS feature switched on. Otherwise, this is a very good camera. It doesn't occupy much space and goes anywhere. I have now taken it to multiple locations around the world and every photo has come out well.

Reviews.Title: workable backup camera
Reviews.Author: oldsalt19
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife who wanted a more powerful zoom.  She likes it a lot.  This camera is 12 mp not 14 mp.  Both descriptions are used in the data that is presented with the camera and is probably the reason for Amazon suspending sales. It's dumb anyway.  Megapixel number is a myth, myth, myth.  This camera  is, and should be, rated at 12 mp.  The camera is reasonably sharp and focuses accurately; and of course the zoom ratio is outstanding. There is built-in sharpening and noise correction which is too bad.  The good news is that both of these can be turned off by menu so that the user can use separate photo utilities to sharpen and correct for noise as they wish.  These specific camera controls can ruin any photo larger than 3x5.  Noise in this camera, even uncorrected, is acceptable at the lowest iso although it rapidly becomes objectionable with even modest iso increases.  Low noise larger sensor (eg DSLR) cameras and superzoom cameras are mutually exclusive.  Superzoom lens acrobatics are only possible because of the tiny size of their respective sensors. As technology advances, these smaller sensors will improve.  Years ago, professional photographers would sneer at 35 mm cameras but now most pros use them or more likely their digital equivalents.  I believe that the professional cameras with superzoom ranges will likewise become common.

Reviews.Title: Excellent under all conditions
Reviews.Author: Hernan Desio
Reviews.Content: We found this camera looking for ones capable of taking good pictures under low light conditions (my wife loves to take pictures in live concerts).  It is great!!!  Great zoom, excellent picture quality & definition, and the pictures under difficult conditions are excellent!!!And the amount of features it has is amazing!!! (still didn't use many of them).  It is very difficult to take wrong pictures with it.The only cons I found are that it was a bit pricey (not much) and some of the features are hard to understand.  But once you get use to it, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Won't weigh you down!
Reviews.Author: Cathy Dudley
Reviews.Content: I started with the DMC-ZS3. I loved that original Lumix camera! Since then, I have updated a couple times and have just purchased the ZS20. If you want something small and compact with a great zoom lens and good picture quality, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: BEST EVER
Reviews.Author: Filipe Fumaux
Reviews.Content: I had a ZS3 and change for it. Best thing I did.Quality of pictures are much better than my old one.Movies and their sound are perfect.Zoom awsome.I used it a lot at my last vacation at Orlando, FL

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Bryan Jackson
Reviews.Content: We always said we never had a camera around with good video.  This one is perfect.  The pictures are crisp and the video is great.  We have our phone cameras, but wanted something better for the events in life.

Reviews.Title: Great size, great photos!
Reviews.Author: Bibi
Reviews.Content: This camera does exactly what we wanted it to do -- it takes great photos!  Its compact size is convenient enough to pop in a small bag and carry it along every day.  The photos are crisp and clear.  The zoom is an added bonus and works well.  Super happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: exelente
Reviews.Author: Victor Hugo Torres Richol
Reviews.Content: muy bueno lo recomiendo muy responsable en la entrega lo recomiendo ampliamente articulo de primera calidad estoy satisfecho por la compra

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - Unbeatable Price & Performance!
Reviews.Author: William Cheb
Reviews.Content: I've owned a number of 'point & shoot' shirt pocket cameras, but this Panasonic is by far the best...not only from what I've had, but from what I've seen.  From my point of view the Lumix ZS20 has many major plus features.  The 20X optical zoom is phenominal, particularly with the image stabilization at full zoom.  There's not a hint of camera shake.  The GPS image tag is very useful when you can't recall exactly where the pic was taken.  You should be aware that battery life is shortened when the GPS function is turned on.  The camera is capable of taking full 1080P movies with stereo sound.  I recently put this to the test while on a storm watching trip to the west coast of Canada.  The movies taken of the huge waves crashing against shoreline rocks were nothing less than spectacular and the sound was equally impressive.  One of the things I like the best with this camera is the ability to take hi res still pictures in widescreen format.  We're all used to seeing movies is widescreen, so why not still pictures as well.  Looking at your still shots in widescreen is very impressive indeed.  The camera's ability to take stills in 3D is also excellent...much better than I would have thought.  This feature is very nice to have if you have a 3D TV.  And you can also view your 3D shots in normal 2D if you don't yet have a 3D TV.  The camera has a mini HDMI port which can be used to connect it to one of the HDMI ports on your TV or AV receiver to allow you to view your pictures and movies on the big screen.  I have a Panasonic large screen 3D TV and as soon as I connected the camera to it, the camera and TV recognized each other and set things up for viewing pictures.  And this also allows you to control the TV AND camera using the TV's remote control...how cool is that!After all is said and done, I would say that the Lumix ZS20 is one of the best bangs for the bucks currently on the market and I would have given it a 6 star rating if I could.

Reviews.Title: Love Lumix
Reviews.Author: Nicole O'Keefe "Story Collector"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Lumix product.  They are small, very functional, lightweight and easy to use.  Tlhe pictures are great.  What more can I want from a camera...

Reviews.Title: excellent lens
Reviews.Author: Menotyou
Reviews.Content: well, made easy to use, BUT SW on included DVD is incompatible with Apple products.  I suggest Panasonic get in gear to have this SW compatible with MAC platform---or they will lose a percentage of their customers.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: maria v
Reviews.Content: I love this camera more than ever, it was a very good choice. I've been using it also in a professional way, I can do big impressions the size of the wall, and the quality of the photography is very good. The zoom is excellent . I do recommend it ! I am a graphic designer and have been using this camera to create posters and some other big impression stuff. Great camera ![...]

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: ADEYEMI ADETOYE
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I haven't been able explore it's potentials. The little unleashed excite me all the times. I feel like snapping pictures at every opportunity. Kudos to Panasonic for this. The price is too good to be compared. However, charging limits user's freedom to a space.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Danilo
Reviews.Content: What a surprise that a point and shoot camera that i bought for my wife who does not know much about photography was so good and advanced that I have taken it many times to take some pcitures. The zoom lens is extraordinarily long.Pictures are clear and with the setting of IA she never misses.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Underrated Pocketcam
Reviews.Author: J. E. Samms
Reviews.Content: I'm getting great results from my new ZS20 which does a very good job automatically and a far better one after you've become accustomed to shooting manually when necessary. The zoom in a camera of this size is simply amazing and the scene modes are also outstanding.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: THOMAS J BLANKEN
Reviews.Content: I had a Panasonic Lumix for many years and as a bicyclist it was used hard and never failed.  I wanted a new camera as good but with all the new technology.  I am thrilled and surprised on how much better it is than my old one.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Gwen Bloms
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is fast and is great for kids that don't stay still.  You push the button and there is no lapse - the picture is taken instantly  The zoom is so amazing. The flash has a very large range which I love.  I can zoom in across the room and use the flash and the pictures are perfect.  We have noticed that walls, colors of furniture, etc seems to always be the color they are in real life. I have not had a camera that is that right on on the colors before and I have had some good cameras to compare with. It has a lot of scene settings which I love and each setting really does what it says it does.  I love having a panoramic setting that does everything itself.  We just got back from Mexico and I got beautiful pictures.  It takes long videos which is amazing. The battery life is very long.  Panoramic pics and videos naturally use more battery life.  I did buy an extra battery because I do not ever like having a dead battery in my camera. I thought I would need it in Mexico with all of our sight seeing but I never did need to use it. I bought this camera because a friend has an older model of this camera and I saw some of the pics from their vacation and really liked what I saw.  She took a pic of the kids on a water ride at a water park and it was perfect.  No wait for the picture to take once you push the button with this camera.  This camera is a tish larger than a lot of the compact point and shoot cameras but I actually like the size better because it's easier to hold. It is still small though!  The one and only thing I do not like is that the camera has to be charged with the battery in the camera plugged into a cord to the wall.  Eventually I will buy the charger that I can put the battery in so I can go about taking pics with my other battery in the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera.....however,
Reviews.Author: D. Sheriff "DS"
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera and met my expectations.  However, the battery life is too short.  When taking pictures my batteries (I had 2 of them) kept being used up, even after having in the charger all night.  They improved on the camera but fell short on the battery.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary A Bauer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had the two features I was most interested in.  Continuous shooting and excellent zoom capability.  I couldn't be more pleased.  This is the second Panasonic Lumix I own and I am definitely a Panasonic customer for life!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix is likeable
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon user so I knew there would be a bit of a learning curve, but I'm working through it because of the great reviews I read here and in photo mags. And it does have a Leica lens. So far I'm satisfied with the quality of the photos. The camera has a good feel in my hands. It's not too small and there's a grip area. Yet it easily fits into a pocket. I wanted the camera for hiking so it's light weight and 20X zoom are perfect. I would have rated this higher, but figuring out some of the features is not intuitive and the mini manual and the one you have to print out were not very good. I couldn't figure out how to change the settings for Manual and Aperture or Shutter priority and in the book it just said to select the setting, but not how to do it! The 3" screen is sufficient however the icons and settings are very small. Video is incredibly clear with great sound. I purchased a charger and extra battery. Overall I'm pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: James Ashton
Reviews.Content: I have owned five Canon Elph point and shoot cameras (pocket cameras like the SD300, 400, 1100, etc.), but finally gave up on the stability control with the latest model we use at home. I have also had a Canon G2, an Olympus C8080 (replaced the G2) that I still use and an Olympus SLR, that I continue to use. I bought the Panasonic after reading many reviews.The pictures are almost as good as any camera that I have had. The stability control is much better than the Canon, which was my major complaint with the last camera. I have not had issues with the battery life, but I don't spend the whole day taking pictures either.Our only criticism of the camera is it's color rendering, which we have found to be inaccurate at times.I would highly recommend this camera to any level of user, based on it's very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Everyday Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Chris Leow
Reviews.Content: When I want the highest image quality, to shoot in low light, or for full control, I use my Nikon D3s with a variety of lenses. When it is not convenient to bring along my big DSLR + a bag of lenses, I would then take my Canon G1X which offers great image quality and a very useful swivel screen although not operationally quick and not quite pocketable. And when being pocketable is essential, I use my Canon S90. However, none of the above offered the 20x zoom and built-in GPS flexibility in such a light and pocketable package as the ZS20.The Panasonic's iA mode works great for quick point and shoot, the GPS locks fairly quickly (way way faster than my Olympus TG-810), the full HD 60p movie recording mode in stereo is really simple to use with a button press, the easy mega zoom helped capture quickly squirrels and birds up in the trees plus events from behind barriers, and the lens stabilizer did its job (important given the long zoom and narrow lens aperture). I also really enjoyed using the panorama scene mode, appreciate its 24mm wide angle lens, and compact form for all the features it contained. I should also add that it's quite robust - I accidentally dropped it almost 3ft onto a concrete floor and other than a tiny dent at a corner and a mark on the LCD screen near the dent, all was well and I was sure thankful.Naturally, the image quality cannot compare with DSLRs, my G1X and even my S90 due to the smaller sensor size. That is as expected and not a disappointment. The jpegs look a little bit better than from my TG-810 in that the noise reduction application seem less heavy.This camera is meant for everyday, carry everywhere, inconspicuous, fun use, and I see it filling that role well. It's so small and easy to carry with lots of extra features that I'll likely bring it along even when taking my D3s or G1X.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Performance from Small Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Johnson "happy camper"
Reviews.Content: I am a long time fan of Lumix cameras because they provide Leica lenses with wide zooms at competitive prices versus Leica cameras.  This little camera packs a lot of sophisticated features and takes great shots.  It is ideal for casual pocket carry.  The 20X zoom with image stabilization gives you the ability to capture subjects at great distance with good quality.  Only complaint is that small cameras have small buttons and these become more difficult to operate as I get older.  I will probably use this camera in automatic mode most of the time and use a DSLR when I want to be "creative".

Reviews.Title: A happy novice - love the camera, not thrilled with the software
Reviews.Author: paulfj
Reviews.Content: There are much better, more technical reviews here I strongly suggest reading. I'm pretty much a point and shoot person. However, the camera has done a fantastic job. We've captured pictures we've already dreamed of prior to owning this camera. Our priorities were 1) fast, continuous shooting, 2) small form factor, 3) fast turn on, 4) affordable. At $200 (Lightning Deal) it fits in a pocket, is ready to shoot within 2 seconds (about the time I can focus on my subject), and can take full megapixel shots forever at 2 fps with burst modes available. The only reason for 4 stars is the software that maybe I haven't figured out yet. I really don't like that pictures taken in burst mode are put in individual subfolders. Thus, if shooting an event I take 20 bursts, I have 20 subfolders to go through. I'd much rather have just 1 folder. My solution is to not use their software and directly transfer from the SD card.

Reviews.Title: If you don't need GPS buy the ZS19
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: This product is good and Panasonic is a good camera. I have had some Panasonic models earlier and they are all good. In particular the Wide Angular and the Zoom is something I love. However if you don't need GPS get the Z19 and you may save some money.

Reviews.Title: Good feature range
Reviews.Author: Shals
Reviews.Content: I've always been a Panasonic fan. All my cameras are Panasonic. After using an FZ28, I wanted a compact PnS but wanted to keep the super zoom feature, so the ZS20 seemed ideal.I love the on-board features, and enjoy playing with the toy / miniature feature. I also like the panorama mode. Even night shots are pretty good for a simple user like me.The reason I'm not giving it a perfect 5 is because I'd just only fooled around with my father's the Galaxy Camera (which he bought after I'd gotten this ZS20), and the colors were way better on the Galaxy (especially under low light situations), and the body of the camera is slightly bulkier than I expected it to be. Otherwise as a PnS superzoom camera goes, I'm pretty satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Love the Stabilization
Reviews.Author: Angela Kelly
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the camera I was looking for.  An easy to use smaller version of those "professional" grade cameras.  My sister has the exact same one and loves it.  She takes amazing pictures.  Probably my favorite part of this camera is the stabilization feature.  You can be in 20 below weather trying to take a picture and you're shaking but the camera takes a clear shot.  I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Oh yeah!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The first one I ordered had a scratch on the sensor.  The return and exchange went smooth.  So after that initial hiccup, I love this camera!  It takes good video in low light situations.  The interface is intuitive and well-organized.  Picture quality is excellent!  This camera is just as good if not better than the larger prosumer digital cameras.  I don't see the need to carry anything around that is bigger than this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Great everyday camera and fast for taking pictures off our 2 year old. Would buy a Lumix again and the zoom is incredible also the blast feature

Reviews.Title: Best movies
Reviews.Author: Doc "lizarddoc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the video.  It is better than our dedicated video camera (a sony that is only 2 years old).  The video is great when the subjects are moving alot and the sound seems to be perfect.  Low light can get grainy but regular indoor light is fine.The pictures are OK and the camera size is small so we can take it everywhere (especially when I am not carrying my SLR).

Reviews.Title: Working great
Reviews.Author: Johnny Tech
Reviews.Content: The camera works great and all features work nicely.  Has many nice features and works as expected. Panoramic, touch screen and other features all work wonderfully and fast.

Reviews.Title: excellent small size and poweful camera
Reviews.Author: Carlos Ponzinibbio
Reviews.Content: it is an amazing camera, with a superb zoom, high quality imaging and with many functions, some of them not explored yet, as HD video

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in photo quality
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Woods
Reviews.Content: I have to agree 100% with the review by "Sierratango" on this one. I wish I would have taken his advice before actually purchasing this camera. I thought...maybe I'll be like the other 75% of these reviews and just love this camera?" but NO. The actual camera is very nice...I loved the feel of it, the looks of it, the size of it, etc. But the most important part...the actual photos...were extremely disappointing. I had an old Kodak point and shoot that was a 4 mega pixel and the pictures on that camera are so much more clear and bright. I'd open up photos from that old camera in Adobe Photoshop and compare them with the photos taken with this Panasonic (which has 14 mega pixels) and the Panasonic's were very pixelated and grainy. The colors had a yellowish tint to them, as well. I even had a few printed to see if I could see the difference in the the actual prints and you can indeed see the difference. I just returned this camera. I am just bummed that my old camera (that I had for about 8 years) broke and I have to figure out what camera to get now. I still don't know what I am going to get...but I do know that I want it to have the same photo quality as my old Kodak. What I have learned is that the number of mega pixels does NOT matter (when it gets past 7 mp anyway) Just because this one has 14, doesn't mean it takes better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Corrine DiPietro
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!!!  My daughter loves it and it takes grrrrrreat picture, they are soooo clear and vibrant.  Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!
Reviews.Author: Max Coello
Reviews.Content: Its an excellent camera!!  100% Happy with this.  Nice pictures and quality. Great size. great price.I would only add Wi Fi ot it

Reviews.Title: Good Buy, Fair but not great Camera
Reviews.Author: Roy Hovey
Reviews.Content: Fair little camera with a lotta features, and a great Amazon buy.  Panasonic continues to lag behind the competition though is image quality - printed and otherwise.  Noisier photos at larger sizes and ISO settings.  Photos blur more easily too.  Good beginner camera, but far from the best long-zoom pocket cam out there (I've owned or test 3 other leading brands).

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: T. D. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Good for travel with great zoom feature.  Has GPS to tag location to photos.  Menu is easy for set up and pictures are sharp.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Adam12345
Reviews.Content: This camera takes incredible photos, even on the automatic setting.  The menus are mostly intuitive, the GPS sometimes drains the battery (but can be turned off, obviously), but the pictures are amazing.

Reviews.Title: Lovely light camera and good pictures
Reviews.Author: Brenda Morris
Reviews.Content: I have not stressed it's capabilities.  I have just used the automatic setting to take point and shoot family photos.  They come out fine.

Reviews.Title: Neat and compact for travel
Reviews.Author: Flower Girl
Reviews.Content: Pros:  I was very impressed with the many features packed into a small camera.  I was particularly impressed with the ease of switching from regular photos to movies and the clarity of the pictures.Cons:  Too easy to take photos by mistake.As a novice, I am still learning the camera and would be better prepared at a later date to give a full rating.  I am still trying to find out how to play back my movies in Picasa.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't have done better!
Reviews.Author: GEORGE H. MCPHATTER "George Howard McPhatter"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It replaced my Panasonic DMC-ZR1.  You can actually see the difference in the pictures that I took with the ZR1 and the ones I've now taken with the ZS20.  A couple things I like the most are the GPS and the 1080 versus 720 mode which the ZR1 was.  The only complaint I have is that I need to read the owners manual to figure out how to take movies with it!  LOL.  The ZR1 actually had a setting when you turned the knob on the top of the camera that specifically said "Motion Picture" mode; unfortunately the ZS20 doesn't so, like I said, I'm going to have to study the owners manual to figure it out.Other than that, I'm loving this camera!  I gave my ZR1 to a buddy who didn't have any experience with a digital camera so he's loving it.  I think the last camera he used was one of those Polaroids where you take the picture, the camera "spits" it out the front, then you shake it to get it dry and develop, LOL!

Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Scott
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures and owning cameras since the early 1970's, and even did professional work for a few years long ago.  I have owned a number of Nikon film cameras and a D80 digital camera with the big 17 to 200 Nikon zoom lens.  I had a darkroom for a number of years as well.As the digital camera age came upon us, I first purchased a small Canon, then a bigger Canon, and then the Nikon D80 rig.  The D80 is able to shoot several pictures with one push of the shutter and takes excellent pictures.  The problem with this camera is that it is difficult to take along with you all the time.I started looking for a small pocket sized camera in 2009.  I always said "When they make a Camera that is 28 to 280, with about 10 Megapixels, has a big screen, and has good Macro, I am going to buy it.  I studied what was available back then and after checking out several at local camera stores, I purchased a Panasonic TZ5 in 2009.  It had all the features (9 MegaPixels instead of 10) and for 3 years, I carried it with me in my pocket or laptop bag, and shot many excellent pictures the world over with it.I had heard that the Pansonics have build problems.  Sure enough, the power switch quit working on the TZ5 in mid 2012, after three years of shooting.  I called Panasonic and the said it would cost $190 to repair this camera.  Wow!  I guess Panasonic is committed to us moving our cameras out every three years of so.  The choice between fixing my TZ5 for $190 or buying  the new ZS20 for $210 was a no brainer.The ZS20 is a great improvement over the already excellent TZ5.  It has more megapixels, shoots better movies, has rapid shutter releases, so that you can shoot 10 frames on one push of the shutter.  It is also smaller than the TZ5.  There are many options on the ZS20, so many that it takes awhile to get familiar with them.  You can easily point and shoot right out of the box and with the truly excellent telephoto capability, your long range pictures will be wonderful.  Also the built in macro is excellent as well.  But with so many options, it takes a while to become competent with this camera.  The supplied manual is truly minimal; I guess Panasonic favors the learn by trying the buttons approach, which I do not prefer.I have two items I do not like about this camera.  First, it only came with an In-Camera charger.  Second, when you are recording, the in-camera mike is not that good, and there is no way to attach an external mike.All in all, the ZS20 is a terrific camera for the size and price.  The 25mm wide angle and the 24X optical zoom provide such an impressive range for such a small camera.  The 14 megapixels is also amazing for a camera this  size.  For those looking for a gigantic improvement over a smart phone camera or a terrific pocket or laptop bag camera that you can take anyware,  the ZS20 is hard to beat.  The quality of the pictures this camera produces is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!!
Reviews.Author: Janie Sawyer
Reviews.Content: This is my second Lumix camera.  I bought my first several years ago and loved it but I wanted something smaller.  I love this camera.  It takes excellent pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Rose M. Griffith "Rose M Griffith"
Reviews.Content: It replaced a three year old Sony that was constantly problematic. This Lumix with its gps feature is perfect for people who travel as frequently as we do--whether around Pittsburgh or in Europe (my husband does sales work there).
