The gps feature makes it easy to tag the photos with the proper places.We also cook a lot and are great fans of adding photos to our recipe program. The SCN (scene) feature has a food tool that works great. As does the nighttime photo option.It is light and small, but that doesn't stop the zoom features from working great. To sum up: there's nothing we dislike about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Portable Camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I always carry a camera with me for those unexpected opportunities as a backup to my Nikon D300. So based on the recommendations of CNET I purchased this full featured 'point and shoot' camera which has GPS with maps, panorama, HDR and many other features, along with the iA, P, A, S & M modes. The 1080p with stereo microphone capability works extremely well and can take advantage of the 20X zoom. Do get a good sized SD card as you will want to download the GPS map onto the camera to get more details on your location when taking pictures.  It has a lot more features and capabilities then the Casio EX-H10 which I have used for many years. The only thing I miss is the battery life of the Casio. I would go for months without having to charge the battery. This is clearly not the case with the ZS20. The GPS feature alone has an impact on battery life; however, you can turn off the GPS feature when not needed. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: just the Point and shoot you want to have
Reviews.Author: JanA "Jaugi"
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd panasonic Lumix and we are happy with this one as we where with all the others. Actually, there are enough well written reviews about the ZS20 here, that you should read. I only wanted to add a 5star review for this Camara as it is great. The zs20 is the perfect for us. The iA makes it a very reliable point and shoot and the different manual settings give you even some space for getting caritative. Actually I learned using manual focus, shutter speed, and  aperture on this Camara and have to buy a SLR now to have more room to play with! So be warnt,- the dz20 is that good, that you maybe get forced to make the next step upwards.Another thing I have to mention the GPS. We are traveling a lot and we really love to later have see with google maps where the shot was taken.Cons: Well, it is hard to find some but here is on: The Camara needs a long time to start up when you are in view mode and turn the zs20 on (at least when you use a large SD card).  Switch to photo mode before turning the Camara on if you need to make a shot fast.We have a lot of fun with the zs20. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended
Reviews.Author: Big80s
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a superzoom (20x minimum) that was small enough to travel with, with minimal shutter lag.  I have a full body camera, but it has shutter lag issues, and is very heavy to travel with. This camera has been amazing.  What is even more amazing is that it takes great 1080p video at 30 fps as well.  I could rave on and on about how great this little camera is, but I highly recommend it.  I have been very pleased, and have recommended it to friends, who've also bought it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible battery life
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a short period, but got to test it out at a friend's wedding...BAD BATTERY LIFE!!! The camera stopped working after the ceremony, an hour later! I left it charging all night to make sure it was ready. I'll give it one more chance but so far not very impressed.

Reviews.Title: quality and compact!
Reviews.Author: V. Teel "stitching g'ma"
Reviews.Content: I had an earlier version of the Lumix that served me well but it was time to upgrade.  I liked this one because of the GPS feature as well as more pixals.  It is about the same size as my old Lumix but thinner.  With the GPS the camera is a little heavier than I thought it would be but not excessive.  I have not used all of the features but have tried the panoramic feature and it works great!  It clicks several photo as you press the button going from left to right and it takes all of the images and puts them into one panoramic shot.  Awesome.  Easy to use.  Also has a feature where you do not have to take out the battery to charge it.  You can plug the cord directly into the camera and it will charge.  It takes a mite longer this way but I like the convenience. You can also plug the camera directly into your computer without removing the little card.  However, probably because I am not a computer whiz, I did not find this easy to do.  It was hard to retrieve the photos on the computer.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for something small enough to fit in your pocket!!!
Reviews.Author: Blk_Panther
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 3 months ago to replace an old Canon Powershot. I can say this is the best point and shoot camera I have ever used. I bought a 32GB card for it, and never ran out of space. Even on full days. I also bought 2 extra batteries with it, which are not needed very often. The battery last most of the day just taking pictures, and shooting full HD video, it will last for close to an hour. The video quality is awesome, with very good sound quality. You can ever capture pictures while shooting video. There are so many 'Scene' settings on it that there is one for just about anything. It even does a pretty decent job of taking dark of night photos. They can sometimes come out blurry, but not if you hold fairly still. I also found the zoom feature was not only great for taking far away pictures, but it works as binoculars too in some cases. I haven't had a chance to use manual focus for very close objects yet, but even using auto focus on close objects comes out very good.I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a quality product that is small enough to carry around with you all day, but has many of the features as a bigger much more expensive camera. I don't like carrying around bulky items with me, and this is no bigger than a phone.

Reviews.Title: Wife friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Great camera easy to use... bought it to replace an outdated point and shoot for the wife so she can finally leave me alone during our Carribean cruise. Shocked me that she actually mastered it by the end of the trip. Sharp pictures, very wide angle lense GPS and a 40X zoom. What more can you ask for in this price range. Same camera was $275.00 at Costco.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: Ted Montgomery "vtgomery"
Reviews.Content: After extensive research over two weeks, looking at dozens of similar products, I became convinced that this was the near perfect fit for my use.The video recording abilities of these types of cameras have come a long way and I have now sold my Sony HDR-SR10 and plan to use only this camera for casual video recording. It has a better color and better lens than my Sony.The menu is far more intuitive that both the Sony HDR and a Nixon Coolpix that I used to own.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Love It.
Reviews.Author: Ghiri
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome photos in the IA mode.  My brother took it on a three week vacation in Europe and came home with wonderful photos.  He liked it because he could keep it in his pocket.  It has a long zoom range.  Batteries last a long time.  I like to bring it horseback riding.  I can hang on to it with the strap and take photos and video while I'm running up a hill.  Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Totally disappointed with this camera! (coming from a Panasonic Lumix fan)
Reviews.Author: Porcheto "porcheto"
Reviews.Content: I've been a Panasonic Lumix fan ever since I bought the TZ5 in 2008. It's been a great camera so far - took it to numerous vacations, kayaking, diving and so on and it made wonderful pictures. The screen stopped working a few weeks ago, so instead of fixing it I decided to upgrade to the new Panasonic Lumix ZS20. I was so satisfied with the the TZ5 that I had high hopes for the new Lumix. I bought it mainly because of the 20x zoom, because I thought that the pictures will be as good as my old TZ5 at least. Not at all. I took hundreds of pictures in bright daylight, perfect conditions and all the pictures turned out with so much noise! I am an experienced photographer ( I also have a Digital SLR Canon 40D) so it was definitely not something that I was doing wrong. I tried all the settings, even updated to the new firmware, but I still get the same noisy pictures. The noise is visible even looking at the picture on a small 14'' screen. Cropping, of course, is impossible. I'm giving 2 stars only because the camera has many features ( like GPS - which I don't really use, manual settings for aperture and shutter and nice touchscreen that works fine). It is also smaller and lighter than the TZ5 I was used to. Other than that it is not worth buying. Big disappointment from Panasonic. I am planning to give it to a friend, who has been taking pictures with her phone so far, so that it will be a big improvement for her. For myself I bought the new Canon Sx50- 50x zoom - but I still have to see how it will turn out to be. I will also fix my old Lumix TZ5, so that I have a pocketable camera.

Reviews.Title: takes great pictures ;)
Reviews.Author: maddog1945
Reviews.Content: all i can say is wow. this camera is a must . i was not expecting this camera to be this good. if you like taking pictures of moving objects like i do. this camera rocks for that ? i was looking for a good camera for like 6 months and did a-lot of research. and i finally got this one. i live in Washington state near Seattle. and i had to wait for a nice day to go out and take some pictures. but once i got the chance, i was out the door once the sun came out. and i went to my favorite place to go. i went to Boeing in Everett . WA. to take some pictures of some jets . and the high speed on this camera is awesome. i took pictures of 747's taking off and landing and 787's as well i was totally amazed by this little camera. and win i was at Boeing i saw all these people have those really big long linz camera's and i pulled my camera out and i felt like i had no chance getting a picture like they got. but after everyone took pictures. i asked a few guys to com pair pictures with there camera's, and they were really impressed by this little guy. my pictures turned out better then there $1,500 dollar camera pictures. so do your reviews. and make your choice. I'm giving this camera a 10 stare if i could but you can only do five here lol ?

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-Zs20 Camera
Reviews.Author: MarJoe
Reviews.Content: My 3rd Lumix: Not as thrilled as I expected to be. Too many manual modes; only 1 pre-set scene mode button. But it takes gorgeous pictures on Intelligent Auto, panoramic is fun, zoom is amazing, plus in the scene mode there are choices my previous cameras didn't have (but because only 1 scene button, can't pre-set more than 1). Have not tried the GPS yet, but expect to have fun with it, too. What's a real problem is the computer photo program: PHOTOfunSTUDIO. Had an earlier version (3.0) that was simple, easy to use, fast, and effective (but had a glitch on my computer that couldn't be fixed). This program is SLOW; takes more than a minute just to open, requires repetitive and duplicative clicks for what should be one or two step processes. Video clips are hard to find (need to refresh every time I upload one). It is nice to be able to pull out still photos from videos, though.

Reviews.Title: a retired consumer
Reviews.Author: John Yu "JOHNHYU"
Reviews.Content: Good camera. Only GPS unit takes too much battery and need to recharge too often. I suggest to buy some extra battery if you like it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera on telephoto with motion
Reviews.Author: Sally S
Reviews.Content: Huge improvement.  We just got back from vacation and took excellent telephoto pictures from a moving bus and cruise ship.  LOVE this camera!!!(We had a previous model of this camera that took great pictures except on telephoto.)Great improvement.  Couldn't ask for more in a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!
Reviews.Author: lloys
Reviews.Content: I got the order on time. I had to upgrade to this camera and I have to say I'm in love with it.

Reviews.Title: Like a Leica
Reviews.Author: G. G. Lopez
Reviews.Content: Compare this camera's features with that of a Leica 18176 V-LUX 40 14.1MP. You'll find everything here that the Leica has. Am very impressed with it's picture quality (though I'm really not a qualified expert). The same goes with ease of use and versatility. The real clincher here is it's lens. One can never go wrong with a Leica-made lens. As far as I'm concerned, it's a Leica at a fraction of the price!

Reviews.Title: great camera great optics
Reviews.Author: sg6jet6
Reviews.Content: Just the LEICA lens alone is worth the very small price for this gem of a caneraPlus 20x OZ and all the other great features it has

Reviews.Title: bob
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: Better than exected. Easy to used good battery life, nice zoom. Only thing I don't like is the power button. When I zip tht case closed it turns the camera on.

Reviews.Title: Terrific New Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dougg
Reviews.Content: The camera is everything I had hoped it would be and more!  The small size is perfect for travelling and takes wonderfully clear pictures and is super easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect LUMIX
Reviews.Author: G. Brown
Reviews.Content: Love it. Perfect, easy pics on Auto mode so far.Only complaint is that if you force flash off, it remembers that setting even if you turn it off, so I had to turn the flash back on after I missed 1 good picture opportunity.Easily connects to PC and recharges thru USB, genius!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: vballer73
Reviews.Content: I saw this camera in one of my photography magazines in " new releases" article. My wife saw it and said " I like that one ". She had an older Lumix that all of a sudden stopped working. So I purchased this one to replace her old one. The features this camera has are incredible, it has all the mode selections my dslr has, manual, shutter priority, aperture priority, program shift, 2 custom settings and of course the auto mode and scenery mode. I have yet to try the 3d mode. It also has stereo microphone on top of the camera ! Haven't tried recording video yet. All in all, this camera is awesome. I use it more than my wife does and when I don't feel like lugging my dslr around.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Great long zoom camera for vacation or just taking a nature walk.  Excellent close up photo capability also. Fits in a purse!  Just wish it came with a neck strap instead of wrist strap.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Richelle Bloomquist "sc44z"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.  It's easy to figure out the functions and you don't have to carry the instruction booklet around!  The 20x optical zoom portion works flawlessly and the pictures are amazing!  It came when promised and was packaged well!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Ruben J. Pinamorales
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA!It is "THE CAMERA", it's resolution is the best point & shot that I ever had, the quality of the photographs is practically a professional job, it is not a joke!!!.I highly recommend it to all lovers of photography who, as I, only use the automatic mode.Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!
Reviews.Author: francis whalen
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic; excellent picture quality, easy to use, has a GPS that tracks where the photo is taken (automatically).  It easily fits into a pocket and turns on quickly.Why carry a big, lumbering camera that is slow, finicky when you can have excellent picture quality with one that fits in your pocket and allows you to enjoy the trip!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Matias Hï¿½ning
Reviews.Content: what can I tell about a camera with gps, 3d imaging, 20x optical and LEICA lenses?!?!?!?! I like its weight too...the images quality is impressive, totally happy!!!I'm in love with it...

Reviews.Title: REALLY AWESOME
Reviews.Author: .Xriss.
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect..! It's so easy to take a picture. If you want powerful zoom this camera is just for you..! Really really awesome and intelligent zoom is great..! You can get 80x zoom and the picture will not be blur at all..!I'm gonna buy another camera for my parents. You don't need even to read the manual to take great pictures. The gps works really great. Iloved this camera.

Reviews.Title: The best choice in the category
Reviews.Author: Jose M. C. Filho
Reviews.Content: It is simply the best cost-benefit camera in its category. Modern design, Leica wide angle lenses and a punch of resoucers like 20x zoom, full hd recording, Scene mode and much more. However, the Lcd display still seems to be quite fragile. I highly recommend Lumix Sz20

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera guy and a lot of the technical aspects others have mentioned don't do much for me.  I bought this camera as my son has moved from Little League to a full sized field and I want to be able to get good pictures when he is far out in the field.  The 20X zoom provides for excellent close-ups when he's batting, pitching, or playing in the field.  The High-Def video is sharp and better than our two year old video camera.  I especially like the "super slo-mo" option, which helps my son and I analyze his swing.  It's a great family camera for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: We really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly "Kell490"
Reviews.Content: We have had the camera for a few days now, and it is working great very fast focus, saves quickly, and I like how fast we can switch between video and still. I like the auto macro feature it is really cool.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: carlp
Reviews.Content: This camera successfully took wonderful pictures on a photo safari in Hawaii and stood up to the very heavy and expensive large cameras.  I wanted great quality with great ease of use and got it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic in all respects
Reviews.Author: Grady
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for several weeks in all manner of situations. The zoom is simply amazing. The display is superb. The low light performance (shutter speed) is outstanding. Video is great. I purchased and recommend an additional battery/charger and a 32 gig class 10 memory card.

Reviews.Title: More camara then we may need for the price
Reviews.Author: Raymond Gallop
Reviews.Content: This camara has more settings then I could ever use. the price is great and Panasonic made one of the best Digital canaras around.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: kac85
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to California later this summer.  I took it on a test run today at the local botanic gardens, and I was very pleased with its performance.  It does well in low light as well as well as sunny conditions.  The zoom is also impressive.  I could take pictures of insects from a few feet away and the pictures turned out great.Pros: Lots of settings to play with, zoomCons: None so far!

Reviews.Title: Mine was a lemon!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I worked pretty well for a short time. I can say that. A couple months out of warranty and I got a "System Error" readout on the screen and the camera would not function. I sent it to Panasonic for an estimate. They wanted $172 to fix it, essentially the cost of a completely new camera. Their customer service people were annoying and I struggled with them. This is a bad thing and I'm feeling ripped off.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but not as sharp as cheaper cameras
Reviews.Author: Ignacy Misztal
Reviews.Content: Pretty small for its capabilities and reliable. In difficult conditions it may take awhile to find settings for good pictures but it is possible. Movies look nice. The battery lasts long enough.GPS sometimes takes a very long time to lock. Also, pictures are not too sharp although they are sharp enough. I was surprised that Panasonic SZ1 takes sharper pictures. With a very large SD card, opening and closing seems to take a long time.In the end, I have not found a better camera for my needs

Reviews.Title: Panasonic vs Nikon
Reviews.Author: J. B. Bormann
Reviews.Content: Had both Lumix and Coolpix.  Both are nice, BUT, the Panasonic is my favorite.  Has SUPER good wide angle lens (Nikon not near as good),  HD recording quality is unbelievable AND the audio is excellent from such a small relative inexpensive camera.  Would recommend to anyone.After using it 'alot' for the past year, the zoom lever on top is sticking and makes it difficult to lock in on exact stopping point while zooming in or out.  I may have just used it too much?  Still would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Short lived
Reviews.Author: G. Garcia "Garcia"
Reviews.Content: The camera lens failed to extend 13 months after purchase, one month after the 12 month warranty expired. The display says “System error (zoom).”  It was only used on two vacations.  It was not mistreated or used in a harsh environment. Panasonic does not repair it.  Various procedures to extend the lens failed.

Reviews.Title: Amateur picture taker-- Here's the things I don't like
Reviews.Author: Madeline Leary
Reviews.Content: There are some annoying things about this camera that I feel are worth mentioning--1. The camera loses all charge when you leave it charging too long. It beeps to warn you when it already happened... honestly this is a HUGE FLAW. When I charge any device, I wanna leave it there til I'm ready to use it, not 'til it dies and is worthless. (I am charging on my computer's USB port by the way)2. The software that comes with the camera to sync is in my opinion complete crap. It doesn't know what pictures you already synced... When I sync all of them hoping it will realize what I already sync'd, it has no idea, copies all of them and adds (2) on the end of the file name. I might as well copy using Windows explorer.3. The shutter speed/picture taking speed is not that impressive for me-- I'm trying to take pictures of my dog and they turn out as a blur. I don't always want to switch to the burst setting to accomplish this.4. As an amateur using this point-and-shoot, I've noticed that any setting other than "Intelligent Auto" results in fuzzy pictures for me. Which is sad since there are lot of cool settings available.If you can look past these flaws it's a solid camera for me (just a regular person taking some pictures).

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Don C Reedy
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a week and have been very impressed with its quality. so far I have used it to just take pictures and video. This camera absolutely rocks. This is the first Panasonic camera that I have purchased. I have in the past purchased mainly Canon cameras. If you're looking for a camera that can do more than just take pictures. This is the one. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS20 cannot live long
Reviews.Author: dcChicago
Reviews.Content: I have to say the camera has great features but it has short life. I purchased it on June 22 2012.  But now the shutter wouldn't close tight and lens could not open any more "System Error (Zoom)". I took the camera to a trip in Ireland/England and it failed me greatly just one month after warranty. I ended up using my iPhone as my sole camera during the whole trip. What a disappointment. I guess the camera has a great optical zoom but the chance for it to fail is much higher than other cameras. So be careful, buyers. You have high chance to end up using it just for a year and may cost you $150 to repair and put you in a dilemma whether to repair it or buy a new one.

Reviews.Title: Faulty
Reviews.Author: Satya Pappu "book worm"
Reviews.Content: First of all, it keeps clicking pictures when you hold it a bit tight. You don't have to press the "Click" button to take pictures. Run your finger across the microphone/speaker and it will click a picture. So, in a photo-shoot of 3 pictures, you'll end up with some 15 pictures and have to delete the unwanted ones.Performance in low-light is not great. I bought this camera after reading its reviews in cnet.com. After a long and satisfactory history of Canon S series point-and-click cameras, I deviated for once and I regret it. I am selling it on eBay and getting a Canon S series.

Reviews.Title: the best "Lil" camera ever
Reviews.Author: donna
Reviews.Content: I was going to Costa Rico and my old camera had started pooping out on me.  My Husband previewed several cameras and decided on this Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS9 It took me awhile to learn the setting, but once I had them figured out, I came home with some beautiful pictures.  Even from a moving car or at a great distance, my camera took clear pictures.  The colors were perfect, no red eye effect at all.Love, Love it.*******I had entered the wrong camera code, The Panasonic I have above is the right camera. I just can't say enough about what a great camera this is,

Reviews.Title: Not nearly what I expected.
Reviews.Author: M. Turner "Mark T"
Reviews.Content: I'll leave image quality review to others and just say it's not as nice as reviews led me to believe.  You won't want to view them on your monitor at 1:1.  Luckily there's enough resolution, you probably won't have to.The amount of zoom is great!  That is certainly the best thing I can say about the camera.The GPS is essentially useless.  In the past, I've carried a hand-held GPS and geotagged my photos later.  I absolutely will still have to keep doing this.  If the camera's GPS manages to get a fix (and that's a big "if"), it doesn't update very often at all (maybe every four minutes at best but probably a whole lot longer).  I spent an hour walking in a wide open parking lot and it never updated once after the initial fix.  According to it, all the photos were taken in one spot.In the woods?  I hiked for around four hours, mostly on top of a mountain ridge with normal tree coverage.  The camera NEVER got a single GPS fix.  It can get one if you sit it on the dashboard of your car.  At least it can if you're in an open location.Also, if you want the GPS to be able to lock with any speed, you have to hook up to the internet once a month so it can update it's "assist" data. The first two days I tried, Panasonic's servers apparently were down.  On the third day it was successful.  Before the assist update, it couldn't get a fix while inside my house.  Afterwards, it could but keep in mind the assist data is only good for a month.  So, be prepared to do it on a regular basis.  Note the manual warns that the servers may be shut down some day in the future.  So, count on it taking a few minutes to get the first fix unless you've updated the assist data.As I mentioned previously, the GPS doesn't update it's coordinates in real time.  It looks like it tries about every four minutes at best, but often a lot longer.  Even then, it may not be successful.  You can force an update but be prepared to wait 30 seconds or so before taking your photo.  I'm sure the limited updating is to save battery power but it would be nice if Panasonic gave us a setting so we could tell it how often to update.Hey Panasonic, if it's a power issue then just don't have it update until somebody takes a photo.  Then update and tag.  Don't use coordinates that are an hour out of date!  I'd rather have no tags than ones that are incredibly wrong and misleading!I am also very suspicious that it doesn't quite understand daylight savings time.  This morning, it updated the coordinates.  I drove fifteen minutes.  When I looked at the status, it said it hadn't updated for an hour and 15 minutes!  I saw it do the same thing yesterday.  It updated at 1:00 but a short time later it said it hadn't updated since noon.Yes, you can view maps on the screen.  North America will take up 2GB of your SD card.  No, you can't just upload a state or two.  Don't count on using the maps like a car GPS unit.  It doesn't update your location in real time.  Maybe a few minutes later.  Maybe a few hours later.  Also, it shows little street detail until you zoom in quite a ways.  Unless Panasonic gives us an update, I'll probably just delete the map data.  It's pretty useless.So, if you're interested in this camera for the GPS, look elsewhere.  It's not at all like the GPS in your car or the one you take hiking.As for the touch screen.  I'll say it's at least as worthless as the GPS.  It seems to ignore touches when it shouldn't, but will notice touches that are unintended.  Trying to shot one-handed?  There's a good chance you'll touch the screen and send it into some mode where the shutter won't fire.  If I could turn off the touch screen, I definitely would.The screen looks nice in shade or low light.  In sun, though, it's nearly unusable.  There's no optical viewfinder, so you have to rely on the screen.No external charger?  What?!  That's just silly and cheap of Panasonic.  At least you can shop around Amazon and find one cheap (along with much cheaper batteries that work just fine).  You shouldn't have to buy it separate, but you can.The ability to pan while shooting a panorama is cool, but has limitations and aggravations.  You won't be shooting at high resolution!  Also, you'll probably have to try multiple times before you get the shot.  Even then, you'll probably find it cut off the end.  A full 360 degree panorama?  It can be done, but don't count on it happening on the first attempt.  Practice spinning in a circle in eight seconds.  Too fast and it'll give up.  Too slow and you won't make it back to the beginning.  Personally, I wish it had the older type mode where you splice images together on your computer.  With that old mode, you get much higher resolution.  Think you can do that with this camera?  If you're in auto-exposure mode, they'll all have different aperture and shutter settings.  Plus, you won't get on-screen overlays to see where to start the next shot.And what the heck is that little rubber flap on the bottom on the battery cover?  The manual gives no explanation.  Opening it up just gives a tiny view of the end of the battery.  Is that it's sole purpose?  Just to be able to see if there's a battery in the camera?  Most people will probably never even take the battery out anyway since you have to charge it inside the camera (unless you buy a bootleg charger).Overall, I'm pretty disappointed.  The giant zoom is very nice and the only reason I'm keeping the camera.  Panasonic could improve some of the problems with an update, but companies seem to abandon their products pretty quickly these days.  If they make a non-GPS and/or non-touchscreen version, definitely go that route.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera, but WARNING: Custom USB Cable
Reviews.Author: D. Haskins "AV and Gaming lover for over 40 y...
Reviews.Content: This camera has a single major flaw. I will be returning it for these reasons:1. It uses a custom USB cable to charge and exchange data (i.e. You can't readily buy a replacement just anywhere.)2. The camera MUST be charged from an electrical outlet - not a PC USB port.3. The included USB cable is only about 12 inches long.So, if you have travel with this camera, you will need to buy the longer cable in order to avoid leaving the camera on the floor of your hotel room (unless you're lucky and get a room with a desk outlet). The longer cable is only about $5 + shipping. Not a huge deal, right? But if, like me, you didn't realize it was custom until 2 days before your trip, you are stuck paying for overnight shipping.The manual, which I read online before I purchased, does NOT mention the fact that the cable is custom. So I assumed I could replace it with one of my existing 6' cables.I contacted the Panasonic service team who, knowing that I was leaving for Europe in two days, would not pay for overnight shipping of the longer cable.So 4 stars for the good camera, but minus 2 stars for the idiotic decisions to use a custom USB cable and then include only a 12" cable in the box.

Reviews.Title: Just as I expected, and as others reviewed it.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Griffin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera (ZS-20) to replace a Canon I bought new in 2006.  I was hoping to be able to take pictures like I see others do on FB using Instagram.  Some of those pictures look great.  I'm not sure how they do it.  I don't have complaints about this camera, but it doesn't seem to have that Instagram magic, at least in my hands.  I've only had it a week so far, and I'm still getting used to Panasonic's layout after owning a Canon for so long.  It isn't difficult, just a little different, with more options available on screen now.So far,..-- I love the panorama shots.  I'm happy with this camera just because I can not only take these types of photos, but they are easy to do.-- Battery life seems decent.  I bought an extra battery, and together, I haven't had a problem even though I've been constantly playing with settings, zoom, and even leaving the camera on with GPS enabled, because...-- ..the GPS tends to take some time to update itself, with the setting I have on, where the GPS is disabled after I turn the camera off.  Thus it needs to find itself again once you turn it on, which while traveling could be who knows where.  Consequently, just today, I ended up leaving the camera on after updating the GPS info (in lieu of just changing the GPS setting to be enabled even while the camera is off--that is backward on my part, I suppose).--I can see the typical description of Lumix point & shoot cameras giving grainy, but sharper (once blown right up) shots versus the too soft shots that Canon cameras give (again once blown up).  But if you want more, don't buy a little point and shoot.  Just check out the many reviews, like those at dcresource to see what I mean.  It is all RELATIVE.  I'm just saying I think I can see what they are saying, since it has been said.--Touch screen works well, but still prefer the buttons to take pictures, because I can do it with one hand (which this camera does have BTW).--Macro seems to work well, and really I haven't even bothered to select it in a few instances where I previously would have done so.--Just realized how well the zoom and I suppose it must be the image stabilisation, because this camera has much more zoom power than my previous camera, but it is much easier to use (minimal to no shake).  I'd put this in the category of things you don't immediately realize and appreciate.--The video seems to work well, as my little niece can verify. I like that there is a separate button for it; so, it can be selected at will at anytime instead of turning a dial to movie mode like on my old Canon.In addition, I haven't made an opportunity to try it at night yet.  Inside, the flash is plenty bright, but I want to try outside.  I'm really hoping this camera impresses me with what it can do with low light levels.  I'm also curious to see how the 3D pics turn out.  I've been taking a few with the thought that maybe one day I'll know someone who has a TV I can view them on.  Even if that someone is me!Finally, there are some Custom settings, but so far I think these are only for manual settings.  I hope, but don't think, I can set up Scene type shots to be my custom setting.  Right now, to shoot a panorama, I have to set the dial to Scene, and select Panorama if it isn't already.  But if I want a different type of Scene shot, like the special one for taking pictures through glass, I have to change my setting in the Scene menu.  I'd like to just have one of the Custom settings on the physical dial be set to panorama since I have been using it so often.  I'll have too look into it, and if you know the answer, let me know!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera. My second Lumix. They keep getting better
Reviews.Author: Craig S. Aberbach
Reviews.Content: The camera works flawlessly. Pictures are shap even in low light with out using flash.  The GPS feature is super for geo tagging photos while traveling.  The long zoom lens (why I purchased this model) is great!!

Reviews.Title: great lens, but two failures
Reviews.Author: Alicia C Duke
Reviews.Content: I purchased two lumix cameras.  highly impressed with the quality of photos and loved the zoom power.  unfortunately my camera ended up with black dots appearing on the pictures.  sent it back to for repair.  i was without a camera for 6 weeks ... twice!  Then when the black dots reappeared beyond the one year warranty I was told it was no longer under warranty.  same problem, third time, but wasn't covered.  I was given a run around by customer service each time, but at least was able to get it fixed two times.  If you buy this camera, get ready to talk with the repair center in McAllen, Texas.  Expect 20 minute plus hold times, incompetent staff, and in the end, you'll get to pay more for the repair than you paid for the camera.  DO NOT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: D. Thayer "Don Thayer"
Reviews.Content: The reason I didn't give this one 5 stars is actually a major one for me; it doesn't  have an optical viewfinder which is typical for most affordable non-SLR cameras.  I need glasses for reading (and seeing the view screen), but none for distance in which I mentally compose the shots.  This fumbling between no classes and glasses becomes distracting and frustrating (in a SLR, the viewfinder focuses at infinity).  Taking pictures is harsh light also presents problems in actually seeing the screen.  The camera is only two months old, so I can't comment on the how well it will hold up, but is does take amazingly sharp pictures (better than scanned 35mm slides and negatives).  The menu system seems complex at first glance but is actually easy to use.  One thing I really like is the view screen option of having vertical and horizontal lines for composing.  I have similar screens in stalled in my old film SLR's for architectural work.  This my first digital, so don't know it this is typical.  The software is adequate for snapshots but the picture editing falls short for serious work.  Of course you won't need and editing it your pictures are right to begin with.

Reviews.Title: Amazing zoom but still slow getting ready
Reviews.Author: rainer goltzsche
Reviews.Content: The zoom is amazing, much better than anything I could afford with my OM2.I had hesitated to buy a Panasonic after I had an opportunity a few years ago to compare one to my Ricoh caplio. The Pana was so slow in getting ready that I thought I would not even consider it ever. But the the zoom and a few other features and the price convinced me. In retrospect I have to say the Panasonic people could/should still learn a lot from the Ricoh people. some of the handling is less than simple and time consuming. Initially getting in shooting mode is still slower than the Ricoh managed about 8 years ago. I am not sure about the macro, the Ricoh had a 1 cm shortest and I think that is not been beaten here. It will take me some time to re learn some of the other functions.The Panasonic ZS20 gets 4 stars from me because I always wanted a zoom like his.Rainer

Reviews.Title: Nice travel-zoom.
Reviews.Author: AJH POSTIE
Reviews.Content: Bought at a super-bargain price! Amazing value for just over USD$160! Works well, with usual limitations for a camera in this pocket-travel super-zoom category. Lots of features.  Panorama mode stitching can be quite visible-depending on the lighting. In-camera charging takes around 4hrs! (painfully slow!)  Get a spare battery- and an OUT-of-camera charger if you plan to use lots!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Kieffer
Reviews.Content: I had an earlier, not as powerful version of this camera, and it was time for an upgrade.  Can't wait to explore the 3D picture options, and again, this camera has the zoom while taking video option which is vital for me and unusual to find.  And with many burst options and 20x zoom, I look forward to playing around with this camera at the dragstrip.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Lens stopped opening.
Reviews.Author: bufiegee
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera in the beginning.  The zoom was very good, but then after 10 months while I was hiking the AT, the lens would not open.  I did not drop it and I kept it on my belt.  By the time I checked with Panasonic, the 1-year warranty had run out.  They told me via their website chat that I would have to send it in to them and that the average cost is $180!!  I only paid $229 for it.  So I guess I've learned my lesson and into the recycling bin it goes!!

Reviews.Title: not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2012 after returning from a tour of Europe (3 weeks) because of the GPS function and zoom. After touring several countries and sorting through the thousands of pictures I decided I wanted a camera so my fiance now g/f at that time and I would not have to debate about where the picture was taken. So in April 2013 we went on a tour of Thailand (2 weeks) and that is why it took me so long to review it so I could really test it out.  I discovered that the GPS function while accurate after taking a several minutes to lock on to your location kills/drains your battery very very quickly. I mean I have two batteries for the camera and they will be dead in less than two hours between taking pictures and the GPS. The couple we traveled with had a camera with GPS and would last a whole day if not more on one battery, which was not much bigger than the one inside of this zs20. The zoom is great for such a small bodied camera. The pictures come out nicely and there are several shooting modes for every occasion. Guess the search will continue for a better GPS point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Dust in Lens after less than a week
Reviews.Author: Elias C.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It pains me to leave such a low rating. The features, Zoom, video quality etc. are amazing! I have never had to return a Panasonic product in my life before. After less than a week of using it I discovered dust in the lens which looks like sand particles. I am not happy. Amazon customer service is great, they are sending me a replacement because I really would like this camera to work out, but I will see if the next one has the same result. What is the point of keeping a camera that will take dusty photos? And I do not want to rip it a part and have to clean it myself. Sounds like an engineering defect to me. I called Panasonic. They suggested I send it the brand new camera to have it cleaned by them. No thanks. I will see how the replacement is. If it is the same end result I will just return the camera for a refund if not I will keep it. Like I said I really love this camera and researched for over a month before buying it. I really don't like the comparable Sony, or the Canon models. I will leave a more detailed edited review later.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. The features are amazing. From panoramic to HDR, this camera has a lot to offer, for the price.

Reviews.Title: Owner
Reviews.Author: N. Pervez
Reviews.Content: Very user friendly camera. Takes great pictures. I wish it had a view finder but then again this this a camera for a different generation.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1
Reviews.Author: Aguston L Jones Jr
Reviews.Content: Great camera, has an excellent design and feature set, love the ultrawide-angle 20x zoom lens, GPS, and semimanual and manual shooting modes, as well as fast shooting performance and improved low-light photo quality from previous versions.Using all of the ZS20's high-performance features, such as its near-pointless touch screen, can really cut into battery life. Also, photos are noisy and soft when viewed at 100 percent.

Reviews.Title: some modest issues
Reviews.Author: Fred Clancey "Fred Clancey"
Reviews.Content: According to p. 128 of Panasonic's instruction manual (included in the DVD) the camera's gps may not work in the presence of another device operating in the 1.5GHZ band which includes iphone 4s. Iphone 4 operates at 1.0GHz.  I see (via google ;) some 1, 1.2 and 1.5 GHz android phones out there but that's not an exhaustive search.An obvious attraction of this camera is the amazingly small form factor that accomdates a 20x optical zoom.  But one of the ways a small form factor was enabled is a very small battery which wouldn't be a large drawback if Panasonic had provided another method for charging the battery. But the travel chargers I've ordered AC Wall Charger + Car Charger Adapter for Panasonic DMC-FX700, DMC-FX75, DMC-ZR1, DMC-ZS1, DMC-ZS3, DMC-ZS5, DMC-ZX1, TZ6, TZ7  will hopefully work or ... I'll return to rewrite this sentence ;-)

Reviews.Title: Best pocket-sized camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: Nirmala Dindial "Amazon shopper maniac"
Reviews.Content: I read about and compared this camera for almost a month before I bought it. I was so ecstatic when I got it and pleased with every aspect of it. It is truly a TRAVELLER"S DREAM! Pocket sized, intelligent features for shaking, lighting etc and excellent zoom for a camera that fits into your purse or travel pouch.The GPS worked the first instant and then was having difficulty connecting with the satellites a couple times after. Do not worry, I think that sometimes indoors, it gives this little difficulty and sometimes in very inclement weather also.I am VERY HAPPY with my purchase of this camera and would recommend it to anyone wanting a good camera (with the added bonus of GPS - which you can turn off also).I am upset I paid $290.00 in May 2012 on Amazon and a week after it dropped to $260.00....but all in all STILL GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: ZS20, a nice step up!
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy Leadfoot "woodchopper27"
Reviews.Content: I have had this new camera for a bout a week now, and I like it. I had another digital camera, admittedly, a sub 100.00 model and this really makes a difference. I like having some adjust ability on the camera, tho' it's easy to just point and shoot, too. Great focus, which was an issue on my previous model (GE A830--it was a disappointing purchase). Super nice video, 1080p, looks great on my 35" tv. Night shots, no problem, AMAZING 20X optical zoom, different color maps to make the scenery pop out, or mute it down,  HDR effect, nice build. It was a little bit more than I wanted to spend, but I'm glad i did. Use it as a point and shoot, or get a little bit more creative, you will be happy w/ the result. get a big SD card, cuz it has next to no internal memory (1 14 meg pic) The files are big, even when you use a 10 meg pic size (about 4.5 megs per pic).Overall, I would recommend if you would like an above average point and shoot super zoom cam w/ movie capability.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Zidek
Reviews.Content: This camera does perfect pictures. Zoom works reliably. Camera has a large range. It is not very heavy and it is very good for holdinig in hands.

Reviews.Title: Sweet and compact
Reviews.Author: Merkin
Reviews.Content: I judge the ZS20 as a very nice package!Gadget freak here so I like complexity and this slippery little shooter can certainly be complex.This thing has many options and features that are still confounding yet keeping me interested.If the user needs simplicity it's there however the "iA" setting will easily bail anyone that becomes confused out.I stand in awe of the technology that resides in a camera such as this one.Sometimes we forget what photography was like just a few short years ago.At times we make incredible demands on an under $200.00 device like the ZS20.These cameras do so much with in device post processing and thru the lens thinking we may be excessively critical of output.I thank the hardware and firmware designers of these amazing devices for their hard work and the concessions they must make to please everyone!The Lumix line is one of the best!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Weiss "Be Alive and Vibrant"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my older Lumix because of the size. I liked my older one, but it was just cumbersome to travel with. This one does the same things and even better.  It is much smaller and easier to travel with and I find the pictures are even better than the older large version.  I was concerned about lag time.  My sister has a smaller version Lumix and she said her lag time was not the greatest.  I took a chance and I am not sorry.  This one is wonderful.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Capturing Memories
Reviews.Author: debolds89
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I'm not a pro at taking pictures. I honestly just point and click but I wanted a good, durable camera that wasn't my cell phone. I have had no problems with this camera and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS20: Great value in a point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Fred L. Rasp
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, easy to use, and delivers good pictures.  I believe it has been replaced in the product lineup, but I continue to be impressed with Lumix cameras, and this one did not disappoint.  It is great for putting in the pocket on a hike, or vacation.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Donna Sucheski
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!! The pictures are clear, the video is HD quality, the manual settings are great for concerts.  Very satisfied with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera
Reviews.Author: anita strandmark
Reviews.Content: Takes surprisingly good pictures. Sharp and with good color (I like to use the color setting that gives vibrant colors )It has more wide angel than most other models. Takes very impressive macro pictures.The only thing that doesnt really give good pics, is the panorama sliding function.Its my favorite camera for everyday use, and i use it a LOT !

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the traveller
Reviews.Author: Warren R. Hartwell
Reviews.Content: Takes great clear pictures.  Easy to handle and keep in your pocket.  Has many modes like panaramic and night shooting.  I searched for many months to get just the right camera for under $300 and I found it.  I am a fan of panasonic products having a home theatre and plasma TV in my home and they are the best products I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera, very happy customer
Reviews.Author: Christel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and in general the Lumix series. The zoom is very powerfull, it takes great night mode pictures and also captures great pictures although been in a moving transport.

Reviews.Title: Good, solid little camera
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Cannon DSLR for 6 years and love it, but needed a small camera to keep in my pocketbook for everyday shooting. This camera has not disappointed me. I have not printed any enlargements yet, but my photos look great on the computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Amazing product, A+++
Reviews.Author: Norman R Witte III
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best point-and-shoot cameras I've ever used. I'm still starting to explore the features, but I'm confident in this camera's ability to adapt to many situations. One of the things I love most is the audio quality. I took some video at a concert, and the sound was so loud that I could not hear what was going on very well. When I took it home I watched the video and I got to see and hear things that I didn't even know were going on. My original purpose for buying this camera was to photograph the aurora borealis in Norway. I did not get to see the northern lights, but I did get to mess around with the exposure, f/stop and ISO settings and I'm confident that I can find a setting that will allow me to capture that moment when it happens. The only downside for me is that it doesn't have bluetooth hookup to my phone. But the GPS is a nice feature to have too. And the quality of picture/video/audio, the Leica lens, and the fine-tune adjustments you can make on the fly far outweighed my ability to transfer photos wirelessly out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great point & shoot!
Reviews.Author: Barb Winters
Reviews.Content: This camera works well under normal, everyday conditions. I love the size and ease of use. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Joseph G.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. Great pictures. But too many unnecessary custom settings. GPS is fun, though not as intuitive as I'd hoped.

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Carole
Reviews.Content: I have bigger cameras but really like the size and compact feel of this camera plus it takes great pictures.  Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever had. Terrific.
Reviews.Author: LMS
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. Easy to use. Great features such as the burst. You don't miss anything with this camera. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera for the price, definately a great buy and great pics
Reviews.Author: Bradford Smith
Reviews.Content: Works  very well and after all the research online I am surprised it works even better than I hoped for. The real test will be a big trip we have planned, but so far the initial pics have been right on. It does take a little practice and I am sure it will get even better with time. I found the youtube videos by Graham Houghton were a big help.

Reviews.Title: Great once you learn the settings
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera a couple months ago before heading on a trip.  We weren't sure whether we would ever use the 20x optical zoom but it ended up being a very useful feature.  We got lots of very good pictures after learning how to use the presets.  Speaking of presets, they are pretty good but be warned that the scenery setting can leave a person a bit blurred and washed out.  Overall I am happy with the camera and would probably buy it again.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Halbert E. Ashworth
Reviews.Content: Usually pretty sharp photos. Able to put the date on them. Has a lot of features in a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera geek....it needs to either be simple or easily understood and this one is!  I love the pictures I can take with it, and actually I have over two years of pictures on my camera and the card isn't full yet!  It has lots of features that I thought were cool, but honestly I usually use just a couple of the settings or IA setting most of the time.  Have had absolutely no problems with it either, so good quality too!

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Jeff gable
Reviews.Content: small, powerful, good quality and the gps is a plus.  was given as a gift and have had good feedback.

Reviews.Title: Software provided with camera doesn't work
Reviews.Author: bascar
Reviews.Content: After owning this camera for more than a year, we recorded some videos.  The PhotoFun Studio software provided with the camera can't find the videos on the camera.  You have to use "my computer" on the PC and treat the camera as an external drive.  The videos will be hidden in a folder named "Private", and then you can transfer them to your computer.  Even worse, the .mts format used by the camera to record videos cannot be viewed using the Quicktime program provided with the camera.  I can play .mts using the Windows Media Player on my Windows 7 machine, but have to convert the .mts files to .avi format to run on my XP machine. BTW, the .avi format conversion won't play properly on my Window 7 machine, so I need two different video files, one for each operating system!  And my friends with Macs are still trying to find something that works.Boo on Panasonic for providing software that will not work with the camera, and forces camera owners to find back-door methods to get the darn thing to work.

Reviews.Title: Love the lens, hate the lens cover
Reviews.Author: Stanley R. Wilson
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Panasonic/Lumix digital pocket size camera over the past 8 years. That show I do love the camera picture quality....but on 3 of them, the automatic lens cover started to stick and fail to open completely some of the time.  That was a big reason why I bought the newer model, along with the ever-better zoom features.Panasonic/Lumix should really try to fix this lens cover problem.I've tried contacting them and they haven't responded. My latest is just 12 months old and the cover is starting to stick some times, giving some of my shots a peephole type of appearance, ruining them.  I can push the lens cover open when needed. But it's supposed to be automatic.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: S. Mitchell "samintx"
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer but I love to take pics on my trips overseas. It requires a good zoom. This camera does a great job with or without zoom. I checked the zoom against my Panasonic SLR 25x camera and it compared (clarity) very well. I only use Panasonic because I don't want to have to learn new icons and configurations. I have really been impressed with their cameras.

Reviews.Title: best
Reviews.Author: Soledad
Reviews.Content: great camera, easy to use, really a best value product. Zoom is excellent and also all the camera functions and the quality of the videos ans its audio.

Reviews.Title: good pics and video
Reviews.Author: M. Welsch "wuzaup"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister as a Christmas gift. She has a daughter and likes snapping pictures.  I think it has something to do with the good quality of it..  :)

Reviews.Title: Good but complex
Reviews.Author: nolato1
Reviews.Content: It is too complicated.  I had to call the camera store to format a new memory card.  It was buried deep in a sub, sub folder.  The other features take some getting used to, like touching the screen and getting a lot of ground shots.  The zoom knob is too touchy but the touch screen zoom is good once you get used to it.  Like all cameras without a viewfinder, the display is useless in sunlight.  You have to guess, shoot, shoot again.  I like the way it feels and the controls.  I'm sure that I'll like it more as I learn how to use it.

Reviews.Title: Sound Quality of videos ,very noisy, But otherwise nice camera.
Reviews.Author: M. R. Cossey "Kamikaze"
Reviews.Content: The only very disappointing aspect of this camera/camcorder is the sound quality, when no or little sound , just room or outdoor noise, the camera seems to invoke a audio normalizer or compressor.....

Reviews.Title: Excellent, easy to use, takes great photos!
Reviews.Author: Jackie L Craver
Reviews.Content: I love the ease of use and the great quality of the photos. The camera has great features. Overall, it is a wonderful camera to have.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Stafura
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! I am so pleased with the pictures and the ease of use.  The pictures are nice and crisp and the camera gives you a nice variety of settings to use for the pictures you are taking. I have recommended this camera, probably 10 times since I got it.

Reviews.Title: Grest
Reviews.Author: Howard J Powers
Reviews.Content: Love the telephoto Lens and the size of the camera and all of the features that I am able to finger our.

Reviews.Title: Small Camera, BIG Assets!
Reviews.Author: dcarney@wpo.co.chatham.ga.us
Reviews.Content: This camera is small enough to stay in my purse so it is with me at all times which means it is my fault if I miss a great photo op!  The picture quality is outstanding and the vast zoom provides awesome opportunities to get up close and personal!  :)  GREAT features in a small package that packs quite a wonderful punch in the photo world!  :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera.  Very happy.  Great for vacation.
Reviews.Author: Alexander Head
Reviews.Content: Would buy this again!Easy to use, seems like good quality.GPS seemed to sometimes take a while to home in on your correct current location.

Reviews.Title: Wow, why didn't I order this sooner.
Reviews.Author: James T Struble
Reviews.Content: I love it. High quality photos and very easy to use. I actually can use this for photos in my business for web pages.

Reviews.Title: Second Point & Shoot from LUMIX
Reviews.Author: stevespassion "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a co-worker which is a newer model than mine. I let her use my model and she loved it.  She's not an experienced photographer, just wanting to take "GOOD" pictures. AND SHE DOES!  This series of Lumix point and shoot cameras are easy to use and get great results, plus give you the option of doing much more. Video is great for a camera of this class.  I'd buy the latest model again!

Reviews.Title: Great machine
Reviews.Author: Bruno Costa
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this machine. Fits your pocket and still takes great photos. What else can I ask for. Just great!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Dhiya
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera from the Panasonic Lumix ZS series and like the earlier model, I love it. Great mega-zoom (20x), with a nice wide angle (24mm equiv) and a very compact profile.Photo quality is very good (but of course never good enough if, like me, you like super-detailed photos yet don't want to sacrifice the convenience of a compact).Easy-to-learn and use controls are an added benefit.

Reviews.Title: Nice, compact camera
Reviews.Author: T. R.
Reviews.Content: This is a high powered 20X zoom lens camera, that will fit in my pocket. Great pictures. The GPS seems to display information a little differently than my ZS7,The ZS20 is more detailed, but seems a little more particular about what it displays. Will change to a 5 rating if it quickly "tags" new locations as we travel.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift and it's really a great buy for the money. Hard to beat in it's category.

Reviews.Title: Great easy to use camera!
Reviews.Author: MingMingVA
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I have the older version as well and after years of use the video started to gobut this is a work horse and great!Lumix is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Megazoom
Reviews.Author: Michael Canic
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera from the Panasonic Lumix ZS series and like the earlier model, I love it. Great mega-zoom (20x), with a nice wide angle (24mm equiv) and a very compact profile.Photo quality is very good (but of course never good enough if, like me, you like super-detailed photos yet don't want to sacrifice the convenience of a compact).Easy-to-learn and use controls are an added benefit.Only downside: no WiFi although the newer ZS30 has this covered.Overall, a great camera in the compact category.

Reviews.Title: Fair product
Reviews.Author: zt Falavinha
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera. Take nice outdoors pictures. Inside pictures are not great. White balance in photos using internal flash are not good. In general terms, it does what is expected for a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Tania Andrasko
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year now and still love it!  The panorama capability is great fun and a real advantage both for landscapes and when you are in a tight spot, too big for the wide angle.  Auto focus does a good job, as well as lighting exposure.  I've enjoyed this camera more than any others I've had so far.

Reviews.Title: Amazing pocket camera
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: The picture quality , depth of field, and clarity is the best I have had or seen.  The wide angle takes in everything.  I could not be more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Shane Louks
Reviews.Content: Quite easily one of the best cameras I've ever bought. The zoom is just incredible. Picture quality is often better than my Canon Rebel. I doubt there's a better "pocket" camera out there. Way better than I expected from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Absolutly Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Doc Beech
Reviews.Content: The video and photo quality of this camera is just amazing. Its crystal clear, and HD all around. I bought this just before our first child was born and wow. The zoom is great, but the video quality just is amazing. I will include a couple samples of the video here. But its just an amazing camera. The photos, and the settings are amazing. The camera even remembers people, like our son. It tells you how old he is and his name is saved in it. It has more features than you can imagine. The battery life is better than they say. Ive had it last twice as long as they claim. I would not pass up this camera because of the quality of it, and the features. It does just about anything you ask of it. Its been really durable. We are pretty rough on things here, its been dropped, thrown up on, slobbered all over, and it just keeps on ticking. You can really take professional quality photos with this. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a small point and shoot camera.Heres the videos:[...][...]

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Arselka
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good at taking pictures without the person using it being a expert. I have enjoyed using it and been able to take lots of lovely pictures with it. I'm glad I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: Savannah Blair
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, we take it for quick trips and it always works well in all lighting situations.  The presets are nice also and have been happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: jorje
Reviews.Content: everything a 12 yr old boy wants in a camera and more. I have used it for high quality photos of wildlife and products for the internet.

Reviews.Title: Another step forward from my Lumix ZS10
Reviews.Author: bruce
Reviews.Content: I loved my ZS10 and for 2 years it was great.  However, on a recent trip I the zoom/wide button started sticking on me and would keep zooming after I release it.  Then dropped it on a cement floor, don't drop your camera on a cement floor!  It hit with a thud and never booted up again.  So with another trip to Yosemite coming I looked for a replacement.  This Lumix ZS20 was it.  I wanted a camera that was small for traveling and trail running, also needed GPS, and a good Zoom with HD movie recording.  This camera meets those criteria perfectly.  The movies from this camera are really crisp and clear, zoom more amazing than my Zs10, nice wide shots too.  I like being able to touch the screen to select what I want to focus on in the picture.  Manual controls are nice.  The biggest improvement from the zs10 was the low light shots.  I tested 3 cameras in very low light and the ZS20 out performed them all!  Another great feature is the backlight shot.  It out performed a Nikon SLR in this area as my back lit people against Half Dome came out perfect as if not back lit at all!So love the camera, small easy to carry and the zoom is amazing to get close to wildlife and the touch to focus feature enables you to get the wildlife in focus!  Macro is great on this camera as well and for size and quick change ability you can't beat it.  That SLR missed many shoots I was able to quickly get.Why only 4 stars for such a great camera?  It is the speed of start up.  I am getting an even faster card to see if that helps.  It is the slowness in writing to the card that I have issue with and try to take a picture and it does nothing as it is booting up or writing to card.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 20X telephoto
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever owned (of many). Best photo reproduction, nice standard wide angle lens gets everyone in the picture or plenty of landscape. Zoom is fast or slow, and gives great clarity even at full zoom. Nice indoor pix, even in low light. Lots of features and manual modes, but I usually let the camera decide how best to expose my shots with its "ia" (intelligent auto) mode. I have now taken thousands of shots over the last several months, and many video clips of anywhere from 10 seconds to about 5 minutes. Tip: Just remember when holding the camera in both hands not to cover the dual stereo microphone holes on the top of the camera, or your videos will have no sound. Excellent camera overall!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ashutosh K. Bahadure "Ashutosh Bahadure"
Reviews.Content: Our second Camera in Lumix ZS series. First one was ZS3, which was also great but while taking pictures at the beach the sand messed up its zooming operation and camera would not work properly (occasionally complains about zoom error).Since we liked previous Lumix, we bought this one and we were not disappointed. Since we bought it fairly recently, we haven't used it much. So, haven't explored features like GPS etc. We used it for our trip to Yellowstone/GTNP and camera took amazing pictures of Tetons, wildlife, geysers etc. GPS seems to show us name of the place (eg. name of hiking trail) while taking pictures. 20X zoom is pretty powerful. Quite powerful camera in point-and-shoot category.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS 20
Reviews.Author: Alan Kendell
Reviews.Content: Great little shirt pocket camera.Fantastically versatile, and portable, ideal family camera.The Leica lens is marvellous. The user interface easy to use.  Photo quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: RmK
Reviews.Content: Have gotten good results so far.  Love the panorama feature and the zoom.  Youtube has a great series of videos explaining all the features by Graham Houghton.  They are a big help in understanding what this camera can do.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: JohnL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a lot and enjoy taking pictures and videos of our trips.  In recent years we began to grow weary of our super  zoom camera because of it's size.  We were looking for something that we could slip in our pocket, but were not willing to give up  the super zoom.  This Panasonic camera more than filled the bill.  It takes wonderful pictures, has image stabilization, takes HD video, and can fit in our pocket easily.  In addition it will take 3D and panoramic still photos.  It has a wide range of features which can be adjusted to give the quality of color you prefer.  We set it on Happy mode and got rich color photos all over Europe.The only negatives for this camera, and what kept me from giving it a five are the battery and the lack of a view finder.  I don't believe you will find any smaller cameras with view finders anymore, but it is a great feature that has gone by the wayside. My only complaint on the battery is that Panasonic has changed the software so that third party batteries will not work, and you must by the Panasonic brand.  They claim it is for quality control of the lithium ion batteries.  Perhaps, but I would take my chances with third party producers when their products are half the cost.One other negative is the huge drain that the GPS feature puts on the battery.  It is a wonderful feature but I would not use it as it ran the battery down far too fast, even when in airplane mode.I believe the longer I have this camera the better pictures it will take.  There are many features and settings which I have yet to explore.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable camera
Reviews.Author: Fred Cicetti
Reviews.Content: I've been a serious photographer for more than 40 years. I cannot shoot as well as this camera. The programming they put in this thing is astounding. I never have this urge to go manual like I have with previous cameras. Just sit back and let Lumix do the driving.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value point and shoot
Reviews.Author: William D. Mathews
Reviews.Content: Really excellent camera for the price, great quality images and better than expected HD video.  Camera seems durable and well-made.

Reviews.Title: super easy- - really fun
Reviews.Author: Michael Scott
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures with super easy zoom. Lots of great features and simple to take videos with. Worth the price. It deserves the rating it gets from consumer reports.

Reviews.Title: A bit complicated interface for simple point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: T.D.
Reviews.Content: It definitely should have simpler interface. It does have a good lens and a potential to be a easy-to-use and user-friendly camera, but Panasonic has better and cheaper cameras than this one.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Alexander Voice
Reviews.Content: works great so far. touch screen is pretty clunky, so I wouldn't recommend it if that is an important criteria.pictures have turned out great, and very easy to use

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I love this Panasonic camera with GPS.  It's so easy to use.  It's light and the screen is very large.

Reviews.Title: Buy It!
Reviews.Author: Rick Harris
Reviews.Content: I have had several in this line starting with zs3 and love each one more than the last.  Had my last model stolen and I am loving this upgrade as much as my past models.  Great compact camera for travel, the zoom really reaches out and pulls in those far away sights.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: JMM
Reviews.Content: After much research on current point-and-shoot cameras within a modest budget, I landed on this Panasonic. I took this camera to Czech Republic and Sweden and plan to take it to as many other countries as I can afford to visit so long as the camera will live. It takes beautiful shots! It's super smart, has multiple settings that assist in capturing what you see and has fun settings like panorama. With a larger memory card, I was able to take over a thousand photos and nearly every shot was exquisite. Definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: fab photos!
Reviews.Author: mimi
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd Panasonic Lumix and by far the best one. Using if for panoramas and other photos is simple and results far exceed prior Lumix cameras in both color, focus and ease. This is a keeper. Only drawback is in the download of movies. The movies themselves turn out great but to download to a Mac is cumbersome. For those of you with a Mac, the way to do the movie download is to doubleclick the Private folder in the diskimage and it should open in Quicktime. Go to File->Export and then put it in a new folder on your desktop; get and open free MPEG Streamclip Beta and drag each clip into its window; go to File->Convert to DV and use the 16x9 option and put in that same folder. Open iMovie and import those DV clips into it and voila! now you can go to the movies with a Mac!

Reviews.Title: GPS no substitute for a Garmin
Reviews.Author: A techno geek
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this camera its first workout.  The photographic quality is really impressive.  I've discovered though that the GPS data is only accurate to about 100 feet.  I'd hoped it could replace the arduous process of recording waypoints on my  Garmin Etrex Legend when going botanizing, but to really return to a plant you found, you'll need a separate GPS unit, like a Garmin eTrex 30 Worldwide Handheld GPS Navigator.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Happy coffee
Reviews.Content: I am not very technical, I would consider myself an amateur or novice photographer. I recently got the camera and it arrived very quickly and in excellent condition. It is easy to set up. In terms of operating, I am still working my way around it as there are a lot of features. The only negative is there are not a lot of customizations that can be done on the basic menu in and display. I am pleased with the functionality and the ease of taking picture. It is quick and takes very good pictures.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Guille
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic!!! Is much more than a point and shot camera. I was looking for a camera that takes nice picture in low light, this one do it perfect. Nice size..

Reviews.Title: Perfect choice for my trip to Scotland
Reviews.Author: travellady
Reviews.Content: I debated as to which camera to get for a recent trip.  This was absolutely perfect & it was hard to take a bad picture with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera but..
Reviews.Author: iPhone 4s user
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this camera with the slow motion shooting etc.. But the night shots are horrible. I switched to a dslr within six months

Reviews.Title: Very versital camera
Reviews.Author: Ihor Yermolenko "world through a windshield"
Reviews.Content: I replaced a five year old Panasonic Lumix that survived over a thousand photos and sound videos. I carried it internationally and in a motorcycle tank bag. If this one is as durable I will again be pleased.This camera  has features that I am still learning. The wide angle works very well for shots inside rooms and the optical zoom and clear focus throughout the zoom range is impressive. Battery life is more efficient than the older model.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera to have all time
Reviews.Author: Sergio A. Rosales
Reviews.Content: Escelente camera, very good composition, but the gps don't update information as the company say and some pictures have very bad position

Reviews.Title: I LOVE it!!!
Reviews.Author: Fred Hirning
Reviews.Content: Great camera  No shutter lag time. Quick to use and it has a GREAT zoom feature, especially for being such a small size.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy Cone
Reviews.Content: I just started using this camera, and I am finding it easy to use. It is lightweight for travel. and  the pictures look great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: jbags
Reviews.Content: I am a novelist at best when it comes to cameras.  I just wanted a camera that takes great pictures, has a great zoom, and has a lot of scene type options that are easy to use.  I have tried 2 more expensive nikons and one cheaper canon before this one over the last couple years.  I didn't think they were that great.  This camera is the best point and click camera I've ever owned.  I couldn't be happier.  It is awesome and takes great pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Derrick Schenk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera one week before a two week trip to Lake Tahoe. I didn't even have time to go through the manual. This camera is very easy to understand and operate. I was able to take some breathtaking pictures because of the quality of this camera. Its a great size to fit in a pocket. The battery lasted longer than I expected if you turn the GPS off. I didnt want to use that function because I knew where I was taking the pictures. Great video quality.

Reviews.Title: Can't take a bad picture!
Reviews.Author: Roger W Maben
Reviews.Content: This is the third Panasonic Lumix I've bought. I got this one to replace my DMC-TZ3 which had a bad image sensor. (A common problem with the DMC-TZ3.) I absolutely love the ZS20. Battery life is great and the macro is the best I've seen in any digital camera except for the old Sony Mavicas.
