Reviews.Title: great camera for long shots but not for low light
Reviews.Author: Carol B. Whitmoyer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and have it in my pocket for all my trips.  Pictures during the day are sharp and clear but it does less well in low light.

Reviews.Title: Nice small camera, great zoom and good sensitivity
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an old Canon 720is and it's a huge upgrade for not much more cost. The superzoom is amazing, though at high zoom it's tough to hold steady, so a mono- or tripod is useful. The ability to capture a low light indoor shot with detail is much better than my old Canon. It's a sturdy unit, but still small and you can put in your pocket. I like this size camera as I wouldn't carry a SLR or really any bigger camera around as much as I do this, so I catch a lot more life moments and the picture quality is very good for most uses.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera!
Reviews.Author: Diane C. Maragioglio "dcmmk593"
Reviews.Content: This camera is one of the best cameras I have ever used!  It takes amazing photos and is easy to use.  LOVE IT!!!  Would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: WE LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Love 2 Read "Love 2 Read"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera on the recommendation of someone else.  We love it.  Recommend it without hesitation.  Great camera.  We love it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful travel camera
Reviews.Author: Roger D Walker
Reviews.Content: so small but so capable! Wonderful Zoom for size. Great as that second camera on trips; but good enough to go on its own

Reviews.Title: works for me
Reviews.Author: Andrea K.
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for me.  With my arthritis the newer smaller cameras don't work for me.  This camera takes excellent pictures and I enjoy using the zoom on wildlife pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Product. Came evantually on time.
Reviews.Author: Doron
Reviews.Content: Ordered it for one nigh shipment. Only after confirming the order it changed to 1 week delivery. After some phone calls that explained the difference between sellers on Amazon, the guy on the other side of the line helped me to cancel the original order and open a new one that allowed real 24 hrs. shipment. The product came packed with its original packaging and carrier protective additional protective package.Product was as promised. Great backup small camera with huge  zoom, GPS and does great pictures/ Real traveller Companion.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black)
Reviews.Author: chaote
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black)I bought Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black) at 7-28-12 and after 9 month of not frequent usage, the shutter was unable to be completely closed when I turned it off. but still had no problem to open it when I turned it  on. I sent it back at this May for repair before the warrant was going to expire in one year and hoped to receive it before my vacation at the end of this July. I didn't receive it before that time, although I called them several times for the repair status. they kept saying that they are waiting for the parts. Obviously, it is the common problem for this camera. I am very disappointed that they couldn't repair it in 2 months. I just received it today. I couldn't know it is fixed or not since it is not charged. I am charging it now. Hope it is going to work. Otherwise this camera was working well when it was in good condition.

Reviews.Title: Camera arrived non functioning
Reviews.Author: Robert Gamache
Reviews.Content: How can a new camera leave the factory in non-functioning condition???  I charged the battery, tried to start the camera, and to my surprise a system error [zoom] message was displayed.  I tried several methods to get it to work but none succeeded.  However, the return to Amazon was a pleasurable experience.  Once refunded I bought a Panasonic LUMIX DMC-ZS19 digital camera - this is the ZS20 without the GPS.  it, by the way is working great.  My only comment is to Panasonic to do better quality control.

Reviews.Title: Software is not compatible with Mac OS
Reviews.Author: CKK "McLovin fan"
Reviews.Content: People should know that this camera only comes with PC software.  Apparently no OS version is available.  I don't want to struggle with complicated work arounds to try and make this compatible with my Mac.  Just opened the box and am repacking camera to return.  Sad--  It sure sounded like a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Dead in 3 months -  see update
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: What junk - dead after only 3 months - lens no longer extends and front 'shutter' stuck half open. Well the pictures were good, so if you buy one take them fast because you don't have much time!July 2013: I did send it back, they did repair it BUT it refuses to focus when zoomed all the way in. Not sure what's up with that. It took a month to get it repaired, but at least they repaired it at no cost to me. Two more stars added .... we will see how long it continues to work. I really don't care about it not focusing at full zoom, but others may.

Reviews.Title: Shutter failure in 2 weeks of light use
Reviews.Author: Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: We bought the ZS20 to replace our ZS7 that I have carried for years now and had become a bit beat up from use.  I loved some of the new features on the ZS20, such as the panoramic photo feature, but after using it for a few weeks the lens cover became stuck and would not open all the way.  This caused my pictures to be covered at the bottom and top by the cover.We also were disappointed in the battery life, which seemed to be drained by keeping the GPS on all the time.  We also noticed that taking pictures in our house and posting them that the GPS info was all over the place, which kind of defeated the point in our minds.The camera also seemed really slow in all of it's functions.  When you turned it on/off or waited for it to write an image it always took long enough to notice that it was paused.We returned it and got the ZS19.  So far it's working great, is much faster and better on the battery than the ZS20.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: gpan
Reviews.Content: I'm the type of person who likes simple to operate cameras that produce high-quality pictures and are convenient to carry around on a vacation. This camera does exactly that. It has lots of options that you can adjust manually and amazing intelligent auto if you don't really want to bother. It is a great purchase for the casual picture-taker at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: This is my favorite camera that I have ever had!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Pevey
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if you're the kind of person who likes a lot of control and features on your camera. However there are a couple things it doesn't do particularly well. Taking pictures in low light or motion in anything but bright sunlight are two things that it doesn't do a particularly good job of. If you're looking for a small camera that fits into a small purse/clutch or pocket and you want to pull it out to take pics of you and all your pretty new friends at the bar to post online this is not the camera for you.If you are looking for a small convenient alternative to use when it's too much work to stop hiking and pull out your DSLR to get that squirrel on the tree up ahead. This is the perfect camera for you! It has great zoom, but with the small camera body you'd better have a tripod if you want usable pictures at the full 20x zoom that this baby can do.Pros:Small camera with great zoom capabilities.Excellent battery life (if GPS is turned off).Lightning quick start up time.Great picture quality in most day time conditions, especially in high light conditions.Cons:I still haven't gotten the GPS to work properly (but I have a great Garmin so I haven't tried hard) and if it's on it will suck the life out of your camera quicker than Kristen Stewart could suck the life out of a movie *BAM!*Not great picture quality in low light conditions, especially if there's motion.

Reviews.Title: buy extra batteries
Reviews.Author: Joseph Festa
Reviews.Content: just like modern cell phones, this item is jam packed with awesome features. the zoom is astounding, video / audio quality is great. the problem with all these features is there's no room for a big battery. it does not last an entire day on vacation. I'm looking for extra batteries and a separate charger.:. also, make sure you get a case that is large enough to carry the cable & accessories since this is larger than a pocket compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: Cumplió con los tiempos establecidos de entrega. El contenido es exacto al promocionado. Una excelente camara con muchas funciones. Excelente producto

Reviews.Title: Lumox
Reviews.Author: K. Hoenke
Reviews.Content: Though it takes very nice pictures, it takes many of them on its own -- sitting on a table, driving along a highway, in a carry-case.  Without encouragement, it snaps series all by itself, thus wasting the battery and chip space in addition to my time to delete all the offending blurs.

Reviews.Title: GREATEST "POINT AND SHOOT" YOU CAN BUY~
Reviews.Author: Hippie435
Reviews.Content: This camera is well worth every dime...and it is very reasonably priced compared to other cameras that will do as much as this.  I'm adjusting to not having a viewfinder, only a screen to see what I am taking but I actually prefer it this way.  I'm still reading up as it will do so much more than I've ever had in other cameras ~ well worth the money!  Nice size, nice weight, great product!

Reviews.Title: Excelent portable camera
Reviews.Author: VIKTOR TARABUKHIN
Reviews.Content: I owned Panasonic Lumix Z10 for many year - it was good. Only impossibility to change zoom level during recording a video was the thing I didn't like. New ZS20 is perfect - it takes full HD video clips very good quality and zoom level is variable now. I also like the HRD mode in this model.

Reviews.Title: THE ABSOLUTE BEST TRAVELING CAMERA EVER MADE!
Reviews.Author: Jon Hopkin
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have a had such an amazing camera. The seller was spot on with the description and delivery of the product. This camera will NOT dissapoint! It will blow your mind!

Reviews.Title: Bad auto focus sometimes
Reviews.Author: Tobias Haag
Reviews.Content: Most of the time this camera takes great pictures but if it isn't very bright the auto-focus is bad sometimes, so the pictures get blurry.

Reviews.Title: Carry it with me every where.
Reviews.Author: Amazon
Reviews.Content: It's a neat camera, I carry it with me every where I go and I must have taken 300 pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing and Inconsistent
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: I have an older Sony Cyber Shot with a short zoom.  It takes great, sharp photos indoor and out.  The only reason I purchased a new camera was for a longer zoom.  I took a long time deciding which camera with a 20X zoom to purchase as they all had their share of good and bad reviews.  So I crossed my fingers and bought the Panasonic.  Wrong choice.I have it for over a month and have been trying out the different features.  It is difficult to familiarize myself with the camera when they DO NOT give you a paper user's manual but you have to download one and scan through it on your computer.  Such a pain in the neck.  I have used cameras all my life but I am, like most people, not an electronic genius and need to reference instructions on a regular basis and lack of a paper manual is unacceptable to me.From all the photos I have taken, indoors and out, I am finding that either I get a very good shot or a bad, out-of-focus one.  The outdoor shots are much better than the ones indoors, especially of people.  Portraits tend to be washed out and some out of focus.  Also, I cannot get really close (macro) shots (tried on flowers in the park) without them being blurry.  I tried with and without the zoom.  Sometimes, the macro mode self engages and shows the symbol on the screen and sometimes it doesn't.  I also tried the manual mode to get a blurry background on people shots and no matter what settings I tried, that doesn't seem to work.The worst, to me, is that I cannot figure out what is right and wrong with this camera.  You can do the exact same thing over and over and get different results each time.  I got one flower closeup which came out sharp with a blurred background but don't know how that happened.  Tried again every which way and couldn't duplicate the result.  Took indoor people photos.  Two were in focus and one was not.  All were kind of washed out, though.Overall, I am not happy with this camera and feel like I wasted my money.  I will continue to play around with the settings and see if my experience improves but I will not count on this camera for important photo-taking occasions.  I'll stick with my older, reliable Sony for those.  In fact, I wish I had bought a new Sony instead as there was one I considered.  But, then again, they don't make them like they used to and that one may have been no better.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Kate "Kate"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a week now and have taken pictures inside and outside, of pets, kids and landscape much better picture quality than the ZS10.  A lot of the same features that the ZS10 had very easy to use.  I got the white one and love it.  The extra zoom is awesome.  Great small point and shoot camera that fits in your purse so you can take it everywhere with you.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic ZS20 Camera
Reviews.Author: Milly
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for an upcoming trip, which was cancelled due to airline delays.  Therefore, I haven't used it as much as I thought I would have by now.  But with the little I have used it, I am impressed.  It has the longest zoom of other cameras of its size, which I love.  Don't love the touch screen & wish it could be turned off.  Otherwise, so far so good.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: carlos
Reviews.Content: It's a very very nice camera, with many features. Small corcern: some pictures are not as good as I wish... but I recomend the product

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: Akpabli
Reviews.Content: This is by all accounts a great camera. My first pictures were good. It seems like with a little mastery of this camera you cannot take a bad picture. I love it. Even the shipment from Amazon is great. Delivered in four days.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. So far the pictures are brilliant. There are many creative features to use. The viewfinder is awesome. My Girlfriend also has a compact camera that takes pretty great pic but the viewfinder was lacking. She loves the ZS20s' display. Its definately a keeper for me. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Camera may be nice (?) but customer support makes it a bad idea to purchase
Reviews.Author: Dave Marcus
Reviews.Content: Rec'd ZS20  today. Overjoyed! Had spent a LOT of time considering what pocket camera would be best to complement my SLR-and-too-many-lenses-etc kit.  Used it for 10 minutes.  Handed it to wife.  She says zoom doesn't work. She's right. Suddenly, no control works, not even the off switch; camera is entirely locked up.No support phone number in the manual so search for it on the Web. I have spent the last two and a half hours trying to reach customer support at Panasonic. I have gone into limbo; been disconnected; had the line answered by an operator 3 times; been answered by one other person who said she is transferring me to the correct agent (that line has been on hold for 32 minutes at this point); etc, etc; been asked to enter full model number omitting no letters or numbers, a challenge when calling on a Blackberry, etc, etc; .  Operator has told me that all the problems are  to a system upgrade.  (What was it like before the upgrade? <joke>  More seriously, what kind of idiot puts in upgrades to mission critical contact center software during business hours?)So I have fully lit up but dead camera; on/off doesn't even work. It is zoomed and I need to figure out how to unzoom it (zoom switch doesn't work) so I can fit it into the box and in utter frustration and disappointment return it to Amazon.And now, 37 minutes into my call being on hold I get an agent who tells me that there is no reason this should have happened; he can't explain it.  I ask for a return authorization.  He says they'll have it picked up for repair. I say 'unacceptable'.  He says he will transfer me to 2nd level support. Instead, he transfers me back to the beginning--and "the voice" asks me why I am calling.  I tell it "technical support" and it says "sorry--we are now closed."The hell with Panasonic. I am really disappointed - bought this for a trip to the Caymans next week.  It is going back to Amazon tomorrow.PS - another trio of Panasonic "joy killers" (not misrepresentations or anything, just things that may impact the quality of your experience as a consumer):(1) No card ships with camera.(2) Battery does not come charged, so when you get excited as you get it out of the box you have to wait 4.3 hours for a charge before you can play with your new camera.(3) Manual is provided on CD only (unless you count all 18 pages of instructions in the "Basic Owner's Manual").Boy, does the excitement fade quickly.UPDATE.  Last night I finally sent them an email saying that it was impossible to call them and I had spent 2 hours trying; would they be so kind as to call me.  They replied this morning (12 hour turnaround, not bad for email help request) but they said "please call us for assistance".  I replied "Please call me; I was too frustrated by my experience to try to call you guys."FURTHER UPDATE.  2 days later, no reply.  I have a return authorisation from Amazon.  Camera has behaved and not locked up again.  Not sure what I am going to do.UPDATE.  Got the replacement; no problems.  Like the camera very much but no desire to change the rating.FURTHER.  Bought a new laptop and have found that PhotoFunStudio - the utility Panasonic provides to transfer pictures from the camera to a PC does not work unless you have the font size set, in Windows, to 100%.  The laptop has a great high res screen and I have it set to 150% font size in order to get things readable. Panasonic support recommends that whenever I want to transfer photos I change to 100%, which means I  must then log off [closing all programs on your desktop] and log back in.  This is dark ages programming - pure laziness and stupidity on Panasonic's part. I then need to reverse the process when I am done with PhotoFUstudio.  Can I change my review down to a half star?

Reviews.Title: Not as sharp as the ZS7
Reviews.Author: Dude1
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I really wanted to like this camera. Although the video quality at 1080p blew my socks off over my ZS7, the pictures unfortunately were not as sharp. Took about 100 indoor and outdoor identical shots at full resolution on both cameras. In the end returned two ZS20 cameras both purchased from Amazon with identical issues. Keeping my ZS7.

Reviews.Title: ugggggg dropped the old camera in a ice hole
Reviews.Author: Dj magee
Reviews.Content: so I went out ice fishing andIi hear a plop and see my camera slowly sinking into the lake. . . I thought about crying for sure that old Panasonic Lumix was the first big electronic i had bought and it was then 6 or 7 years old. I had taken it all over the USA and it had been a trooper no matter what. When i lost it I was devastated!!! well I was so happy to find out that the Lumix was still a excellent camera for a amateur photographer on a budget. I have throughly enjoyed my new camera and look forward to trying out more of the new features it has in the near future. I would give this a 5 start but my favorite feature from my old model was the high speed burst and this one is just different and not doing exactly what i want it to be doing yet. anyway RIP old Lumix you will never be forgotten. cheers

Reviews.Title: You never appreciate how excellent Amazon is until you make a purchase from another retailer
Reviews.Author: F. Alexis
Reviews.Content: I have read nothing but great reviews on this Panasonic Camera,but as much as a bargain hunter as i'm i went on a hunt for a better price. Like they say you cannot put a price on true customer service and your level of comfort. I went and order this Camera from Abe's Of maine. OMG, this is the worst experience i have ever encounter from a retailer. They don't update you if the item was shipped. They don't update their web site for tracking info. When you call customer service, you are on hold for at least 1/2 hr before someone comes on the phone. When you finally get a live person, they tend to lie about the shipping information. The young Lady on the phone said it was shipped and you should get the tracking info in via email. I said you told me the same thing yesterday and i received nothing. Then she said it was shipped yesterday and they should have sent you the tracking info via your email. I said can i have it while we are on the phone, my email is not working right now. She said you should get the tracking info by the end of today. This is for all of you wonderful consumers at Amazon, "Do not sacrifice an extra $25-$50 less just to go to another retailer. It will be the worst mistake you possibly will ever make. At this time i'm still waiting for the Camera and i still don't have an update when i will receive it and they have my $229.00I want to thank Amazon for putting consumers needs first before anything else. I hope someone can read this before they make the same mistake.Thank You

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: S. Cliatt
Reviews.Content: So far I am very satisfied with my new camera. ( I have only had it a month)  I'm still trying to figure out all the features(it's seems pretty complicated sometimes) but the ones I've used are great.  I love the 20X optical zoom.  Maybe I can score it higher after I've had it awhile.

Reviews.Title: Awesome do it all camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan Portz
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've ever owned. Zoom is great features are great and still small enough to keep in my pocket while traveling

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera is awesome.
Reviews.Author: Boo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Germany and Switzerland.  The pics all came out great and even took a video while driving through the Alps and everybody loved the quality of the video.  It made them feel like they were there with us.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: This was the first camera of this type that I have purchased. It offers more features than the slr like camera I purchased 5 years ago that was $200 more.The panoramic feature came in very handy. The custom scene features work very well for novice photographers like me.Video was absolutely amazing. I thought I was watching hd tv.

Reviews.Title: my new TZ30
Reviews.Author: Eniko
Reviews.Content: I was very exited to get the newest Panasonic Lumix TZ30. I purchased the TZ1 six years ago when the that was the first 10x zoom small camera and I was happy with it. I like to take pictures of birds and wild animals and the 20x zoom and the small size was the deciding factor. I read a lot of the reviews about similar cameras and this seemed to be the best, but it still has a lot of room for improvement.I like the zoom and it works well in bright light and even got a decent photo of the full moon free hand. In low light is much worse than I expected. I liked the idea that it can take 2-3 pictures automatically to compensate for the strong back light - until I found people with two noses and missing arm. The macro is very good. I like the wide angle.  The skin tones need improvement.I didn't have a chance to try all the possibilities, I am still learning. The buttons on the TZ1 were easier to navigate.I know I cannot expect the same quality as the big cameras get and I wouldn't want one of those but I still hope to get a better camera in the future.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: audrey
Reviews.Content: I bought the ZS20 with 20x, and the quality is what is accepted for the price- pretty good. I'm not a photographer of any sort, I just need a camera for travel, so it serves its purpose. However the battery is horrible- it can't even last me half a day. And it's not very flattering when taking pictures of people.

Reviews.Title: Not-So-Great
Reviews.Author: Reil
Reviews.Content: Cumbersome to determine the proper settings; acceptable results; but NO BETTER than previous cameras I've purchased/used over the past few years.My grandchild destroyed my previous camera (it was worth the destruction).

Reviews.Title: good enough to give my son
Reviews.Author: oldmanmike2468!
Reviews.Content: this little camera was so nice, i had to give it to my son & takehis 5 year old camera for myself - he uses it for work & needed thequality this camera affords him - emb

Reviews.Title: Wished there the instruction manual was legible... software included not compatible with windows 8
Reviews.Author: Marie-Jeanne Parsons
Reviews.Content: It takes awhile to get up to speed on how  to use all the features... the instruction manual is fairly limited and printed very small.But big surprise the software is not compatible with windows 8....Takes nice pictures, many options... but you need the instructions to figure it out

Reviews.Title: LCD Touch Screen is not good.
Reviews.Author: Praveen Challa
Reviews.Content: LCD touch is not as expected. Also, the LCD takes time to update when you move across the photo subject unlike in SONY it gets updated very fast. The zoom feature is excellent. And so do other features.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ksteig
Reviews.Content: I had to read the manuals which come with technology.  And I didn't read the instruction to this one.  I have a great Cannon which I continue to use.  This one is different and I am learning as I go.  I do like some of the affects I can get by just tuning this little gem.  I like the camera and it is just another addition to my growing collection

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20X Zoom
Reviews.Author: Ralph Furlong
Reviews.Content: This is a very difficult review to write as there are two major components to it.  On the one side, there is the software and Panasonic Support and on the other side there is the actual camera itself.  First, let me deal with the software, Firmware updates, and Panasonic Support.  Here are my thoughts on that front:  1.  The included software for the camera does NOT work on Windows 8.  It is NOT supported on Windows 8 and there is apparently no intention of supporting Windows 8.  Here is a direct quote from Panasonic support once I finally managed to find a way to contact them:There is no PhotoFunStudio 1.8 update program for Windows 8 compatibility. We are sorry for any inconvenience.Thank you for contacting Panasonic.This is the software that you are supposed to use to connect your camera to your computer, control advanced functions, work with your pictures, etc.  So, forget any value on that front.  The software also appears to have issues loading on Windows 7 64 bit OS.  2.  If you go to the Panasonic Website and try to download updates, you will find a very interesting mess.  First, there is an endless loop that if you select the correct camera for support takes you directly to the sales site for you to purchase the camera.  Click on "support" and you go right back to the sales site.  In order to get anywhere, you need to select the wrong camera (anything other than this black ZS20).  Depending upon which one you select, you will see that there is a firmware update to correct issues with the GPS.  However, do not try to click on the explanation on what the update is for or how to install it as it will take you right back to the sales site so you can purchase the camera!If you click directly on the download, it might take you to the download for the firmware or it might give you a "location not found".  3.  If you finally find your way to e-mail support, it does allow you sort of fill in the blanks with whatever your issue might be.  Once submitted, I received a response in a very short order.  I was asked to provide the exact verbiage of the error message, so I sent in a screen shot of the message.  Forget that!  You get an error response from Panasonic stating that your message exceeds their allowed e-mail size!!!!Once I typed in the exact message detail, I received a response from their technical support person who said to go ahead and load the software even though the warning message states that the OS is NOT compatible and that even if you do manage to load it, it will not function correctly.  They told me to load it anyway and then contact them with whatever problems that causes!!!!When I wrote back and stated that I was not happy with this, the tech pointed out that this camera came onto the market in 2012 before Windows 8 .  Well, Windows 8 also launched in 2012 and that is a lousy excuse!  Why are you still selling the camera then if you will not support it?Ok, enough with this section, let's get on to the actual Camera review:  Here is what I liked:  1.  The camera is very light weight and they added a rubber section to the camera grip that makes it easier to hold.  2.  The 20X optics is very nice and it appears to work well.  3.  The move into the digital expansion that takes the camera to 40X is very smooth and the camera stabilization works well.  Pictures taken of an object in the rain that was 6 feet away came out very clear and the rain drop that I was focusing on was very detailed.Here are some items that I did not like as much:  1.  Many of the features are not intuitively obvious and will take some time to learn.  As an example, try to locate the function to format the card!  2.  Touch features seem a little erratic.  3.  The time to first shot appears to be much longer than the information on the website indicates it should be.As long as this camera does not malfunction and you do not want any software, it should be a reasonable camera.  I do not, however, have a lot of faith that if something goes wrong it would be repaired.

Reviews.Title: GR8 LITTLE FULL-FEATURED CAMERA, I'VE BOUGHT 2 OF THEM.
Reviews.Author: D. DUPLAY "PHOTO-LADY"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THESE SMALL FULL-FEATURED CAMERAS THAT HAVE OPTIONS MY 2 NIKON D-SLR CAMERAS DON'T HAVE.I LOVE THE GPS FEATURE FOR EXTENSIVE TRAVEL AND LANDSCAPE SHOTS.  THE PANARAMIC FEATURES ARE AWSOME & FAST. THE START-UP & RESPONSE TIME OF THE CAMERA IS EXCELLENT AS IS THE VIDEO I HAVE TAKEN WITH IT, EVEN IN LOW LIGHTING. THE TOUCH LCD SCREEN IS QUITE NICE & RESPONSIVE.I FIRST BOUGHT A SILVER ONE, USED IT QUITE A BIT FOR SEVERAL YEARS. I RECENTLY BOUGHT ANOTHER NEW ONE IN BLACK *ONLY COLOR AVAILABLE AT THIS ALMOST 1/2 PRICE OF MY FIRST PURCHASE. I DO PREFER BRIGHTER COLORED BODIES BUT FOR THAT PRICE, WHO CARES?  I HAVE READ ABOUT THE LENS STICKING/JAMMING AND I HAVE SEEN A LITTLE OF THAT WITH MY FIRST PURCHASE. I PUT A SMALL AMOUNT OF SILICONE ON MY FINGER & RUBBED THE OPEN LENS  O.D. LIGHTLY. REMOVED THE BATTERY, PUT IT BACK IN POWERED IT BACK UP AND IT HAS BEEN GOOD SINCE THEN. WHEN I SAW THIS LOW PRICE $162, I BOUGHT THE 2ND. ZS-20 AS A BACK-UP AND FOR WHEN MY HUSBAND'S CHEAPO CAMERA DIES.I BUY EXTRA BATTERIES & CHARGERS ONLINE. THE BATTERIES ARE SMALL & LAST QUITE A WHILE, BUT I ALWAYS HAVE A CHARGED SPARE WITH ME.  I HAVE RECOMMENDED THIS CAMERA TO OTHERS AS THEY ARE ALWAYS IMPRESSED WITH MY PHOTOS & VIDEOS TAKEN WITH THE ZS-20. YOU CAN USE LARGE CAPACITY HC/XC SD FLASH MEDIA CARDS IN THESE TOO. COMFORTABLE HAND GRIP SO IT FEELS GOOD & SECURE IN YOUR HAND. I LOVE THE 20-40X ZOOM CAPABILITY. I HAVE PAID $3K FOR A NIKON LENS WITH LESS ZOOM RANGE FOR MY D-SLRs.A PRETTY STRONG / EVEN FLASH ON IT TOO.  EASY TO QUICKLY BUMP YOUR SPEED UP FOR THOSE LOW LIGHT SITUATIONS. THE AUDIO IS SHARP & CLEAR WITH THE VIDEOS I HAVE TAKEN.I AM A 25+ YEARS FREELANCE SHOOTER,  WHO SHOOTS A LOT. THIS IS MY EVERYDAY/TRAVEL CAMERA.  I AM VERY IMPRESSED WITH THIS SMALL CONVENIENT TALENTED CAMERA WITH TONS OF FEATURES, LEARN THEM ALL OR NONE OF THEM FOR GREAT QUALITY RESULTS.  VERY EASY TO USE FOR THE LESS-EXPERIENCED SHOOTER WHO WANTS A SMALL POINT & SHOOT CAMERA TOO. THIS IS A GREAT FULL-FEATURED SMALL CAMERA FOR THE PRICE IN MY OPINION.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Lyn
Reviews.Content: Best photos done in bright light outdoors.  Zoom feature and lens are great for a point/shoot camera.  PIcture quality is ok, but not SLR quality of course.  Video record button and screen are big improvements over the ZS5 that I had before.  Limited touch screen for focus point is ok.  Quick response to shutter.

Reviews.Title: Picture rotates when using zoom
Reviews.Author: Bchar
Reviews.Content: Has a problem in that when I zoom, the picture rotates somewhat (10-15 degreees) inside the camera, which means I need to crop all my photos in Picasa. Otherwise photos excellent

Reviews.Title: thank you!!
Reviews.Author: Godwin Mindra
Reviews.Content: Thank you for delivering this product. I like it and works just fine. Will for sure come back to shop

Reviews.Title: Just the right size
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Schnyder
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I loved all the bells and whistles that the Panasonic offers.  The size is perfect for traveling as it fits in my pocket.  I have the larger model which is nice but just too large

Reviews.Title: Lots of features in a compact size
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures and the movie mode is also very good. Easy to use and the small size makes it easy to put into a pocket. I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS20
Reviews.Author: Linda Alley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just before going on a trip to Europe.  The camera was wonderful!!  I especially like the i on night setting; it took great nighttime shots when there was low lighting.  Took a city night tour one night and got some great shots of the bridges and buildings with all there lights on.  Also like the stablization of the zoom when zooming in really close on an object from a long distance; the picture comes out as if you were only standing a few feet away, there was no grainess like you usually see when doing shots like this.  I do a lot of scrapbooking and was really impressed with this camera; very compact and light weight for all that it does.  If you are just looking for a good camera to take great shots for personal use that is light weight and compact this is the camera for you.  I have a friend that I was traveling with at the time and she is seriously thinking about getting one of these cameras.  She was very impressed with the pictures also.A happy camper with this camera, Texas

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: WellHurfMyDurf
Reviews.Content: It works very well and replaced my old Powershot S50. I haven't learned to use all its features yet but it is not a SLR so yeah.

Reviews.Title: I sent it back
Reviews.Author: Reverend Cliff "Rev Cliff"
Reviews.Content: I love the lumix cameras but this one you can get the same one without some of the bells and things for alot less.

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: IZILDINHA REGINA ALVES KAVAI
Reviews.Content: Does not workI bought this camera, and she only worked one month, and not turn over. Displays the error message System zoom.Do not buy

Reviews.Title: Great camera but I was sent an open-box item so returned it
Reviews.Author: Pammy C "Brainfood maniac"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with features somewhere between my very compact Lumix DMC-FH25 and my larger Lumix DMC-FG28.  Specifically, I wanted an extra-wide angle lens, compact size, but with the the customization abilities of the larger camera. This camera really had all the features I wanted. I also checked out the Lumix ZS25 because it appeared to be roughly the same camera without the GPS feature, however, when I looked at it, it was really cheaply made, with plastic dials and buttons, including the shutter button. Anyway, long story short, I was sent an obviously open-box item, so I returned it. Unfortunately, I wanted it for a backpacking trip and don't have time now to re-order before I leave. I am very dissapointed and I don't think open-box items should be sold as "new". I will most likely reorder this camera when I return, as I LOVE my Panasonic Lumix cameras and have yet to be sold on Cannon, Nikkon, Fugi, or Sony, even though I tried REALLY hard to like one at Best Buy this evening.

Reviews.Title: incomplete ?????
Reviews.Author: risolera
Reviews.Content: The camera is a super product, very good night or low light shots ....  but it only included the wall charger cable !!!!!  I am missing the battery charger, that is almost always included in the packages.  Was the shipping incomplete????

Reviews.Title: OVERALL, A GREAT CAMERA...
Reviews.Author: Elly "mother of 2"
Reviews.Content: I never take the time to write reviews on any items,but i thought this might help someone with their decision making. First let me start by saying that I'm one of the pickiest person when it comes to buying a camera. Over the years I had few favorites and when they broke down I dreaded the process of looking for another great camera. I hate reading GREAT REVIEWS, buying the product, taking it for a ride in different environment only to discover that the camera works great in some instances but not in others (i.e. sometimes a camera it's great in day light but lacks during night scenes, or it's great when you use the zoom a little bit but not so great when you zoom all the way out, or it's fast in day light and slower at night, etc., etc.). I bought and returned so many cameras I lost count. After my everyday point-and-shoot camera broke down few months ago I thought I'll never find a great camera, but I did, actually I found 3 and one is a WINNER! I bought many cameras, my recent purchases were: this camera ( Panasonic dmc-zs20),PANASONIC DMX-ZS25, and PANASONIC DMC-ZS19. I have to say that all 3 cameras are outstanding,and I had a hard time deciding which one to keep. I was so set to keep ZS25 for many reasons: although it's similar to zs19 the thing I love about ZS25 were the on/off button (it's push and not slide)& the review button (it's push and not slide, which is annoying on zs19/zs20). If you don't care for those two items than all 3 cameras seem to be the same. The major difference between the them is:1. zs20 has a GPS while the zs19 doesn't (which I don't care for anyway, since it just kills the battery)2. zs19 has a semi-touch screen and zs20 doesn't ( this is a pretty handy addition when reviewing pictures in a hurry, unfortunately you can't delete pictures with a touch which would've been great). The touch screen can be used when you want to take pictures by just touching the screen and focusing on certain things.3. during recording with zs19 you can take 12 pictures, while with zs20 you can take only 1! AND THIS WAS THE DEAL BREAKER FOR ME WHEN IT CAME TO THE ZS20 AND THE MAIN REASON WHY I HAD TO PICK THE ZS19 AS A WINNER. EVEN THOUGH YOU CAN STOP AND SAVE A STILL PICTURE FROM A VIDEO, IT'S STILL NICE TO HAVE THE OPTION TO CHOSE EXACTLY WHEN YOU WANT TO TAKE A PICTURE DURING RECORDING! I love everything about both cameras, the quality it's the same, the LCD it's a bit more colorful on the zs20 (only when viewing, the pictures LOOK nicer on the zs20 but the quality it's exactly the same when viewed on a computer), the pictures are great in any situation even at night and in low light ( which it's the problem with most cameras). WHAT IMPRESSED ME THE MOST ON BOTH OF THESE CAMERAS IS HOW FAST THEY ARE (IN LOW LIGHT TOO) AND A HUGE PLUS FOR BOTH IS THE BUST MODE WITH FLASH (ON ALL SETTINGS EXCEPT FOR iAUTO) WHICH ALLOWS YOU TO TAKE A SERIES OF RAPID FIRE PICTURES WITH FLASH FULLY WORKING! Like I said I tried many cameras ( different models, brands, prices, etc.) and all the cameras that I tried that have a BURST mode option don't have BURST WITH FLASH (which in good light is not a problem but when you do need a flash...and most of the times indoors you need a flash...the pictures taken with BURST MODE WITHOUT A FLASH WILL LOOK LIKE CRAP). I was really impressed with both cameras so far but few days ago I went on a field trip with my son and the zs19 won me over (I'm sure zs20 would've been the same). The pictures I took with the zoom fully extended were UNBELIEVEABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!! AND THAT DOESN'T HAPPEN EVERYDAY :) SO FAR I TOOK PICTURES INSIDE, OUTSIDE, RAIN, SNOW, COLD, SUNNY, BIRTHDAYS WHERE KIDS MOVE CONSTANTLY, SOCCER GAME WHERE THERE IS A LOT OF ACTION, ETC. AND I LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT. ONE THING I NOTICED THAT THIS CAMERA DOESN'T HAVE AND I WISH IT DID IS A SNOW/BEACH SETTING WHICH I FOUND VERY HANDY ON MY OTHER CAMERAS. ONE MORE THING IT'S GREAT ON THOSE TWO CAMERAS IT'S THE PANORAMA SETTING,ON SOME CAMERAS YOU HAVE TO TAKE ONE PICTURE AND FOR THE NEXT ONE YOU'LL HAVE TO ALIGN THE PREVIOUS PICTURE ON THE SCREEN IN ORDER TO MATCH THE NEXT ONE, ON THE PANASONIC ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS KEEP THE SHUTTER PRESS AND MOVE YOUR BODY 360 degrees,it's super cool even my kids were very impressed :) So, overall both cameras are outstanding but for me the fact that I have the choice to take more than one picture while recording made me decide to keep the zs19. If the zs20 would've had this option I would've loved to keep it because I liked the two buttons better (on/off and review) and the LCD was a bit more vivid. One more plus with the zs19 was the touch screen. I think it all depends on what you're top requirements are. I hope I helped someone by writeing this review. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: ec11
Reviews.Author: ebetgil11
Reviews.Content: the delievery time was very fast The camera is very light and fixs nice in a small hand i sent it back because I found a newer model and was priced less

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: daniel-flores
Reviews.Content: It is a really good camera. The options, the quality, the pixels... Everything is fabulous! I just do not give it 5 stars because I believe I was expecting a little more. However I am satisfied of this product.

Reviews.Title: Does not shoot raw format
Reviews.Author: gvguru
Reviews.Content: Does not shoot raw format so it was not what I wanted in a camera.  Returned it to the sender.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: I don't have a momment with bad quality in my pictures, easy setup for different options, very good with video and just enough for quick photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Alex Carapia
Reviews.Content: Very good camera with a low price.I compared with a profissional Nikon and my lumix loose for fewYou can put the camera in your pocket and walking with no problem.I recomended that camera for everybody i know.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: The camera features resolution as high as 14 megapixels, but picture sharpness is mediocre at best.  I took comparative shots of the same subject with my old Fuji FinePix 3800 whose highest resolution is 3.2 mega pixels and alternated them with the Lumix shots in the photo file on my PC so that I could "toggle" between pictures for comparison.  To my amazement the Fuji pictures were noticeably sharper (this Fuji model uses an xD picture card, in the Lumix I use an SDHC class 10 memory card).  I did this with every pixel option on both cameras and for each one, the Fuji pictures were better.  I thought perhaps that the problem was in the SD memory card reader so I took photos using the camera's built-in memory for transfer to my PC directly from the camera's memory -- no change, so it's not the card reader. I took the shots in the "Intellgent Auto" mode and the "Program AE" mode (two of its many options) and selected settings to ensure the highest quality photo.  Nothing that I did produced photos that were at least as good if not better (my expectation) than the Fuji.  Since the camera is under warranty I'll be contacting Panasonic to have a service center examine the camera -- maybe I have a "lemon".  But, for now, I'm very diappointed and  wouldn't recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: wanted to love this camera
Reviews.Author: R. Vancook
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Panasonic.  I have the f15 for three years.  When it came time to replace it, I naturally looked to Panasonic for a new camera.  The problem with this camera for me, was despite reading the manual, using the settings, and having a high speed card, every picture I took was highly pixelated.  The pictures looked normal on my 24in monitor at home, but not clear and sharp like my f15. By the time I got them to my ipad, or work computer, all the details of the photos were gone and replaced with pixelation.  I requested a return this morning.  I did search a thread on Panasonic zs 20 and found that there are people out there with pixelation issues like this.  Perhaps Panasonic has some defectives out there...

Reviews.Title: Soft compared to my ZS7
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Steve@StevesTravelGuide"
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my ZS7 for several years, but it was getting a little long in the tooth, a few artifacts on the sensor, etc. And, I was hoping for better low light performance. So, I tried the ZS20.At a feature level, it is a super upgrade.  Long zoom, HDR, auto backlight compensation. Really great.But, compared to the ZS7 it is simply soft - and I tried two to make sure I did not have a bad one.  Took it out on several shooting sessions, but the results were verrrry disappointing, and unacceptable.  Appreciable difference from the ZS7.Have now purchased a LX7 which seems hopeful. Better pictures from what I've seen, but miss the longer zoom. Larger and heavier, which makes is less portable. But the quality is critical. Will report on that soon.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Andres Ochoa
Reviews.Content: I have the camera four months ago and was the best decision, the camera has a great zoom (20x), has several functions for each of the scenes you want to take, the camera corrects hand movement, and the photos are not moved all, the flash is perfect, the camera is comfortable and not very heavy for its size easily fits in the pocket of the jean, the only thing that is difficult is the beginning of the video recording, it is other than the menu button, but but read the instructions, the camera is very intuitive to handle, the screen is touch, was very pleased with the product.Tengo la cámara hace cuatro meses y fue la mejor decisión, la cámara tiene un excelente zoom (20X), tiene varias funciones para cada una de las escenas que desee tomar, la cámara corrige el movimiento de la mano, y las fotos no quedan movidas para nada, el flash es perfecto, la cámara es cómoda y no pesa mucho, fácilmente por su tamaño, cabe en el bolsillo del jean, lo único que al principio es difícil es la grabación del vídeo, porque es otro botón diferente al menú, pero es sino leer las instrucciones, la cámara es muy intuitiva para manejarse, la pantalla es touch, quedé muy satisfecho con el producto.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture quality
Reviews.Author: Infinitedreams
Reviews.Content: I was having high expectations from this camera but it really takes crappy pictures in low light conditions and indoors.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed because of 2 things...
Reviews.Author: Brittany "Johnson"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera primarily because of the HD video function. I film horses and download the frames that I like most as photos.I expected it to record the video as .mov like its predecessor ZS3 that I had before. I need the .mov format because I have a Mac computer.ZS20a) hides the recorded video deep in the Private folder (you have to click 3 other sub folders to finally find your videos at least on a MAC computer)  and it took me quite some time to find out that the .mts files were the videos that I recorded. It took another 2 hours to find the right free .mts to .mov converter.b) It seems they have changed the algorithm for the IA intelligent automatic function for photos and videos. Now photos and videos are too dark and saturated.When I want to work on them in Photoshop the Level curve is already fragmented in a way that occurs when I use the automatic enhance function in Photoshop. There is not much I can do with it.I've yet to find out which other default I can use to get videos and pictures in the quality that I got with the IA function in the ZS3 camera (that is broken otherwise I'd never bought the new one).So for my preferences and purposes this camera is not good.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: barbara schmell
Reviews.Content: it is a great camera..takes clear closeup photo's from far awayLightweight and very portableOnly have it a few weeks..Granddaughter is playing in Rosebowl Parade so, I need it to take photo's of floats..LUCKY ME

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price !!
Reviews.Author: William Root
Reviews.Content: I love the clear clean pics this camera takes...and all of the functions available...this is a great camera for the price !!

Reviews.Title: Muy buena cámara
Reviews.Author: Esteban Tapia Ch
Reviews.Content: Excelente tamaño del equipo, toma imágenes muy claras, incluso en la oscuridad, y el zoom está excelente. Muy recomendable lo que obtienes por un buen precio.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera in a small package
Reviews.Author: Marivel
Reviews.Content: I am still learning to use this camera but so far I found it great!  I have the ability to set it the way I like, or to rely on its many standard settings.  I like the spot metering that enables me to pinpoint the area that gets best exposure.  The vibration compensation works very well, in particular in video mode.  I was able to shoot decent videos in low light.  Tu sum-up, this is a great camera to keep on me at all times, in particular when I do not want to carry around my large SLR.  It is NOT an SLR replacement for me but complements it quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: Beautifull camera
Reviews.Author: robcom
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, a lot of features, small camera, simply to use, astonished video in HD, super slow motion videos and super zoom (20x).I simply recommends this camera. I was looking for a bridge camera but this is one the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Camille
Reviews.Content: I got this as a birthday gift. I had been looking for a couple of months but could not seem to settle on a camera.I use this camera to shoot videos mostly of my toddler. it takes beautiful stills also. The GPS function is awesome.Fits perfectly in my pocket so it's easy to take anywhere.The only thing is it is a bit heavy...or maybe that's just me.The plug is also short not the normal length which is annoying.

Reviews.Title: Terrific little camera
Reviews.Author: DocG
Reviews.Content: The zs20 has lived up to my expectations in nearly every way.  The only complaint I have, as have others for years, is Panasonic's tendency to create yellow-brown interior images.  I'd love to believe an update would fix this, but I doubt it either can or will be done.  Other than that the camera is fun and the images excellent.  And it's amazingly small size, compared to the Sony, make it easy to transport.  Very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Ken Hudson
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black) is a very good camera and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera until it broke ...
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I give this a 1 start because the camera broke after 1.5 years of light use.  Before the camera broke it was great.

Reviews.Title: Video is not Mac compatible!!
Reviews.Author: aklyric
Reviews.Content: VIDEO IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MAC LAPTOP!!!!  I was soooo disappointed to find out that I could neither import or play the video on my Macbook Pro.  Also Iphoto will not warn you that it is failing to import.  So what do I do, buy a new laptop or pay for a camera that will work with what I have.  Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Not dependable
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: This camera started out good, then about 8 months  after using to shoot the interior of homes for real estate sales, the auto focus setting stopped working. While shooting dimly lit rooms, the camera would change to "burst mode".  No flash.  This only happened after about 20 shots or so.  I sent it back while under warranty with square trade.  It was returned once with a note: working properly"  I sent it back a second time with a better explanation.  Square Trade agreed it was defective and send a refund.

Reviews.Title: May have gotten a bad camera...
Reviews.Author: One Small Voice
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas from my husband. In most of the several dozen pictures we took there was a faint shadow in the bottom corner of the pictures (slight but undeniably noticeable). It appears that this is either a design flaw or this particular camera was a lemon. It's a somewhat bulky camera in contrast to my older, much more compact Canon Elph I purchased in 2009. Also, unlike that camera, the screen resolution was surprisingly poor. An hour glass even popped up while it delayed processing, which reminded me of the digital camera I bought 8 years ago. I think technology should keep improving in all aspects of the camera, so it felt like a regression using this. Overall, a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Graet camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: R. A. Hendi
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. My last three cameras have been this model. I love the one hand operation capabilities, which allows me to enjoy an icecream while I'm taking an interesting shot.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Julie Gurganus
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago. It was my 2nd Linux. My first I had for about 4 years. I loved it but one day I noticed spots in my photo's. Tried cleaning the lens but the spots were inside the camera. I thought maybe I damaged it and since I had had it for awhile I decided to just replace it with a newer Lumix. Less then a year after I bought this camera I noticed a spot. Since I just got the camera I checked into my warranty but they wouldn't help me and to clean it would cost more then buying a new camera. Very disappointed. I love this camera but can't afford to buy a new one every year. Looking into Canon

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, bad battery
Reviews.Author: pototo
Reviews.Content: Good:Excellent zoom, Amazing HD video, multiple types of scene.Bad:Battery runs out too fast. Bad GPS receiver...Recommendation:buy another extra battery

Reviews.Title: Wish there was a 10 star rating!!!
Reviews.Author: LittleHobbit
Reviews.Content: By far the most amazing camera i have ever purchased! I havent found a single thing that did not meet and exceed my expectations! Amazing zoom, picture quality, hd video....all over incredible camera!

Reviews.Title: Keep your old camera
Reviews.Author: D. NEVIN ""Doc""
Reviews.Content: I purchased this just over a week ago.  I had read a lot of reveiws from independent firms and on Amazon and had a bit of conern but, I own 2 other Panasonic Mega Zoom cameras and both take excellent pictures( DMC FZ40 and DMC  F27 ).  I wanted something that had a good zoom but, more pocket size.The bottom line is that I've taken several pictures in natural ligth and with the flash, indoor, outdoor, cloudy, sunny etc. on the IA setting and the pictues are just horrible.  There is no other way to put it.  I tried a different memory card just to see if that might be an issue but, it is the camera.  I can not recommend this to any one for any reason and sadly, my confidence in Panasonic has now been seriously degraded.

Reviews.Title: Not too impressive
Reviews.Author: CACNYC "CACNYC"
Reviews.Content: Overall this unit has a slightly cheap feel to it. The panels give and creak. The lens housing feels very delicate. The operation of this camera, with the touch screen active, is a bit on the fussy side. It lacks the more intuitive layout of Canon or the more useful setup of Nikon, speaking generally. So far I've only been able to test the camera on a limited basis since the battery was not charged enough for testing out of the box (not a complaint). However, the few pictures that I did manage to take did not seem of any better quality overall than my 6 year old Canon Elph SD750. Also when compared to my other point N shoot, a PowerShot ELPH 100 HS, the image quality was notably lacking on the Lumix. I'll have to wait to make any really informed comparisons because the Lumix is now charging.At this point I'm willing to say that the Lumix has an impressive array of bells and whistles. It does also have a decent array of scene choices and photo capture settings. Time will tell whether the cheap feel of the body and buttons are actually a point of concern or just something to get used to. However, at this price point everything should feel tight and of quality on the unit. I will continue to test and familiarize myself with the Lumix to find out whether it is a matter of a slightly higher user learning curve required to take good photos with the Lumix or whether the photos from this camera will always come out a little grainy / soft and slightly off colorwise.*****Update*****I have tested the Lumix ZS20 now for almost two months and I find that my former observation that the overall feel of the camera being on the cheap side remains intact. However, in fairness, while the buttons still rattle and the panels do flex, there has been no worsening of the situation. So I guess it is a matter of getting used to the flimsy feel with the understanding that it won't worsen, at least so far.As for the grainy / noisey look of the images, that still remains an issue. Outside daylight shots are very impressive at any focal length, but once you begin to zoom into the final image product on your computer you see that enlargements are going to be grainy/soft or fuzzy. The lack of definition when enlarged is very disappointing. Images taken in dark or night at any resolution or focal length are plagued with noise / grain. This remains a problem and I don't foresee a resolution. You will also note a distinct lack of difintion if you take a photo of a woven fabric or grass, for example. The camera has a tendency to render these textures flat or fuzzy when set to "iA mode". You can work around this a bit with the manual mode, but the results aren't too much better. It's a shame.One other very disappointing problem that may not matter to many, is a washout effect while trying to take photos against a bright sky backdrop. When you try to take a photo of a bird in flight or an airplane, the camera sensor seems to get overwhelmed by the brightness of the sky and you get a white image.  If the subject is at an angle or the sky isn't too bright you may get the shot, but it still will be somewhat "whited out". This problem occurs using the "iA mode" and the "Program mode". If you tweak and play with the settings on manual you can work around the problem a little, but that is assuming you have time to do that while you are trying to photograph something in flight!Overall, this camera works well as a simple point N shoot under non-demanding situations. It is at its best when taking photos with good, evenly distributed, daylight and in controlled compositions.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera (not excellent), a few key quirks
Reviews.Author: kharris2828
Reviews.Content: Took it to a New Year's celebration, as I got it for Christmas for myself.Pros:- Fairly easy to use- Compact- Seems to take good pixCons:- Long lag between pix, which I thought I'd read it DIDN'T have - was one of my key criterium- Burned through batteries after about 20 pix, so our final New Years pic had to be taken with someone's iPhone :(UPDATE: Charged the battery overnight - when it arrived the battery was not charged. My mistake. Battery fully charged and ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures/Video But Susceptible to Dust Inside Lens
Reviews.Author: K. Harper
Reviews.Content: I just finished packaging up the camera to send it back to Panasonic for warranty work.  I read some other reviews stating this camera was susceptible to getting dust inside the lens but I disregarded them.  I wish I hadn't.I now have some dirt inside my lens that shows up as a dark oval shaped distortion in the lower LH corner of the view finder as well as in all the pictures.  Apparently dirt can get inside the lens if you use the zoom frequently.  Anyway, I guess I will get to post a review of the warranty service too later on.When it was clean it took good pictures and excellent video but it's useless to me now.EDIT:The camera was received at the Panasonic facility on 6/14/2013.  I did not receive the camera back until 7/10/2013.  The warranty claim process was slow and the communication to me throughout the process was non-existent.Any to the commenter:  Yes I give the camera 1 star now.  It's useless if it will get dirt in the lens with just mild easy use.  Coincidentally, just today my neighbor asked me to take a picture of her and her son on their bikes and it was almost the same camera that she had me use.  Same basic design but an older model with 16x zoom.  That one had tons of crap inside the lens or on the sensor too...it was horrible.  I will surely never buy a Panasonic camera again knowing that they have this design defect and it has not been fixed even though the older models were this way too.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the cable
Reviews.Author: BarnacleKen
Reviews.Content: It's probably a nice camera but I misplaced the USB charging/data cable because I thought I had a dozen just like it.  Well, it seems that their's looks like an industry standard micro USB plug but it's proprietory and can't be bought locally. No problem, I ordered a proprietory replacement from Amazon but that didn't fit either.  It seems that Panasonic thinks that it's big enough to ignore all industry standards with each new camera.  Sooner or later I'll locate the proper proprietory cable for this camera and start taking pictures.This may or may not affect your purchasing decision.  I like to keep things simple so it would have affected mine.

Reviews.Title: A lot of issues with the LCD
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Martin
Reviews.Content: I tried multiple cameras and had nothing but issues with the LCD being laggy. I spoke with Amazon support and they suggested I contact the manufacturer but out of a brand new camera I shouldn't have to contact them. All of the firmware was up to date and nobody else was having problems with the LCD so it's possible the two cameras I got were duds but it wasn't worth the risk as a Christmas present.Panasonic makes fantastic products, almost anything I can buy by them I do but this was such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: The camera stopped working after 6 months: zoom barrel stuck
Reviews.Author: HHughes
Reviews.Content: After 6 months of very gentle use, one day, out of the blue, the zoom barrel is stuck and the camera is not working (simple interventions, like turning on/off, taking out the battery, did not help). I looked this problem up on Panasonic FAQ page, and quite a few people have this problem.My camera is less than a year old, so it is still under warranty, and they will most likely replace or repair it. But I can't give a (rather expensive) product more than two stars if so many people are having so many issues with it!

Reviews.Title: I wouldnt buy this again
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM KALLBERG
Reviews.Content: When I loaded the pc with the programs from this camera it messed up the pc. I may have to reload my pc because of this.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Camera
Reviews.Author: Beverly Zorn
Reviews.Content: I love my camera even though it is quickly outdated.  I'll still use it quite often.  It "fits" my age group--retired.

Reviews.Title: Works well in auto-mode but not intuitive
Reviews.Author: Bob Friesenhahn
Reviews.Content: This camera produces very good pictures in automatic mode but I find that its menu system is not intuitive and is complicated.The bundled software is rather poor and seems like some sort of share-ware which was re-branded by Panasonic.  The Windows application for loading maps onto the phone never worked for me.

Reviews.Title: I will use this exclusively while traveling.  The photos are of excellent quality.
Reviews.Author: Barbara I. Williams
Reviews.Content: My daughter owns this camera and it was a recommendation from a grandson who is a professional photographer.  I don't know how long it will take to learn all the ins aND OUTS OF USSING IT EFFICENTILY.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: TERESA J. BRINSON
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I took it to the Indianapolis 500 and got some great shots and video from the race. My previous camera couldn't deliver like this one can. A lot of bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price
Reviews.Author: oortcloud
Reviews.Content: And by that I mean the price I paid for it 4 months ago. I bought this can fron the famous New York store for $270. And they still sell it for $299. It might have grown in popularity or something...I'd never paid $400 for it though. It's beyond ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: Compared to TZ4
Reviews.Author: Jennifer N. Takato "Hapa_Kepani"
Reviews.Content: i had a TZ4 and loved it. i think this one is a little harder to figure out...i've had it since may and still have some issues. the TZ4 model was just a lot easier. that being said, i give it a 4 cause there isn't any real issues but the ease of it. i do like that it has the panorama built in. :) i'll try to add more as i play with it more.My issues: - not as easy as the TZ4 model...this is it's upgrade - the video is hard to get used to...it has a button that you use instead of a mode on the dial. again this is a personal thing and not so much a defect in the product make. - it does have a cool GPS function added so you can tell where your photos were from! - 3D is interesting, not sure how 3D it is...

Reviews.Title: Very similar to my last Lumix
Reviews.Author: Ralph Passino
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Lumix camera with a 10X zoom (dropped it). Previous version was a bit bigger and heavier than this one.  The zoom seems fine on this ZS20 camera.  I would rather it were smaller and lighter - I looked at the Cannon comparable camera (less zoom, but smaller and lighter AND more expensive) and opted for the Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Delivery
Reviews.Author: T. Williams
Reviews.Content: The packaged was delivered on time on the day they said it would arrive....Very happy about that.I wish i could have ordered the 32 GB camera card from you also.....I have the camera but not the card...so basically I can take one Picture.....I love Amazon's service.....i have ordered items before and always works out.....Nothing but praise for Amazon's efficiency can't say the same about ordering items from other stores on Amazon.Ted

Reviews.Title: Really Wanted to Like This Camera... But It's Junk
Reviews.Author: MFA
Reviews.Content: Picked this camera up from a Black Friday deal and really wanted to like it. I put it through it's paces and alas, it's junk. I took over 100 pictures indoors using all settings, all zooms, flash and no flash, and every single one is bad. Whitewashed faces, obnoxious shadows from the flash, yellow flesh tones, and blurred pictures. I didn't try it outdoors, but what's the point - I need a good all-arounder. This one was returned, tried a Nikon P300 which was even worse (see my 'horrible' review on that one), moving on to a Canon SX60 with fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this product
Reviews.Author: Anthony Strong
Reviews.Content: I've purchased two of these cameras in the last year and I've had the same problem with both of them.  1) the zoom lens is very sensitive, if you get any dust or dirt in the lens area the zoom locks up.  2)  the input for the charger is very sensitive and the metal prongs get bent very easily and then you will not be able to charge the camera or connect the camera to a PC.  I bought two of these cameras as I thought it was just myself having user error which caused the problems, this is not true, after I bought the second one I was super careful to handle the camera with extra care and I ran into the same problems again.  I called customer service then they we unhelpful which is why I'm now turning to this customer review.  I at least hope to help others in making a better decision.

Reviews.Title: Quality issues
Reviews.Author: AS
Reviews.Content: I bought the ZS20 in Austraia in september 2012. In august 2013 the lense was full of particles. Under the world-wide warranty the camera was sent back to Australia and came back, repaired, after 6 weeks. In december the battery signalled problems. Messages: "this(Lumix) battery cannot be used", the camera off but zoom out, the camera on but black screen. Warranty was expired. I go to the service center, and leave it for testing, then go to the service center and make a downpayment of 30USD, and after 24 hours more, the camera was repaired for a total of 62USD. It worked, but a lot of going forth and back. To have to go to the center for a downpayment is preposterous. As for the camera, compared to the ZS3 that I owned in 2009: the picture quality is not better, the metallic finishing is chipping of everywhere, as before, the dust into the camera is exactly the same problem. The GPS is fine if you take a picture and you do not know where you are.I did not find any p ractical use for the touchscreen. Overall, a good camera, but not good enough for outdoors-in-the-field, as the workmanship is not up to it.

Reviews.Title: Perfectly Nice, Just Not For Me
Reviews.Author: A. Ansley
Reviews.Content: My quick back-story.  I am a smartphone attic and typically have the most up-to-date gadget phone.  When I got the iPhone 4S last year, I was thrilled with it, especially the camera.  Why would I ever need a regular camera!?  Its pictures are gorgeous!  I took it to Europe last Christmas and it was my dedicated camera.  Really useful!  How were the pictures?  Really awful!  If it was bright outside, the iPhone did great.  If it was dreary, and in London & Hamburg it certainly was, the pictures were grainy, soft, and any movement completely ruined the photo.  I still kick myself for not taking a better camera.  A lot of really great moments were lost.Enter in the Lumix ZS20.  Portability is a must and low-light performance is a must.  Those are my 2 things.  This camera certainly does better in low-light, much better than a phone.  The zoom is fantastic.  The touch-to-focus is really nice & fast.  I really had no complaints about it.  But if I'm going to carry around a dedicated camera, it sure better be a step-up from my phone, right?  I recently got the Galaxy S3 and pitted it against my old iPhone 4S.  It was roughly the same, picture quality wise.  When the Lumix ZS20 arrived, I took it out after a few days and compared it against my wonderful new point & shoot.  How did it do?  The pictures were beautiful!  Much more saturated than the pictures coming out of my smartphone.  The colors really popped.  However, and especially at 100% crop, I realized they were really no better than the Galaxy camera.  I was kind of flummoxed.  Have phones really come that far?  If I turned up the saturation/color on the phone, the pictures would be nearly identical.I was lost.  After *a lot* more research, I decided to step it up to something a little less pocketable, but something that would offer better quality pictures.  I went with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-GF3 12 MP Micro 4/3 Compact System Camera with 3-Inch Touchscreen LCD and 14-42mm Zoom Lens (Black), of the mirrorless variety.  I just got back from a weekend in NYC and snapped over 500 pictures with the GF3.  It looks like it's here to stay.  Beautiful pictures that have really great detail.  Easily a few steps above the ZS20 and my myriad of smart phones.I have no major complaints with the ZS20, but look out point & shoots, with the quality cameras coming in smart phones now, I think your time on this Earth might be coming to a close.

Reviews.Title: Nice compact that delivers great pictures
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on some hiking trips through our Natioanl Parks.Great weight and size for on the trail.Takes great pictures.The only draw backs are:1. I wish it had a view finder - not sure I like using the screen.2. Invest in an additional battery and external charger - minor investment - great help.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price but sacrifices have been made over previous ZS/TZ models.
Reviews.Author: J. M. CAULFIELD "John Shaka"
Reviews.Content: So far, important to consider for all potential buyers;The corners stretch out the pictures artificially which is awful and the menu options have changed for the worse, over simplistic and not user friendly.GPS is slow, often not ready even when left on and unused for some time, when already in a new area so quick response for shots are not possible to have correct location data sometimes.The scene options also are lacking - not concise.

Reviews.Title: nothing like the older version
Reviews.Author: G C
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to replace a TZ5 (most excellent camera) that I lost while hiking.  This camera is nothing like the earlier model in terms of quality.  It does not focus very well at all, and i have missed many great shots due to that.  I miss my TZ5!

Reviews.Title: panasonic lumix zs20 digtal camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrtey Ankiel
Reviews.Content: the camera is great takes great picture with very good resolution,it was a very purchase it is really worth the money

Reviews.Title: This is a FANTASTIC Camera
Reviews.Author: Sylvia F. Ayala
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an picture heavy trip to Panama.  It was amazing!!!  The zoom is phenominal & the photo quality is outstanding.  Easy to use, large view finder makes it fun to review & edit pictures one stop.

Reviews.Title: A very good Camera
Reviews.Author: Jambuu
Reviews.Content: Panasonic has really kept in mind the users perspective while designing this camere.Right from the design of it to the use of it.The Leica lens is really good and the picture does not have a tint of Red which i had seen in other camera.The processing time to review the photo is also fast.Tried the Panorama mode and the results are really good only we need to get used to it.Continous shoot option,the picture comes out pretty good and overall was very satisfied with this product purchased from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I Have Treated This Camera With Kid Gloves
Reviews.Author: IMA
Reviews.Content: I wanted this camera so that I could always have quality pictures. A friend of mine has the same one, and last week the zoom quit. This week mine quit. Unfortunately, I purchased extra batteries, a charger, so hope I can find another brand that uses the same battery. Very disappointed and would not advise anyone to purchase it. I could understand if it was mishandled at any time or dropped, but it appears to me that it's just poorly made. It does take very nice pictures, but what good is that if it doesn't last.

Reviews.Title: Outrageous design flaws
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: So far, a very good camera with lots of features at a great price. BUT! There are two flagrant design flaws.1) Look at the photo of the camera. The lens barrel is placed essentially flush with the side of the camera, which makes it nearly impossible to get any grip with one's finger on the front of the camera, something necessary both to hold it steady and to prevent it slipping and falling. My previous Lumix wasn't built this way.2) The battery charger. It consists of an AC adapter that MUST be connected to the camera via a USB cable. And not just any USB cable, according to Panasonic, but only the one provided. This has multiple disadvantages. First, it becomes impossible to use the camera while it is charging (switch one battery for another). Second, the cable is short, so you either have to be lucky and have a table or something near an outlet on which to lie the camera or you have to put it on the floor and hope nobody steps on it. Third, woe! to you if you lose the cable or even forget to take it with you wherever you go.Who dreamed up this idiocy? The previous Lumix had a small AC adapter that was self-contained with a compartment for the battery being charged. It also had prongs that neatly folded away when not in use. Why not have left well enough alone?

Reviews.Title: Camera To slow,sometimes will not switch off.
Reviews.Author: phillip stumbo
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures but there are more issues other than that. When I try to switch from camera to the view the picture there is a 1-2 minute wait. then when I want to go back to picture taking mode another 2 minute wait. I miss a lot that way.That is to long to wait for it to switch. The GPS is very hard to get calabrated, hard to findsatelites. The date stamping is very slow. I was in Israel and took around 50 pictures one day, I wanted to date stamp them so I set it up to do that. Date stamping takes a long time for that many pictures, so I just got it started and went to bed leftit plugged in to the outlet so so all night it worked and by morning it was still not finished and I had o turn it off because I needed the camera for that day. I lost about 50% of my pictures. After that as I resumed the use of the camera the problem started with it locking and as described earlier it was very slow in switching from picture to camera mode. I sent it back to MC Allen Tx for repair it was under warranty and they told me nothing was wrong with it. it came back to me and I continued the use of it and it got worse. I decided to just pay for the repair if they would fix it. I sent it back to them, they wante dmy CC and told me it would cost 178.00 to fix. I agreed to do it. 2 weeks later I called and they, they told me that still there is nothing wrong with it but they would have to charge me to inspect it. I paid 250.00 for the camera and they after two tried they are charging me to look at again and tell me that there is nothing wrong with it. I will have to buy another camera but it will not be a Panasonic. I will say it takes superb pictures and vedio. They told me that they might not charge me the total of 178.00 I will wait and see. I am totaly disgusted at Panasonic. more problems I forgot is sometimes it will not switch off I have to take the batteries out to get it to go off.

Reviews.Title: Quite slow so no good pictures; not good colors
Reviews.Author: Demi007
